content:
にらむ〔睨む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=睥睨する)to glare at (one); to stare at (one); to glower at (one); to look daggers at (one)

content.content: あの人は酔うと凄い目で人をにらむ
When he is drunk, he will glare at you with wild eyes.
あの男にしゃれでも言おうものならにらまれる
If you crack a joke, he will stare at you.
彼女のことをすっぱぬいてやったらさも恨めしそうに僕をにらんで出て行った
I exposed her in company, and she left the room looking daggers at me.
彼ははったと一座をにらんだ
He withered the company with a look.
彼は彼女ににらまれて縮み上がった
He quailed beneath her glance.

content: 2. (=目を付ける)to have an eye on (a man); to spot (one as the culprit, etc.)

content.content: 警察ではあの男をにらんでいる
The police have an eye on that man.
彼は官憲ににらまれている
He has fallen under the eyes of the authorities.
あれはこの目でにらんでおいた
I have an eye on him.
刑事は彼を犯人とにらんだ
The police-detective spotted him as the culprit.
匿名投書家は君とにらんだがひが目か
Am I wrong in spotting you as the author of the anonymous correspondence?
僕はあの西洋人を米探とにらんでいる
I have set him down as a spy.
彼はこうとにらんだらはずっれこはない
His judgment never errs.

content: 3. (=恨む)to be displeased ［angry, offended］with (a man)

content.content: あの男ににらまれたら最後だ
It is all up with you if you incur his displeasure.
いったん彼ににらまれようものなら居たたまらないようにされる
Once you give him offence, he will make it hot for you.
僕はあの先生ににらまれているから何も言えない
I can not speak to him, for he has a down upon one.

にりつはいはん〔二律背反〕
〈名〉Antinomy

content:
にりゅう〔二流〕
〈形〉Second-rate; of the second order; middling

content.content: たかが二流の学者だ
He is, at best, but a second-rate scholar.
あれはまあ天才でも二流だね
He is a genius of the second order, I should say.

にりんざき〔二輪咲き〕
〈名〉A double flower

にりんしゃ〔二輪車〕
〈名〉A two-wheeled vehicle; a two-wheeler

content:
にる〔似る〕
〈自他動〉
1. To resemble (the other in some point); to bear a resemblance to (anything); to agree (in some point); to favour (one's father); to take after (one's mother); to be like (something); to be alike; to be similar to (anything); to have (something) in common with (each other)

content.content: 彼は性質は父に似ている
He resembles his father in disposition.
彼の顔は猿に似ている
His face resembles a monkey's―His face is like a monkey's.
New Zealand は多少日本に似ている
New Zealand bears some resemblance to Japan.
二人はよく似ている
They are very much alike.
著しく似ている
They bear a striking resemblance to each other.
日本は英国に似たところがある
Japan has something in common with England.
大いに似たところがある
They have much in common with each other.
兄弟でも少しも似たところが無い
Though brothers, they have nothing in common with each other.
彼の顔は親父に似ている
He favours his father.
親父よりも母に似ている
He takes after his mother more than his father.
親父に似てばくちが好きだ
He has inherited his father's passion for gambling.
二人は瓜二つに割ったほど似ている
They are as like as two peas.
二人は似ても似つかぬ
They are as like as chalk and cheese.
二人は容貌は似ているが性質は似ておらぬ
They agree in appearance, but differ in disposition.
目付きが似ている
They have the same eyes.
それに似た例がある
There is a similar instance.
子は親に似る
“Like begets like.”
親父によく似た子だ
He is a chip of the old block.
似た者夫婦
Like husband, like wife―As is the husband, so is the wife.
兄弟だけに皆似ている
A family likeness runs through them all.
二人は従兄弟だけにどこか似ている
They are not cousins for nothing.
この両国の似たところを比較してみると面白い
It is interesting to draw a parallel between the two countries.
二人の生涯の相似たところが見える
I can perceive a resemblance between the two lives―trace a parallel between the two lives.
似て非なるもの
a counterfeit
似て非なる事
false analogy
似て非なる詩人
a false poet
似て非なる説
a sophism
非に似て是なる説
a paradox

content:
にる〔煮る〕
〈他動〉To boil; to cook; to do (meat, etc.)

content.content: 蟹や海老は煮ると赤くなる
Crabs and prawns turn red when they are boiled.
煮て食う
to eat anything boiled
この魚は煮たのが好い
I like this fish boiled.
グダグダに煮る
to boil anything to a pulp
卵を固く煮る
to boil eggs hard
固く煮た卵
hard-boiled eggs
この野菜はよく煮なければならぬ
This vegetable needs thorough cooking―This vegetable must be thoroughly cooked―well done.
魚は煮るばかりにこしらえてある
The fish is ready for the pot.
自分のものは煮て食おうと焼いて食おうと勝手だ
One may do what one likes with one's own.
あれは煮ても焼いても食えない奴だ
He is too old a bird to be caught with chaff.

content:
にれつ〔二列〕
〈名〉Two rows; a double line; a double file

content.content: 二列縦隊
a double file
二列横隊
a double line
二列に並ぶ
to form two rows
二列にする
to arrange in two rows
二列になって進む
to march by two and two―march two abreast

content:
にれんしき〔二連式〕
〈形〉Duplex

content.content: 二連式機関
a duplex engine

にれんじゅう〔二連銃〕
〈名〉A double-barrelled gun

にろくじちゅう〔二六時中〕
〈副〉Right round the clock

content:
にわ〔庭〕
〈名〉
1. (=庭園)a garden

content.content: 家にはおのおの庭がある
Each house has a garden to it.
家は好い家だが庭というほどの庭が無い
The house is a good one, but there is no garden to speak of―no garden worth mentioning.
庭を作る
to lay out a garden
庭作り
gardening
庭の手入れをする
to trim a garden―keep a garden
庭の手入れが行き届いている、手入れが行届かぬ
The garden is well kept―The garden is ill kept.
庭に木を植える
to plant a garden with shrubs
庭木
a garden-shrub
庭石
a garden-stone
庭の植え込み
a shrubbery
庭の築山
a rockery
庭師
a gardener

content:
2. (=中庭)a yard; a courtyard
3. (=家庭)the household; home

content.content: 庭の訓え
home education

content: 4. (=場所)a place

content.content: 学びの庭、教えの庭
a school
軍の庭
the seat or of war―the theatre of war―a battlefield

content:
にわか〔俄〕
〈形〉
1. (=不意の)sudden (departure); unexpected, unlooked-for (occurrence):(=に) suddenly; on a sudden; all of a sudden; all at once; at short notice; unexpectedly

content.content: にわかに聞こゆる人馬の足音
All at once there were heard the tramps of a multitude―A sound of multitudinous feet burst on our ears.
一天にわかに掻き曇る
The whole sky suddenly became covered with clouds.
にわかにさし支えが起こって出席致しかねます
I can not attend owing to a sudden engagement.
にわかに駆け出す
to break into a run―burst into a gallop
にわかに現れる
to burst on the scene
岬をまわるとにわかに壮観が現れた
When we doubled the cape, a magnificent sight burst on the view.
にわかに大便を催す
to be taken short
にわか雨
a shower
にわか分限
an upstart―a parvenu
にわか景気
a boom
にわか仕込み
cramming
試験の用意ににわか仕込みする
to cram for an examination

content: 2. (=前もって用意なき)improvised (drama); impromptu (play); extemporary, extemporaneous (speech, etc.):(=に) impromptu; extempore

content.content: にわか狂言
an improvised drama―an impromptu play
にわか学校
an extemporaneous school―an extemporary school

にわか〔仁和賀〕
〈名〉An impromptu theatrical performance; an extravaganza; a farce

content:
にわかあめ〔俄雨〕
〈名〉A shower; a cloud-burst

content.content: にわか雨に逢う
to be caught in a shower

にわかげいき〔俄景気〕
〈名〉A boom

content:
にわかじこみ〔俄仕込み〕
〈名〉Cramming:(=する) to cram (for an examination); to cram up, get up (a subject for an examination)

content.content: 試験の用意ににわか仕込みする
to cram for an examination
試験の用意に地理歴史などをにわか仕込みする
to cram up history for an examination―get up geography for an examination

にわかぶんげん〔俄分限〕
〈名〉An upstart; a parvenu; a nouveau riche

にわし〔庭師〕
〈名〉A gardener; a landscape-gardener

にわたし〔荷渡し〕
〈名〉Delivery of goods:(=する) to deliver goods

にわつくり〔庭作り〕
〈名〉Gardening; landscape-gardening

にわとこ〔接骨木〕
〈名〉The elder-tree

content:
にわとり〔鶏〕
〈名〉The domestic fowl; the barn-door fowl:(雄鶏) a cock:(雌鶏) a hen

content.content: 鶏が時をつくる
A cock crows.
鶏が卵を生む
A hen lays eggs.
鶏が巣につく
A hen sits―A hen broods.
鶏を飼う
to keep fowls
鶏を割くに牛刀を用いる
to employ a cleaver to cut up a fowl―“employ a steam-hammer to crack a nut”―“break a butterfly upon the wheel”

content:
にん〔人〕
〈名〉A man; a person; so many (persons)

content.content: あの人は子どもが十人ある
He has ten children.
千人も弟子を持っている
He has as many as a thousand pupils.
十人十色
So many men, so many minds―No two men are alike.
人を見て法を説く
Suit your style to your audience―Adapt yourself to the intelligence of your audience―“Be all things to all men.”

content:
にん〔任〕
〈名〉An office; a post; a duty; a charge; a trust; a task; a burden

content.content: 人に任を負わせる
to charge one with a duty
彼は重い任を負っている
He is charged with an important duty.
青年教育の任を負っている
He is charged with the education of youth.
任に当たる
to charge oneself with a duty―take a trust on oneself
僕は向こう見ずにこの大任に当たったのだ
I took the trust on myself head over heels.
遺族に悲報を伝える任に当たった
I took it upon myself to break the sad news to the family.
任を果たす
to perform one's office―discharge one's duty―discharge one's trust―acquit oneself (of one's charge)
彼は立派に任を果たした、あっぱれ任を果たした
He has acquitted himself to his credit.
あっぱれ講和大使の任を果たした
He has acquitted himself as peace envoy to his credit.
忠実に任を守る
to be true to one's trust
任を守って番兵が撃たれて死んでをった
True to his trust, the sentry lay shot dead.
任に適する
to be fit for the post
誰か任に適する人は無いか
Can't you think of any one fit for the post?
彼ならば最も任に適している(適所適材)
He is the right man in the right place.
彼は任に適さぬ
He is unfit for the post―a square peg in a round hole.
彼は学校管理の任に適している
He is fit to manage a school.
任に堪える
to be equal to the task―competent to the task―capable of filling the post
彼は任に堪えない
He is unequal to the task―sinking under his burden.
僕は任に堪えないからご免をこうむりたい
I am unequal to the task, so I must excuse myself from it.
任に赴く
to proceed to one's post―leave for one's new post
任に就く
to assume one's office―take office―enter upon one's office―be installed in one's office―be inducted to one's office―be inaugurated―take up one's post
彼は校長の任に就いた
He assumed his office as principal―took up his duties as principal.
彼は顧問官の任に在り
He holds the office of adviser―occupies the post of adviser.
任を辞す
to resign one's office―resign one's post

content:
にんい〔任意〕
〈名〉Option; pleasure; discretion; voluntariness:(=の) optional; discretionary; voluntary; free; any (one likes):(=に) at one's option; at one's pleasure; as one pleases; at one's discretion; as one thinks fit; ad libitum

content.content: 仏語独語いずれを選ぶも学生の任意たるべし
It is at the option of the student―It is left to the option of the student―to take either French or German.
去るも留るも任意です
You may go or stay at your pleasure―as you please.
各自任意の処置をなすべし
Each may act at his discretion―do as he thinks fit.
而して汝の入牢の期限は王の任意たるべし
And there you shall remain during the King's pleasure.
任意選択
optional choice―free choice
任意法
voluntary law
任意の点
any point
任意の場所
any place
任意の時
any time

content:
にんか〔認可〕
〈名〉Authorization; sanction; recognition; approval; approbation:(=する) to authorize (a text-book); to sanction (a measure); to recognize (a school); to approve (a bill):(米国にては) to approbate (a bill)

content.content: 政府の認可を得る
to obtain the sanction of the government―be sanctioned by the government
学校は文部省の認可を得た
The school has been authorized by the Department of Education―recognized by the Educational Department.
認可学校
an authorized school―a recognized school
その筋の認可を得てしたことだ
The matter was approved by the authorities―The thing was done with the approval of the authorities.

content:
にんがい〔人外〕
〈名〉
1. (=非人)a beggar; an outcast; a pariah
2. (=人非人)a monster (of depravity); a brute (in human shape)
〈形〉(=非道)inhuman

content.content: これは人外の沙汰だ
This is an outrage on humanity.

content:
にんかん〔任官〕
〈名〉Appointment; investiture:(=する) to be appointed (governor―to the post of governor); to be gazetted (to a post―as something); to be invested with an office

content.content: 彼は海上領事に任官した
He has been appointed (to the post of) consul at Shanghai―gazetted as consul at Shanghai.
任官式
installation
任官の挨拶
an inaugural address

content:
にんき〔人気〕
〈名〉
1. (=人民の気性)the temper of the people

content.content: 人気の好い処だ、人気の悪い処だ
It is a good place―a bad place.
船着きは人気が荒い
The people of a seaport town are excitable―restless―feverish―lively.
小樽は人気の荒い処だ
Otaru is a lively town.

content: 2. (=景気)the times; the tone of the market; the popular feeling (towards something); sensation; sentiment

content.content: 世間の人気はどうか
How are the times?
世間の人気は好い、人気は悪い
The times are good―The times are bad.
市場の人気はどうか
How is the tone of the market?
人気は好い方だ
The market is looking up.
人気は悪い方だ
The market is looking down.
人気が好くなった
The tone of the market has improved.
人気が悪くなった
The tone of the market has declined.
この事業の人気はどうか
How is the popular feeling towards this enterprise?
一般の人気は好い方だ
The general sentiment is in its favour.
一般の人気は悪い方だ
The general sentiment is against it.
Washington 会議で世界の人気が立った
The Washington conference has created a sensation throughout the world.
彼は倒るところで人気を立てる
He creates a sensation―creates a furore―wherever he goes.
人気を見る
to fly a kite

content: 3. (=人望)popularity; popular favour; sensation

content.content: あの役者は人気がある
That actor is popular―in favour with the public―a favourite (with the public).
たいそう人気がある
He is very popular―He enjoys great popularity.
人気役者
a popular actor―a favourite actor―a stage favourite
この新聞は学生間に人気がある
The paper is popular with students―in favour with students―a favourite with students.
新女優は非常な人気だ
The new actress has taken the city by storm.
彼は人気が上がった
He has risen in popularity―gained in public favour―risen into favour.
人気が落ちた
He has fallen in popularity―fallen in popular favour―fallen into disfavour.
人気を取る
to win popularity―(人気を取ろうとする)―bid for popular favour―court popularity―(芸人なら)―strive for applause―strive for effect
各政党はうまいことを言って人気を取ろうとする
The political parties bid for popular favour by making fair promises.
彼は人気を取った
He has won popularity―got into favour.
どうして人気を取ったか
How did he get into favour?
ご馳走政略で人気を取った
He has fed himself into favour.
うまいことを言って人気を取った
He has talked himself into favour.
大向こうの人気を取る
to play to the gallery
彼はどうかこうか人気を維持している
He manages to keep in favour―keep his popularity.
病気して休むと人気に障る
Illness and absence will affect your popularity.
人気がつく、人気が集まる
to become popular―become known
私立学校は年数を経なければ人気が集まるものでない
It takes years for a private school to become known.
人気に投ずる
to hit with the popular wishes―catch popularity―catch on―take
人気に投ずる策だ
The scheme hits with the popular humour.
今度の芝居は人気に投じた
The new play has hit the taste of the public―The new play has caught on―The new play has taken.
この小説は人気に投じた
The novel has caught on―The novel has taken.
計略が人気に投じた
The stratagem took.
この小説は人気はどうですか
How does the new novel take?
どんな話が学生に人気がある
What sort of topics takes with students?
人気のある問題
a taking topic
あの男は人気商売だ
He deals in sensation.
人気小説
a sensational novel

content:
にんき〔任期〕
〈名〉One's term of office; one's tenure of office

content.content: 大統領の任期は四年
The president's term of office is four years.
任期が満つる
One's term of office expires―One's term runs out.
任期満了
expiration of one's term of office
任期満ちて再選になった
At the expiration of his term of office,―On the completion of his tenure of office,―he was re-elected.
大統領は任期中に死んだ
The president died during his term of office.
議員の任期は何年か
What is the term of membership?―the tenure of an M. P.?

content:
にんきとり〔人気取り〕
〈名〉Bidding for popular favour; a claptrap

content.content: 人気取りをする
to bid for popular favour―court popularity―(芸人なら)―strive for applause―strive for effect
各政党はうまいことを言って人気取りをする
The political parties bid for popular favour―outbid each other for popularity―by making fair promises.
これは人気取り策だ
The scheme is a claptrap―It is a claptrap scheme.
人気取り小説
a sensational novel
人気取りの見世物
a pyrotechnical display

にんきもの〔人気者〕
〈名〉A popular favourite; a popular hero; the idol of the people; a lion

content:
にんきょ〔認許〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: にんか〔認可〕

にんぎょ〔人魚〕
〈名〉A mermaid(は女):(男ならば) a merman

にんきょう〔任侠〕
〈名〉A chivalrous spirit; chivalry

content:
にんぎょう〔人形〕
〈名〉A doll:(操り人形) a puppet

content.content: 人形のような(綺麗な)子だ
It is a doll-like child―a cherub.
人形芝居
a puppet-show
人形使い
a puppet-show man
人形を使う、人形を操る
to pull the wires―to be the power behind the throne
人形のように使われる
to be the puppet on the throne
人形食い
a beauty-hunter
君は人形食いだ
You run after pretty faces.

content:
にんげん〔人間〕
〈名〉A human being; (a) man; a mortal:(集合的に言えば) mankind; humanity:(=の) human; mortal

content.content: 猿は人間に近い
The ape is closely allied to man.
彼は同じ人間だ
They are our fellow-men―our fellow-creatures.
彼らとても同じ人間だ
They are human―human beings―as we are.
だから人間らしく取扱ってやらなければならぬ
So we must treat them like human beings.
どんな英雄豪傑も神ならぬ人間だ
The greatest man is but a mortal.
彼らは人間の屑だ
They are the offscourings of humanity―the scum of society―the dregs of the population.
伯(叔)父が僕を一人前の人間にしてくれると言っています
My uncle promises to make a man of me.
彼は一人前の人間になった
He can do a man's work―fill a man's shoes.
立派な人間になった
He has become a person of consequence.
立派な人間になってくれ
You must be a somebody―somebody in the world.
人間が器用にできている
He is clever by nature.
人間がばかだ
He is a born fool.
人間がばかでない
He is no fool.
ひねくれた人間だ
He is a perverse character―a crabbed nature.
白河以北は人間がおとなしい
North of Shirakawa, the people are gentle.
彼はそんなばかなことをする人間じゃない
He is not the man to do such a foolish thing―He is above doing such a foolish thing.
貴様は人間の皮をかぶっているというだけだ
You have nothing but your shape to make you human―You are human only in shape.
人間万事塞翁が馬
“Inscrutable are the ways of Heaven.”
人間万事金の世の中
“Money makes the mare to go.”
人間諦めが肝心
Resignation is the great lesson of life.
人間到る処青山有り
A true man is found in his place everywhere.
人間社会
human society
人間の力
human power
人間の力に及ばぬ
It is beyond human power.
この病人を治すことは人間の力に及ばぬ
He is past help of man.
人間商売
the business of life
人間商売を止めたくなった
I could wish to quit this life.
人間業
human work
彼の助かったのは人間業でない
His escape is a miracle.
彼の為したことは人間業とは思われぬ
His deeds are sublime.
世界統一は人間業でできることではない
The federation of the world is not humanly possible.
人間並みに
like other human beings
人間並みに言えば不可能だ
Humanly speaking, it is impossible.
僕だってたまには人間並みに風邪を引くさ
I catch my cold once in a while.
あれでも人間並みに泣きもすれば笑いもする
He will cry his cry and laugh his laugh.

content:
にんげんわざ〔人間業〕
〈名〉The work of man

content:
にんじょう〔人情〕
〈名〉
1. (=人性)human nature

content.content: 誰でもそう思うのは人情だ
It is human nature to think so.
そこは人情でいやとは言えぬ
It is not in human nature to say nay.
人情はどこも同じ
Human nature is the same all over the world―“Man is man everywhere.”
人情の然らしむるところ
It is human nature―It is the dictates of nature―It is the promptings of the heart―It is but natural and as it should be―Nature will assert himself.
人情には背かれぬ
You can not go against nature.
彼は人情に通じている
He is versed in human nature―versed in the human heart.
人情を研究する
to inquire into human nature
彼は人情を知り抜いている
He is deep in the knowledge―of the heart.
人情の機微に触れる
to hit human nature home―touch a string of the heart
人情記事(三面記事)
human document
人情本
a novel

content: 2. (=人間の情け)humanity; the heart; feeling; bowel; human sympathy

content.content: 彼は人情がある、人情が厚い
He is humane―He has a feeling heart.
人情があり過ぎる
He is “too full of the milk of human kindness.”
人情が無い、人情が薄い
He has no hear―no feeling―no bowels.
ずいぶん人情の無い男だ
His conduct is heartless.
義理も人情も無い
He has no heart or conscience―no human sympathy.
法律に訴えるのは義理人情を捨ててのことだ
Law begins where human sympathy ends.
人情というものはそんなものじゃない
That is against the dictates of humanity.
人情として断ることができぬ
I can not, in common humanity, refuse the request―Humanity forbids me to refuse the request.
人情に訴える
to appeal to the heart
人情を捨てる(心を鬼にする)
to divest oneself of humanity
風俗人情
the manners and customs of a country
土人の風俗人情は日本人に近い
In manners and customs, the natives are closely related to the Japanese.

content:

〈名〉Pregnancy; conception:(=する) to conceive; to become pregnant; to go with child

content.content: あの女は妊娠している
She is pregnant―gravid―enceinte―with child―in the family way―in an interesting condition―in a delicate condition―in expectation of childbirth.
被告らは妊娠しておった
The prisoners were found with child.
細君は妊娠しているそうだ
His wife is in the family way―going to have a child―going to be a mother―I hear.
母が僕を妊娠しておった時、小説を読んだそうだ
When my mother was with child of me, she is said to have read a romance.
彼女は妊娠して五カ月になる
She is in the fifth month of her pregnancy―She is five months gone with child.

content:
にんずう〔人数〕
〈名〉The number of persons; numerical strength

content.content: 人数が多い
There are many persons―They are numerically strong.
人数が少ない
There are few persons―We are not numerically strong.
敵の方が人数が多い
The enemy are superior in numbers―superior in numerical strength―The enemy outnumber us.
味方の方が人数が少ない
We are inferior in numbers―inferior in numerical strength―We are outnumbered.
敵の人数は三百人
The enemy number 300―The enemy are 300 strong.
私どもの人数は七人です
There are seven of us.
人数の多い家族だ
They are a large family.
人数は(?)
What is the number?―What is the numerical strength?
人数を数える
to count the men―tell noses
人数を増やす
to increase the men―increase the number―add to the number
人数を減らす
to decrease the men―lessen the number―take from the number
人数を揃える
to complete the number
人数が揃った
The number is complete.
人数をまとめる
to make up a party
人数を狩り集める
to make up the number
餓鬼も人数
Numbers will tell.

content:

〈他動〉
1. (=任命する)to appoint (one governor―one to the post of governor); to nominate (one to a post); to gazette (one to a post―one as governor)

content.content: 彼は上海総領事に任ぜられた
He has been appointed (to the post of) consul-general at Shanghai.
内務大臣に任ぜられた
He has been appointed Minister of Home Affairs―appointed to the Home Ministry―gazetted as Home Minister―He has received the portfolio of Home Affairs.

content: 2. (=自任する)to call oneself (a scholar); to profess to be (a scholar); to pretend to (learning); to lay claim to (learning); to set up for (a scholar); to pose as (a scholar); to fancy oneself to be (a scholar, etc.)

content.content: 僕は学者をもって任じはせぬ
I do not profess to be a scholar―pretend to learning―lay claim to learning.
彼は世間通をもって任じている
He pretends to a knowledge of the world―sets up for a man of the world―poses as a man of the world.
彼は天才をもって任じている
He calls himself a genius―fancies himself to be a genius.
彼は天才をもって任ずる資格が無い
He has no pretension to genius.
彼は愚直をもって任じている
He calls himself simple and honest―He gives himself the character of honest simplicity.
いやしくも語学者をもって任ずる人はいつかは必ず読書家であったに違いない
A man of any pretension to linguistic knowledge is sure to have been a reader at some period of his life.
本社はその責めに任ぜず
We do not hold ourselves responsible for it.

目下後任者の人選中

content.content: 君は人相が好い
You have good physiognomy―regular features.
あれは人相の悪い男だ
He is a man of evil physiognomy―an ill-looking fellow.
ひと癖ある人相だ
He has a sinister cast of countenance.
あの男の人相が気に入らぬ
I do not like the looks of the man.
あの人は苦労した人相だ
His face is lined with care―His face shows deep lines of care.

Love of liquor is written in every line of your countenance.

to read character by physiognomy―tell fortunes by physiognomy―physiognomize a person
人相見

〈名〉(堅忍)perseverance:(気長な辛抱) patience; long-suffering:(苦しいことの我慢) endurance:(不幸に堪える剛毅) fortitude:(=する) to persevere (in one's efforts); to be patient (of control); to have patience (with a man); to endure (pain); to bear (pain); to stand (heat or cold); to put up with (an evil); to have fortitude (under misfortune); to bear up, hold up (under misfortune)

content.content: 彼は忍耐の強い人だ
He is persevering―He has perseverance.
お前は忍耐が無い

忍耐して勉強せよ

何事も忍耐せずに成功するものでない

どんな困難でも忍耐で打勝たぬことは無い
Nothing is so difficult but it may be overcome by perseverance.
忍耐すれば必ず忍耐しただけのことはある
Perseverance will not fail of its reward.
忍耐は岩をも通す

痛くとも黙って忍耐しろ

僕はたがいのことは忍耐するが冷笑ばかりは

不幸に逢って忍耐する

冗談は抜きにして本当にどうするつもりか
Joking apart, what do you really intend to do?

content: 〈前置詞相当〉Less, minus (something)

content.content: 中身抜きの財布だけあった
I found the purse minus its contents.
舟は乗り手抜きで帰って来た
The boat returned to port less her passengers―minus her passengers.

content:
ぬきあし〔抜き足〕
〈名〉Stealthy steps; soft steps; a cautious tread:(=で) with stealthy steps; with soft steps; cautiously; on tiptoe

content.content: 抜き足さし足忍び寄る
He approaches with stealthy steps―approaches on tiptoe.

ぬきあつめ〔抜き集め〕
〈名〉Extracts; selections

content:
ぬきうち〔抜き討ち〕
〈名〉Drawing the sword and cutting down (a man) at the same time

content.content: 彼は敵を抜き討ちにした
He drew and cut down his enemy with one movement.

ぬきえもん〔抜き衣紋〕
〈名〉A woman's way of wearing her clothes with the neck-band low on the back

ぬきがき〔抜き書き〕
〈名〉An extract; an excerpt; an abstract:(=する) to extract (from a book); to excerpt (a passage from a book); to abstract (matter from a book)

ぬきかざす〔抜き翳す〕
〈他動〉To brandish, flourish (a sword)

content:
ぬきさし〔抜き差し〕
〈名〉Putting in and taking out; alteration; choice

content.content: 本は版にしてしまうと抜きさしができぬ
A book, once put in print, admits of no alteration.
抜きさしならぬ羽目に陥った
I have no choice (but to do so)―There is no alternative.

ぬぎすてる〔脱ぎ捨てる〕
〈他動〉To cast off, throw off, fling off (one's garments); to lay aside (a coat); to kick off (one's shoes)

ぬきだす〔抜き出す〕
〈他動〉To pick out, single out, select (the best)

content:
ぬきつれる〔抜き連れる〕
〈他動〉To draw (swords) together

content.content: 玉散る剣抜き連れて
With flashing blades in your hands,
死する覚悟で進むべし
March with your lives in your hands!

content:
ぬきで〔抜き手〕
〈名〉An overhand stroke

content.content: 抜き手を切る
to swim by overhand strokes

content:
ぬきとる〔抜き取る〕
〈他動〉
1. To extract (a bullet); to abstract (a bank-note)

content.content: 束から札を一枚抜き取った
He abstracted a bank-note from the bundle.

content: 2. (=抜き出す)to pick out, single out, select (the best)

ぬきはなす〔抜き放す〕
〈他動〉To draw, unsheathe, whip out (a sword)

content:
ぬきみ〔抜き身〕
〈名〉A drawn sword; a naked blade

content.content: 抜き身を提げて押し込んだ
He forced his way into the house, drawn sword in hand.

content:
ぬきんでる〔抽んでる〕
〈自動〉To excel; to be eminent; to be preeminent; to be prominent

content.content: ぬきんでた学者だ
He is an eminent scholar―a prominent scholar.
学者としてぬきんでている
He is preeminent for his scholarship―by far the greatest of all scholars.
一頭地をぬきんでている
He towers above his contemporaries.

content:
ぬく〔抜く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=引き抜く)to draw, unsheathe (a sword); to pull out, extract, draw (a tooth); to pull out, pluck out (a hair); to pull up (weeds); to root up, uproot (a tree)

content.content: 刀を抜く
to draw a sword―unsheathe a sword
ギラリと抜いた
He flashed his sword.
抜く手は見せぬぞ
I will cut you down in an instant.
歯を抜く
to pull out a tooth―draw a tooth―extract a tooth
この歯を抜いて下さい
I wish to have this tooth pulled out.
毛を抜く
to pull out a hair―pluck (out) a hair
鳥の毛を抜く
to pull out a feather―pluck a feather
人の鼻毛を抜く
to steal a march upon a man
釘を抜く
to pull out a nail―draw a nail
徳利の口を抜く
to draw the cork―uncork a bottle
ビールを一本抜こう
I will open a bottle of beer.
樽から酒を抜く
to draw wine from a cask
この酒は今樽から抜いたばかりだ
This wine is fresh-drawn from the cask.
弾を抜く
to extract a bullet―unload a gun
ねじを抜く
to undo a screw
桶の底を抜く
to knock the bottom out of a tub
腸を抜く
(魚なら)to gut a fish―(鳥なら)―draw a fowl
生馬の目を抜く
to pull out one's eye-teeth
江戸っ子は生き馬の目を抜く
The Edokko is as sharp as a needle.
度胆を抜く
to appall one
荒胆を抜く
to tame a wild nature―break one's spirit

content: 2. (=抜萃する)to extract (a passage from a book); to excerpt (a passage from an author); to abstract (matter from a book); to select (passages from a book)

content.content: この一節は Emerson から抜いたのだ
The passage is an extract from Emerson.
これらの本から好い処を抜いてみよう
I will make selections from these authors.
教義などの要を抜く
to summarize a doctrine―epitomize a doctrine
武士道の粋を抜く
to extract the essence of Bushido

content: 3. (=抜擢する)to select, pick out, single out (the best); to choose (from among many―so many out of the number)

content.content: 一番好いのを抜いたのだ
I have selected the best―picked out the best―singled out the best.
この中から五六人抜いてみよう
I will choose five or six out of the number.
これらは好いのを抜いた残りだ
These are the remains left out of the choice.
人才を抜く
to draw the talent of a nation

content: 4. (=除く)to get rid of (a habit); to take out, remove (a stain)

content.content: 悪い癖を抜こうとしている
I am trying to get rid of my bad habit―break myself of a bad habit.
しみを抜く
to remove a stain―take out a stain
垢を抜く
to polish one's manner―give a girl a town polish
寝て疲れを抜く
to sleep off one's fatigue

content: 5. (=省く)to omit (a chapter); to leave out (a passage); to skip over (a passage)

content.content: この一章は抜くことにしよう
We shall omit this chapter.
名前は抜いた方がよい
You had better leave out the names.
むずかしい処を抜いて読む
I skip over difficult passages.
手を抜く
to slight one's work―scamp one's work―fudge one's work―do careless work
手を抜いた仕事
careless work
決して手を抜くようなことは致しません
I never do careless work―I always do my work with scrupulous care.

content: 6. (=貫く)to pierce (the wall); to penetrate (the armour)

content.content: この榴弾はどんな甲鉄でも抜く
This shell will penetrate any armour.
この甲鉄はどんな弾丸でも抜けない
This armour is impenetrable to shot or shell.

content: 7. (=略取する)to seize, capture, carry (a castle or a fortress)

content.content: 敵陣を抜く
to carry the enemy's position
一挙して要塞を抜いた
The fortress was carried by one assault.
城は堅くして抜くべからず
The castle is impregnable.

content: 8. (=追越す、凌ぐ)to outstrip (a man); to outrun (a competitor); to outsail (another ship); to get ahead of (one's class); to rise above (the rest)

content.content: 植民地が本国を抜くような勢いだ
The colony nearly outstrips her mother-country.
赤が青を抜いた
The red has outrun the green―(競漕なら)―The red has got ahead of the green.
赤が一艇身抜いた
The red has won by a length.
甲丸が乙丸を抜く
One ship outsails another―outsteams another.
彼は進歩が早いからたちまち全級を抜いた
He made such progress that he soon got ahead of his class.
彼は確かに英語では全級を抜いている
He is decidedly ahead of his class in English.
群を抜く
to rise above the crowd―to be distinguished―conspicuous―preeminent
凡を抜く
to rise above the common herd―rise above the common run of men
彼は一頭地を抜いている
He towers above the rest―towers above his contemporaries.

content: 9. (=盗む)to abstract

content.content: 彼は札の束から一枚抜いた
He abstracted a piece from a bundle of bank-notes.
風呂を抜く
to empty the bath-tub
富士は海面を抜くこと一万二千四百五十六尺
Mt. Fuji is 12,456 feet above the sea-level.
肩を抜く
to cut the concern
決心抜くべからず
His resolution is not to be shaken.

content:
ぬぐ〔脱ぐ〕
〈他動〉
1. To take off (one's coat, hat, or shoes); to strip off (one's coat); to strip oneself of (one's clothes); to divest oneself of (one's garments); to doff (one's hat)

content.content: 着物を脱ぐ
to take off one's clothes―strip oneself of one's clothes―undress (oneself)
靴を脱ぐ
to take off one's shoes―(手をかけずになら)―kick off one's shoes
靴を脱ぐことは無いそのままはいておれ
You need not take off your shoes―You may keep on your shoes.
肌を脱ぐ
to bare one's shoulders―strip oneself to the waist
皆肌を脱いでいる
They are all stript to the waist.
片肌脱ぐ
to bare one shoulder―(力を添えるの意味なら)―stretch a helping hand―lend one a helping hand―give one a lift
君のためなら僕も片肌脱ごう
I will stand your friend.
仮面を脱ぐ
to throw off one's mask
兜を脱いで軍門に降る
to lay down one's arms―surrender
蛇が皮を脱ぐ
A snake sheds its skin―casts its skin―sloughs.

content:
ぬくい〔温い〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: あたたかい〔温かい〕

ぬぐいとる〔拭い取る〕
〈他動〉To wipe off; to wipe away

content:
ぬぐう〔拭う〕
〈他動〉To wipe; to mop

content.content: 額の汗を拭う
to wipe the sweat off one's brow―mop one's brow
涙を拭う
to wipe one's eyes―dry one's tears
口を拭う
to wipe one's mouth―(白を切るの意味なら)―feign innocence
恥を拭う
to wipe away a disgrace
拭うべからざる恥辱だ
It is an indelible disgrace―an ineffaceable disgrace.
一天拭うが如し
The whole sky is clear from clouds.
人の尻を拭う
to repair another's blunder

content:
ぬくめる〔温める〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: あたためる〔温める〕

content:
ぬけ〔抜け〕
〈前置詞相当〉Minus, less, wanting (something)

content.content: ひと月に三日抜け
It is a month less three days.
十円に五十銭抜け
ten yen minus fifty sen―ten yen wanting fifty sen

ぬけあきない〔抜け商い〕
〈名〉Smuggling:(=する) to smuggle (opium, etc.)

ぬけあそび〔抜け遊び〕
〈名〉Truancy:(=する) to play truant

content:
ぬけあな〔抜け孔〕
〈名〉A loop-hole; an outlet

content.content: この法律には抜け穴がある
There is a loop-hole in this law―You may drive a coach-and-six through this law.

content:
ぬけがけ〔抜け駈け〕
〈名〉Forestalling

content.content: 抜けがけの功名をする
to forestall one's rival―steal a march on the others

content:
ぬけがら〔脱殻〕
〈名〉A cast skin; a cast shell; a slough:(総称複数名詞)exuviae

content.content: 蝉の脱け殻
a cicada's shell
蛇の脱け殻
a slough

content:
ぬけかわる〔抜け変る〕
〈自動〉To exuviate; to cast its skin; to shed its shell; (a snake or a cat) sloughs; (a fowl) moults

content.content: 鶏は今羽根が抜け変わる時だ
The hens are moulting.
猫は今毛が抜け変わる
The cat is sloughing.

ぬけさく〔抜作〕
〈名〉A stupid fellow

content:
ぬけでる〔抜け出る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=孔から出る)to go through (a hole)

content.content: 絵から抜け出たような美人だ
She seems as if she had walked out of a painting.

content: 2. (=忍び出る)to steal out (of a house); to slip out (of a room)

content.content: どさくさまぎれにそっと家を抜け出た
He benefited by the confusion, and stole out of the house.

content: 3. (=動物が檻から逃げる)to get loose; to break loose; to get out of (the cage)

ぬけまいり〔抜け詣り〕
〈名〉A secret pilgrimage to a shrine:(=する) to make a secret pilgrimage to a shrine

content.content: 昔は伊勢へ抜け詣りをする者があったものだ
In bygone days, there used to be people who went on secret pilgrimages to the Shrine of Ise.

content:
ぬけみち〔抜け道〕
〈名〉A secret path; a by-path

content.content: 彼は関所を通らずに抜け道を抜けた
He went by a secret path to avoid the barrier.

content:
ぬけめない〔抜目無い〕
〈形〉Shrewd, smart, knowing, sharp, acute, keen, astute, alert, wide-awake (man); close (attention or observation):(俗語)fly

content.content: あれは抜け目の無い男だ
He is a knowing fellow―a 'cute chap―He is fly.
米国の東北人は非常に抜け目が無い(生き馬の目を抜くよう)
A Yankee is as sharp as a needle.
支那には抜け目の無い商人が多い
There are many smart merchants in China.
(もう知っているか)抜け目が無いね
You are on the alert, I see.
そこは抜け目は無いさ
I know what I am about―I understand my business.
海外に居る日本人は内地人より抜け目が無い
People who live abroad are more wide-awake than those who stay at home.
彼は金儲けに抜け目が無い
He is a shrewd man of business.
取引には抜け目が無い
He is keen at a bargain.
利益にかけては抜け目が無い
He is awake to his own interests―He has an eye to the main chance―He knows on which side his bread is buttered.
抜け目無く立ちまわる
He goes shrewdly to work.
例の通り抜け目無く各方面に運動している
He is making interest with everybody with his usual shrewdness―with his characteristic savoir faire.
彼は細かい点まで抜け目無く注意する
He gives close attention to details.
世の中を抜け目無く観察する
He is a close observer of men and things.

content:
ぬける〔抜ける、脱ける〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=脱落する)to fall off; to fall out; to come out

content.content: 毛が脱ける
Hair falls out―falls off.
病気のせいか毛がこんなに脱ける
Whether owing to my late illness, my hair falls out so.
彼女は髪がすっかり抜けてしまった
Her hair is all gone.
オウムは羽根が抜けると惜しがる
A parrot seems to be sorry when a feather falls out―when it loses a feather.
釘が抜けた
A nail has fallen out―(抜こうとしてなら)―The nail has come out.
この徳利の口がなかなか抜けない
The cork will not come out.
(重くて)腕が抜けそうだ
I feel as if my arms were coming out of their sockets.
腰が抜ける
One is paralyzed with terror―One's knees give away.
慾張る鷹は爪が抜ける
“He who grasps at too much, will lose all”―“Grasp all, lose all.”
底が抜ける
The bottom comes out.
彼の洋服は肘が抜けている
He is out at elbows.
膝の抜けたズボンをはいている
He wears trousers out at the knees―kneed trousers.

content: 2. (=脱漏する)to be omitted; to be left out; to be wanting; to be missing

content.content: 一字抜けている
A word is left out.
一番大事な物が抜けている
The most important item is omitted.
この本は二三枚抜けている
A few leaves are wanting―missing.
間が抜ける
to be wanting in harmony―out of time
君はずいぶん間の抜けたことをしたものだ
What a stupid thing you have done!―How stupid of you!

content: 3. (=無くなる)to go; to go off; to come out; to fail

content.content: 火にあぶると匂いが抜ける
Show it the fire, and the smell will go off.
このしみがなかなか抜けない
The stain will not come out.
この香水の香りが抜けた
The perfume is gone.
菫は日本へ持って来ると香りが抜ける
The violet loses its aroma in Japan.
力が抜けてどうしても立てなかった
My strength failed me, and I could not, for the life of me, stand up.
見物人が無いと競技者は張合が抜ける
The want of spectators discourages the competitors.
(人が)気が抜ける
One is stupefied―abstracted―absent-minded.
ビールは気が抜ける
Beer becomes stale―becomes flat.
気の抜けたビール
stale beer―flat beer―dead beer
葡萄酒は味が抜ける
Wine becomes stale.
あの子は垢が抜けている
She has a polished manner.
垢の抜けた子だ
She is a polished girl.

content: 4. (=欠ける)to be less (something); to be minus (something); to be wanting (something)

content.content: 一カ月に三日抜ける
It is a month less three days.
十円に五十銭抜ける
It is ten yen minus fifty sen―ten yen wanting fifty sen.
あの男は少し抜けている
He wants a shilling in the pound.

content: 5. (=直る)to be got rid of; to be got over

content.content: 悪い癖は抜け難い
A bad habit is hard to get rid of.
彼はまだ昔の癖が抜けない
He can not get rid of his old habit―break himself of his old habit.
お国訛りがまだ抜けない
He still retains his provincialism.
この煩いが抜けたらありがたいがな
I should be glad to be rid of this trouble.
風邪が抜けたか
Have you got rid of your cold?―got over your cold?―lost your cold?
今の風邪は抜け難い
A cold at this time of the year is hard to get rid of.
疲れがまだ抜けない
I have not recovered from my fatigue yet.
寝ると疲れが抜ける
You will sleep off your fatigue.

content: 6. (=通り抜ける)to pass through (a place); to go through (an alley, etc.)

content.content: この森を抜けると道路へ出る
You strike a road when you pass through this wood.
この横町を抜けて行こう
Let us go through this alley.
この路地は抜けられますか
Can one pass through this alley?
この路地は抜けられません
You can not pass through this alley―It is a blind alley.
非常線は抜けられない
One can not pass the cordon.
目から鼻へ抜けるような男だ
He has a subtle intellect.

content: 7. (=言い抜ける)to dodge; to quibble; to shuffle; to shift and prevaricate; to excuse oneself

content.content: 裸のところを廊下で見つかって風呂場はどこだと抜けた
Caught naked in the passage, he dodged himself out of the difficulty by asking where the bath-room was.
彼に何を尋ねてもなんとかかとか抜ける
Ask him any question you will, he will excuse himself somehow or other―shift and prevaricate.

content: 8. (=脱出する)to slip (the bonds); to escape (danger); to get away

content.content: 囚人が縄を脱ける
A prisoner slips his bonds.
馬が手綱を脱ける
A horse slips his bridle.
犬が頸輪を脱ける
A dog slips his collar.
やっと危ないところを脱けて来た
I have managed to escape an imminent danger―I have had a narrow escape.
この夏は講習会があるから脱けられぬ
I can not get away this summer, for we have summer school.

content: 9. (=脱退する)to withdraw from (a society)

content.content: 会を脱けた者がある
Some members have withdrawn from the society.
(トランプなどで)僕は一番脱けよう
I will sit out a game.

content:
ぬける〔抜ける、脱ける〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=脱落する)to fall off; to fall out; to come out

content.content: 毛が脱ける
Hair falls out―falls off.
病気のせいか毛がこんなに脱ける
Whether owing to my late illness, my hair falls out so.
彼女は髪がすっかり抜けてしまった
Her hair is all gone.
オウムは羽根が抜けると惜しがる
A parrot seems to be sorry when a feather falls out―when it loses a feather.
釘が抜けた
A nail has fallen out―(抜こうとしてなら)―The nail has come out.
この徳利の口がなかなか抜けない
The cork will not come out.
(重くて)腕が抜けそうだ
I feel as if my arms were coming out of their sockets.
腰が抜ける
One is paralyzed with terror―One's knees give away.
慾張る鷹は爪が抜ける
“He who grasps at too much, will lose all”―“Grasp all, lose all.”
底が抜ける
The bottom comes out.
彼の洋服は肘が抜けている
He is out at elbows.
膝の抜けたズボンをはいている
He wears trousers out at the knees―kneed trousers.

content: 2. (=脱漏する)to be omitted; to be left out; to be wanting; to be missing

content.content: 一字抜けている

一番大事な物が抜けている
The most important item is omitted.
この本は二三枚抜けている
A few leaves are wanting―missing.
間が抜ける
to be wanting in harmony―out of time
君はずいぶん間の抜けたことをしたものだ
What a stupid thing you have done!―How stupid of you!

content: 3. (=無くなる)to go; to go off; to come out; to fail

content.content: 火にあぶると匂いが抜ける

このしみがなかなか抜けない
The stain will not come out.
この香水の香りが抜けた
The perfume is gone.
菫は日本へ持って来ると香りが抜ける
The violet loses its aroma in Japan.
力が抜けてどうしても立てなかった

見物人が無いと競技者は張合が抜ける
The want of spectators discourages the competitors.
(人が)気が抜ける
One is stupefied―abstracted―absent-minded.
ビールは気が抜ける
Beer becomes stale―becomes flat.
気の抜けたビール
stale beer―flat beer―dead beer
葡萄酒は味が抜ける
Wine becomes stale.
あの子は垢が抜けている
She has a polished manner.
垢の抜けた子だ
She is a polished girl.

content: 4. (=欠ける)to be less (something); to be minus (something); to be wanting (something)

content.content: 一カ月に三日抜ける
It is a month less three days.
十円に五十銭抜ける
It is ten yen minus fifty sen―ten yen wanting fifty sen.
あの男は少し抜けている
He wants a shilling in the pound.

content: 5. (=直る)to be got rid of; to be got over

content.content: 悪い癖は抜け難い
A bad habit is hard to get rid of.
彼はまだ昔の癖が抜けない
He can not get rid of his old habit―break himself of his old habit.
お国訛りがまだ抜けない
He still retains his provincialism.
この煩いが抜けたらありがたいがな
I should be glad to be rid of this trouble.
風邪が抜けたか
Have you got rid of your cold?―got over your cold?―lost your cold?
今の風邪は抜け難い
A cold at this time of the year is hard to get rid of.
疲れがまだ抜けない
I have not recovered from my fatigue yet.
寝ると疲れが抜ける
You will sleep off your fatigue.

content: 6. (=通り抜ける)to pass through (a place); to go through (an alley, etc.)

content.content: この森を抜けると道路へ出る
You strike a road when you pass through this wood.
この横町を抜けて行こう
Let us go through this alley.
この路地は抜けられますか
Can one pass through this alley?
この路地は抜けられません
You can not pass through this alley―It is a blind alley.
非常線は抜けられない
One can not pass the cordon.
目から鼻へ抜けるような男だ
He has a subtle intellect.

content: 7. (=言い抜ける)to dodge; to quibble; to shuffle; to shift and prevaricate; to excuse oneself

content.content: 裸のところを廊下で見つかって風呂場はどこだと抜けた
Caught naked in the passage, he dodged himself out of the difficulty by asking where the bath-room was.
彼に何を尋ねてもなんとかかとか抜ける
Ask him any question you will, he will excuse himself somehow or other―shift and prevaricate.

content: 8. (=脱出する)to slip (the bonds); to escape (danger); to get away

content.content: 囚人が縄を脱ける
A prisoner slips his bonds.
馬が手綱を脱ける
A horse slips his bridle.
犬が頸輪を脱ける
A dog slips his collar.
やっと危ないところを脱けて来た
I have managed to escape an imminent danger―I have had a narrow escape.
この夏は講習会があるから脱けられぬ
I can not get away this summer, for we have summer school.

content: 9. (=脱退する)to withdraw from (a society)

content.content: 会を脱けた者がある
Some members have withdrawn from the society.
(トランプなどで)僕は一番脱けよう
I will sit out a game.

ぬさ〔幣〕
〈名〉A symbolical offering (to the gods)

content:
ぬし〔主〕
〈名〉
1. (=主人)one's master
2. (=持主)the owner; the proprietor

content.content: この家の主は誰か
Who is the owner of this house?―Whose house is this?
主ある女
a married woman―somebody's wife
主無き船
an ownerless ship―a derelict ship
主無き地
no man's land
預かり主は半分の主
“Possession is nine points of the law.”

content: 3. (=山や河などに古く住む霊的動物)the guardian spirit, the genius (of a place)

content.content: 古池の主
the guardian spirit of an old pond

content: 〈代名詞〉Thou (of lovers' language)

ぬすっと〔盗人〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ぬすびと〔盗人〕

content:
ぬすびと〔盗人〕
〈名〉A thief; a robber; a burglar

content.content: 盗人に入る
to break into a house―(泥棒の符牒では)―crack a crib
盗人をする
to commit theft―commit burglary―commit robbery
家に盗人を養う
“So many servants, so many thieves.”
家には鼠国には盗人
“Every mountain has its wolves.”
人を見たら盗人と思え
Trust no stranger.
盗人に追銭
to throw good money after bad―throw the handle after the axe
盗人にも三分の理あり
“Give the devil his due.”
盗人に金の番
to set a wolf to watch the sheep
盗人の番には盗人が好し(蛇の道は蛇)
“Set a thief to watch for thieves.”
盗人猛々し
Evil-doers are audacious.
盗人猛々しとはこのことだ
The audacity of evildoers!
盗人を捕えて縄
“After death the doctor.”
世に盗人の種は尽きまじ
The world will never be free from thieves.
盗人を捕えてみれば我が子なり
I find the thief to be my own son.
盗人を
The prowling one
捕えてみれば
I pounce upon―
我が子なり
'Tis my own son.

content:
ぬすみ〔盗み〕
〈名〉Stealing; theft

content.content: 盗みをする
to steal―commit theft
彼は盗みを言いかけられた
He was accused of theft―charged with theft.
人の家へ盗みに入る
to break into a house―(泥棒の符牒にては)―crack a crib

ぬすみぎきする〔盗み聞きする〕
〈自動〉To eavesdrop
〈他動〉To overhear (a talk)

content:
ぬすみぐい〔盗み食い〕
〈名〉Eating by stealth:(=する) to eat by stealth

content.content: 盗み食いはうまい
“Stolen fruit is sweet.”

ぬすみみる〔盗み見る〕
〈他動〉To steal a glance at (anything); to cast furtive glances at (one)

content:
ぬすみもの〔盗み物〕
〈名〉Stolen goods

content.content: 盗み物を吐く
to hand up stolen goods

ぬすみわらいする〔盗み笑いする〕
〈自動〉To laugh in one's sleeve

content:
ぬすむ〔盗む〕
〈他動〉To steal (anything from a person or a place); to rob (a man of his money); to pilfer, purloin, crib (small articles from a store):(綺麗に言えば)to abstract (a bank-note from a bundle); to make free with (others' possessions):(以下特例)to plagiarize (others' writings); to father (another's work); to crib (another's writings); to pirate, gut (a book)

content.content: 僕は時計を盗まれた
My watch was stolen―(と言うよりも)―I had my watch stolen.
金を盗まれた
I had my money stolen―I was robbed of my money.
女中が主人の財布から金を盗んだ
The servant abstracted some money from her master's purse.
彼は下男が酒を盗んで困ると言っている
He complains of his servant making free with his wine.
人の家へ盗みに入る
to break into a house―(泥棒の符牒では)―crack a crib
あの人は人の作を盗むという評判だ
He is accused of fathering others' works―plagiarizing others' works.
本の内容を盗む
to gut a book
本を盗んで出版する
to pirate a book
禄を盗む
to have a sinecure
天下を盗む
to usurp the throne
耳を掩って鈴を盗む
“The cat shuts her eyes while she steals the cream.”

content:
ぬすむ〔偸む〕
〈他動〉
1. ［注意］訳語一定せず。

content.content: 暇を偸む
to snatch a moment―spare time from business
暫く職務の暇を偸んで来た
I have snatched a few minutes from my duties.
本職の暇を偸む
to spare time from one's business
彼は職業の暇を偸んで読書する
He spends in reading all the time he can spare from his business.
これは本職の暇を偸んで書いた本だ
The book was written in the intervals of my professional business.
人は忙しいと寸暇を偸んで読書する
A busy man will read at odd moments.
苟安{こうあん}を偸む
to snatch a moment of ease
忙中の閑を偸む
to snatch a leisure hour from pressure of business
人目を偸む
to avoid observation―elude observation―shun observation
人目を偸んで悪いことをする
He does evil in secret―by stealth―on the sly.
二人は人目を偸んで逢った
They met in secret―arranged clandestine meetings.
彼は久しく警察の目を偸んだ奴だ
He has long eluded the police.
親の目を偸む
to elude paternal vigilance
彼は親の目を偸んで遊びに行く
He visits gay quarters by eluding paternal vigilance―He takes surreptitious pleasure.
親の目を偸んで河へ泳ぎに行った
I went for a surreptitious swim in the river.
黒人{くろうと}の目は偸めぬ
One can not deceive a trained eye―The blemish will not escape a trained eye.
足音を偸んで忍び寄った
He approached with stealthy steps―on tiptoe.
禄を偸む
to have a sinecure
天下を偸む
to usurp the throne

content:
ぬたうつ
〈自動〉→『

content.content: のたうつ〔のた打つ〕

content:
ぬたくる
〈自動〉→『

content.content: のたくる

content:
』
〈他動〉(=下手に書く)to scrawl; to scribble:(絵なら)to daub

ぬっと
〈副〉
1. (=不意に)suddenly

content.content: 彼は時々ぬっとやって来る
He sometimes puts in a sudden appearance.

content: 2. (=ぼんやり)vaguely

content.content: ぬっと現れる
to loom
高い崖が霧の中からぬっと現れた
A lofty cliff loomed large out of the fog.
暗闇の中からぬっと現れたのが一人の大男
There loomed out of the darkness a gigantic figure.

ぬのこ〔布子〕
〈名〉A cotton gown

content:
ぬーぼーしき〔ヌーボー式〕
〈名〉The ecole nouveau

content.content: ヌーボー式の男だ
He is an apathetic man―a stolid-looking man.

content:
ぬま〔沼〕
〈名〉A marsh; a swamp; a (lowlying) lake

content.content: 印旛沼
Lake Inba.
沼地
marshy land―swampy land―a bog―a morass

content:
ぬらす〔濡らす〕
〈他動〉To wet (anything)

content.content: 寝床を濡らす(寝小便する)
to wet the bed
足を濡らすと風邪をひく
You will catch cold if you get your feet wet.
手を濡らさずして魚は取れぬ
There is no catching fish without getting wet―He who would catch fish, must not mind getting wet.
手を濡らさずして得らるるもの無し
Nothing is to be had without labour.
火楽を濡らすな
Keep your powder dry!
袖を濡らす
to wet one's sleeve―cry―weep
密かに袖を濡らすことも度々あった
She often wept in secret.
露をだに厭う
The dew of morning she doth dread,
大和のおみなえし
Yamato's tender maid;
降るアメリカに
That foreign rain her sleeve hath wet,
袖を濡らさじ
Shall of her ne'er be said.

content:
ぬらつく
〈自動〉→『

content.content: ぬらぬらする

content:
ぬらぬらする
〈他動〉To be slimy; to be clammy; to be slippery:(油でなら)to be greasy:(形容詞に用いれば)slimy (fish); clammy (frog); slippery (eel); greasy (table, etc.)

content.content: 魚はぬらぬらする
Fish are slimy.
蛙はぬらぬらする
Fogs are clammy.
鰻はぬらぬらしてつかめない
Eels are slippery.

content:
ぬり〔塗り〕
〈名〉(漆なら)lacquering:(ペンキなら)coating

content.content: 道具は塗りが好い
The furniture is well lacquered.
塗りがはげる
The lacquer comes off.
塗りが所々はげている
The lacquer is off in places.
黒塗り
black-lacquered
朱塗り
vermilion-lacquered
ペンキの一塗り
one coat of paint
下塗り
the first coat (of paint)
上塗り
the last coat (of paint)

ぬりいた〔塗り板〕
〈名〉A blackboard

content:
ぬりかえる〔塗り替える〕
〈他動〉To repaint

content.content: 家は塗り替えなければならぬ
The house wants painting―(は英、米は)―needs painting.
戦争でヨーロッパの地図が塗り替えられた
The war has altered the map of Europe.

ぬりぐすり〔塗り薬〕
〈名〉An ointment; a liniment

ぬりけす〔塗り消す〕
〈他動〉To paint out (a signboard, etc.)

content:
ぬりたて〔塗り立て〕
〈形〉Fresh-painted (door, etc.)

content.content: 塗り立てのペンキに触るな
Do not touch the wet paint.
ペンキ塗り立て(掲示)
“Wet paint.”

ぬりたてる〔塗り立てる〕
〈自動〉To paint (one's face) thick

content:
ぬりつける〔塗り付ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=ぬたくる)to daub, bedaub (the canvas); to smear, besmear (the face with ink, etc.)
2. (=なすり付ける)to lay (the blame on another); to charge (the guilt on another); to father (one's child upon another); to affiliate a (fault upon another); to lay (a failure) at one's door; to lay (a failure) to one's charge

content.content: 僕に罪を塗り付けるのはひどい
It is hard of you to lay the blame on me.
彼は自分でいたずらをしておいて僕に塗り付けた
He fathered his prank upon me.
先生は自分の子どもを書生に塗り付けた
He fathered his own child upon the house-boy.
失敗の罪を塗り付けられた
They laid the failure at my door―laid the failure to my charge.

content:
ぬりもの〔塗物〕
〈名〉Lacquer-ware

content.content: 塗物師
a lacquerer

content:
ぬる〔塗る〕
〈他動〉
1. To paint (a house or a ship); to plaster (a wall); to cover, coat (anything with paint or lacquer); to daub, bedaub (the wall with clay); to smear, besmear (one's face with ink); to spread (butter on bread―bread with butter)

content.content: 壁を塗る
to plaster a wall
壁に土を塗る
to plaster the wail with mud
白壁を塗る
to whitewash a wall
ペンキを塗る
to paint anything
船は白く塗ってある
The ship is painted white.
漆を塗る
to lacquer anything
道具が黒く塗ってある
The furniture is black-lacquered.
ワニスを塗る
to varnish anything
心棒に油を塗る
to oil the axle―lubricate the axle
パンにバタを塗る
to spread butter on bread―spread bread with butter―butter one's bread
顔に墨を塗る
to smear one's face with ink
負けた者は顔に墨を塗られる
One who is beaten has his face besmeared with ink.
人の顔に泥を塗る
to dishonour or disgrace a person
お前のような奴は親の顔に泥を塗る奴だ
You are a disgrace to your father.
亭主の顔に泥を塗る
to dishonour one's husband―disgrace one's husband―deceive one's husband―cover one's husband with disgrace―clothe one's husband with shame
顔に泥を塗られる
to be covered with disgrace―be clothed with shame―cherish a viper in one's bosom

content: 2. (=塗り立てる)→『

content.content: ぬりたてる〔塗り立てる〕
ぬりつける〔塗り付ける〕

content:
ぬるい
〈形〉Lukewarm; tepid:(風呂なら)not hot enough

content.content: お風呂はぬるくはありませんか
Is the bath hot enough?
おぬるいなら焚きましょう
If it is not hot enough, I will put more wood on the fire.

content:
ぬるぬるする
〈自動〉→『

content.content: ぬらぬらする

ぬるまゆ〔微温湯〕
〈名〉Tepid water

ぬるむ
〈自動〉(Of hot water) to become less hot

ぬるめる
〈他動〉To make (hot water) less hot (by adding cold water)

content:
ぬれぎぬ〔濡衣〕
〈名〉A false accusation; a false charge; a false imputation

content.content: ぬれぎぬを着せる
to accuse one falsely
ぬれぎぬを着る(着せられる)
to be falsely accused
ぬれぎぬを干す
to prove one's innocence―vindicate one's innocence

ぬれごと〔濡れ事〕
〈名〉A love affair (in a play)

ぬれごとし〔濡れ事師〕
〈名〉An actor who plays the lover or sweetheart

content:
ぬれて〔濡れ手〕
〈名〉A wet hand

content.content: 濡れ手で粟のつかみ取り
to take with a wet finger―make money as a magnet gathers iron filings―make easy gain

content:
ぬれねずみ〔濡れ鼠〕
〈名〉A wet rat

content.content: 濡れ鼠のよう
like a drowned rat

ぬれば〔濡れ場〕
〈名〉A love-scene (in a play)

ぬれぶみ〔濡れ文〕
〈名〉A love-letter

ぬれぼとけ〔濡れ仏〕
〈名〉An open-air Buddhist image

content:
ぬれる〔濡れる〕
〈自動〉To get wet; to be drenched; to be soaked

content.content: 下が濡れている
The ground is wet―It is wet underfoot.
雨でびっしょり濡れた
I am drenched with rain―soaked with rain―wet to the skin―wet through and through―dripping-wet.
そこは濡れますよ
You are standing in the rain―standing in the wet.
そこは濡れるから(早く)こっちへお入り
Come in out of the rain!―Make haste in out of the wet!
張子でないから濡れても平気だ
I am not made of salt―not made of sugar.
濡れぬ先の傘
“Look before you leap.”
濡れぬ先こそ露をも厭え
Dry feet dread the dew―Wet feet dread no dew―Let a woman once lose her purity, and she has nothing more to lose―When a woman has once lost her virtue, she will shrink from no crime.

content:
ね〔音〕
〈名〉
1. Sound; the tone (of an instrument); the note (of a bird)

content.content: 鐘の音
the sound of a bell
三味線の音
the tone of the samisen
琴の音
the strains of the harp
虫の音
the chirping of insects
鶯の高音、中音下げ音
the high note―middle note―low note―of the warbler
笛は音が好い
The flute sounds sweet.
好い音
a sweet sound
どこを押せばあんな音が出るやら
He expresses a sentiment foreign to his heart―How he talks!―Hear him talk!
ぐうの音も出ないように負かす
to beat one all to nothing―beat one all to sticks―(は英、米は)―beat one all hollow.
僕のその一言で彼はぐうの音も出なかった
He was nonplussed―at a nonplus―reduced to a nonplus―It was a silencer―a poser―a clincher―a floorer―a staggerer.

content:
ね〔根〕
〈名〉
1. A root

content.content: 木の根
the roots of a tree
この木の根に鼠が巣を食っている
A mouse lives under the roots of this tree.
木の根枕に寝る
to sleep in the open
根が付く
to take root
柳の枝はじきに根が付く
A willow twig soon takes root.
植え換えた木は根が付いたらしい
The replanted tree seems to have taken root.
木が根を下ろす
A tree strikes root.
深く根が張る
A tree strikes deep root.
この木は深く根が張っている
The tree is deeply rooted.
木の根を抜く
to pull up a tree by the root―root up a tree―uproot a tree
木の根をまわす
to dig round the roots of a tree(to fit it for replanting)
今根をまわしておけば来春は植え替えられる
If you dig round the roots now, the tree will be fit for replanting next spring.
歯の根
the root of a tooth
歯の根が合わぬ
One's teeth chatter for fear.
はれものの根
the nucleus of a boil
島が東の方へ根を引いている
The island sweeps to the eastward.
根を絶つ
to root out an evil―eradicate an evil―extirpate a pernicious doctrine―exterminate a pernicious sect
根を絶ち葉を枯らす
to destroy anything root and branch
根も葉も無い話だ
It is a groundless report―an unfounded rumour―a cock-and-bull story.
それは根も葉も無い捏造説だ
It is a pure fabrication.
根も葉も無い話をこしらえる
to make up a story out of the whole cloth
根掘り葉掘り聞く人だ
He is inquisitive―an inquisitive person
根に持つ
to resent (an insult)―bear one a grudge (for a slight)
彼は断られたのを根に持って仇をする
He resents my refusal, and does me ill turns.
彼は負けたのを根に持っている
He bears me a grudge for his defeat.
彼は根が江戸っ子だ
He is an Edokko by birth.
根が正直だ
He is honest by nature.
根が上人だ
He is a good fellow at bottom.
根が芸者だ
She is a geisha by origin.
根がそれ者だ
She is a demi-rep by origin.

content:
ね〔子〕
〈名〉The rat (one of the twelve zodiacal signs)

content.content: 子の年
the year of the Rat

content:
ね〔寝〕
〈名〉Sleep

content.content: 昨夜は寝が足らなかった
I did not get enough sleep last night.
寝が足らないから気分が悪い
I feel ill from want of sleep.

content:
ね〔値〕
〈名〉(売る値)a price:(買う値) a cost:(売買共に) a figure; terms

content.content: 値かいくらか
What is the price?―What does it cost?
値を聞く
to ask the price
おおせの値でさし上げます
I will let you have it at the price you name―at the figure you name.
その値で売っては損になります
I shall lose if I sell it at that price―at that figure.
その値では仕事を引受けかねます
I can not undertake the work on such terms.
値が高い
The price is high―It is dear.
値が安い
The price is low―It is cheap.
値がいくら高くとも買う
I will buy it at any price.
値がいくら安くとも買わぬ
I will not buy it at any price.
値が法外だ
The price is exorbitant―The price is extortionate.
骨董は法外な値なものだ
Curios are bought and sold at fabulous prices―at fancy prices.
家は好い値に売れた
The house sold at a good price.
この品は好い値に売れる
The article commands a good price―fetches a good price.
値が上がる
The price rises―The price goes up―The article rises in price―advances in price―appreciates.
値が下がる
The price falls―The price goes down―The article falls in price―declines in price―depreciates.
値を上げる
to raise the price―advance the price―enhance the price―put up the price
値を下げる
to lower the price―reduce the price―cheapen the price―put down the price
値が出る
An article rises in price―improves in price.
値が出るのを待って持ちこらえよう
I will hold the goods for a rise―stick out for better price.
値が張る
The price comes high―The article comes high―The article is expensive.
値をきめる
to fix the price of the article―set a price on the article
値を引く
to reduce the price―lower the price―abate the price―take something off the price
値を五円だけ引いておきましょう
I will take five yen off the price.
値を引かせろ
to cheapen the price―beat down the price―knock down the price
値をつける
to bid a price―bid for an article―offer a price for an article―make an offer
付け値
the price offered―the offer―the price bidden―the bid
値を言え
Name your price―What price do you ask?
言い値
the price asked―the price named
言い値に買おう
I will buy it at your own price―take it on your own terms.
僕は何でも言い値に買う
I always give the price asked for anything.
決着の値はいくらか
What is your lowest price?
それがぎりぎり決着の値です
That is the very lowest limit I can go―the bottom price―the bed-rock price.

ねあがりまつ〔根上り松〕
〈名〉A pine-tree with its roots raised above ground

ねあきる〔寝飽きる〕
〈自動〉To get tired of lying in bed

content:
ねあげ〔値上げ〕
〈名〉Rise in price; advance in price:(=する) to raise the price; to advance the price; to enhance the price; to put up the price

content.content: 原料騰貴につき値上げ
The price is raised owing to the appreciation of the raw materials.
電車賃は五銭から八銭に値上げになった
The tramway fare has been raised from 5 to 8 sen.
ガスの値上げ
the raising of the gas rate
品物の正札が値上げしてある
The article are marked up.
賃銀の値上げ
an increase of wages―a rise
賃銀の値上げを請求する
to ask for a rise
職工が同盟罷工をして賃銀の値上げを請求した
The men struck for a rise.

content:
ねあせ〔寝汗〕
〈名〉Night-sweat; sweating at night

content.content: 寝汗をかく
to sweat at night―have night-sweats

ねいかん〔佞奸〕
〈形〉Wicked; perverse; sycophantic

content:
ねいき〔寝息〕
〈名〉The breathing of one asleep

content.content: 寝息をうかがう
to listen to one's breathing to ascertain if one is asleep
寝息をうかがって室内へ忍び込んだ
He stole into the room after making sure that the occupant was asleep.

content:
ねいじつ〔寧日〕
〈名〉A peaceful day

content.content: 寧日無し
Not a day passes in peace.
忙しくてほとんど寧日無しという有様だ
I am so busy that I can not rest even on Sunday.

ねいしん〔佞臣〕
〈名〉A wicked courtier; a treacherous subject; a traitor

ねいじん〔佞人〕
〈名〉A perverse man; a villain; a sycophant

ねいす〔寝椅子〕
〈名〉A couch; a lounge; a sofa

content:
ねいべん〔佞弁〕
〈名〉Flattery; adulation; sycophancy

content.content: 佞弁を弄す
to be sycophantic
佞弁家
a sycophant―a toadeater―a toady―a flunkey

content:
ねいりばな〔寝入り端〕
〈副〉When one has just fallen asleep; in one's beauty-sleep

content.content: 火事の出たのは寝入りばなだった
We had just fallen asleep, when we were awakened by the fire.

content:
ねいる〔寝入る〕
〈自動〉
1. To fall asleep; to go to sleep; to drop off to sleep; to fall into a slumber; to sink into a slumber

content.content: 枕をつけるや否やグッスリ寝入った
As soon as I lay down, I fell fast asleep―sank into a sound sleep.

content: 2. ［商業］To be dull; to be slack; to be stagnant; to be inactive; to be languid; to be heavy

content.content: 市況は寝入っている
The market is dull.

content:
ねいろ〔音色〕
〈名〉Timbre; tone

content.content: 琴と三味線は音色が違う
The harp and the samisen differ in timbre.

content:
ねうち〔値打〕
〈名〉
1. (=値踏み)appraisal; valuation; assessment; estimation:(=する) to appraise; to value; to assess; to estimate
2. (=価値)(物の値打)value:(人や物の値打) worth:(人や作品の値打) merit:(賞罰などを受ける値打) desert:(世間の値打、評判) estimation

content.content: 値打のある(人、物、作)
a worthy man―a valuable thing―a work of merit
値打の無い(人、物、作)
a worthless man―a valueless thing―a work of no merit
いくらの値打がある
to be worth so much
何々の値打がある
to be worth reading―worthy of perusal―to deserve praise or blame, reward or punishment―merit attention
この家は一万円の値打がある
The house is worth 10,000 yen.
この品は値段だけの値打がある
The article is worth its price.
この品は三文の値打も無い
The article is valueless―not worth a farthing.
この本は一読の値打がある
The book is worth reading―worth of being read―worthy of a perusal―worth while reading―It is worth while to read the book―The book deserves a perusal―deserves to be read.
彼の成功は賞讚の値打がある
His success deserves praise―His success is worthy of praise―deserving of praise.
彼は賞を受ける値打が無い
He does not deserve the reward―He is unworthy of the reward.
彼の行動は厳罰の値打がある
His conduct deserves a severe punishment.
そこは行ってみる値打がある
The place is worth a visit―worthy of a visit―worth while visiting―It is worth while to visit the place.
富士登山はそれだけの値打がある
The ascent of Mt. Fuji is well worth the trouble.
あの人の演説は聞く値打が無い
He is not worth hearing―unworthy of being heard.
詩人と称すべき値打のある詩人は彼一人だ
He is the only poet worthy of the name.
英語は専門に研究する値打がある
English is worth making a special study of―worthy of being made a special study of―worthy to be made a special study of.
あんな人間は取り合う値打が無い(取るに足らぬ)
Such men are unworthy of notice―beneath notice.
こんな本は批評する値打も無い
The book is beneath criticism.
彼は給料だけの値打がある
He is earning his salary―worth his salt.
給料だけの値打が無い(穀つぶし)
He is not worth his salt.
この事実は注意する値打がある
The fact deserves attention merits attention―The fact is worthy of note―noteworthy.
この発見は何の値打も無い
The discovery is valueless―of no value―destitute of value.
実際上の値打が無い
It is of no practical value―destitute of practical value―practically valueless.
この学科は教育上の値打が無い
The subject is of no educational value―destitute of educational value.
こっけいは変化としての値打があるのみである
The comical is only valuable as a variety.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 青年は元気だけの値打だ
A young man is nothing if he has no spirits―nothing without his spirits.
軍人は勇気だけの値打だ
A soldier is nothing if not brave―nothing without his bravery.
富豪は金だけの値打だ
A millionaire is nothing without his money.

content:
3. 
《a》(値打の上下)

content.content: 値打が上がる、値打が下がる
to rise in value―fall in value
土地は値打が上がるばかりだ
Land goes on rising in value.
人の値打が上がる、値打が下がる
A man rises in the public estimation―falls ［sinks］ in the public estimation.
彼はあの行動で値打を上げた
He has risen in the public estimation through his conduct―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His conduct has raised him in the public estimation―raised him in my estimation―raised him in my opinion.
彼は今度の事で値打を落とした
He has fallen［sunk］in the public estimation through his conduct―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His conduct has lowered［sunk］him in the public estimation―lowered him in my estimation―lowered him in my opinion.
文章が好いから本の値打を上げる
The beauty of the style adds to the value of the book.
文章が悪いから本の値打が下がる
The badness of the style takes from the value of the work.
人の値打を落とす
to detract from one's merits
僕は人の値打を落とそうとするような精神はもうとう無い
Nothing can be farther from my intentions than to detract from otbers' merits.

content: 《b》(値打の認知)

content.content: 値打を認める
to appreciate anything
世間では彼の値打を認めぬ
He is not appreciated―They deny him justice.
皆この本の値打を認めている
Everybody appreciates the work.
健康の値打は人これを失って初めて知る
People do not know the value of health―the blessing of health―till they have lost it.

ねうりする〔値売りする〕
〈他動〉To sell (a house, etc.) at a price higher than the cost; to sell (anything) at a profit

ねえさん〔姐さん〕
〈名〉
1. (=茶屋女)a restaurant waitress
2. (=芸者間の長者)madame

ねえさん〔姉さん〕
〈名〉
1. (=姉)an elder sister
2. (=町家の娘)a girl; a wench

content:
ねおき〔寝起き〕
〈名〉
1. Lying down and getting up:(=する) to lie down and get up:(病人などなら) to get about

content.content: 彼は寝起きが不自由だ
He is a cripple.
独りで寝起きができるようになった
He can get about by himself now.

content: 2. (=目覚め)awaking

content.content: この子は寝起きが悪い
The child will cry on waking.

content: 3. (=起居)one's daily life:(=する) to live

content.content: 彼とはいっしょに寝起きをした
He and I have lived under the same roof.

content:
ねがい〔願い〕
〈名〉
1. (=歎願)a request; an entreaty; a solicitation:(受ける方から言えば) a favour

content.content: 君にお願いがある
I wish to make you a request―I wish to ask a favour of you―I have a favour to ask of you.
お願いがあって来た
I came to ask a favour of you.
お願いがある聞いてくれんか
Will you do me a favour?
願いを聞く
to grant one's request―grant one a favour―do one a favour
願いを聞かぬ(拒絶する)
to refuse one a favour
お願いをお聞き下さらば実にありがたい
If you would grant my request, I should be greatly obliged to you.
お願いを聞いて上げます
I will grant your request―Your request shall be granted.
あなたのお願いなら何でも
I can refuse you no favour―refuse you nothing.
金を貸してくれお願いだ
Lend me some money―I ask it as a favour.
お願いだから金を貸して下さい
De me the favour of, lending me the money.
願いによって本官を免ず
You are hereby relieved of your post at your own request.
後生一生のお願いだから思いとどまって下さい
For God's sake, desist from the attempt!
お願いですから私に免じてゆるしてやって下さい
Pardon him for my sake!
お願いですから命だけ助けてやって下さい
For mercy's sake, spare the poor fellow!

content: 2. (=出願)an application

content.content: 願いを出す
to make ［given in, hand in, send in］an application
高等学校へ入学願いを出した
I have applied for entrance to the High School.
入学願い
an application for entrance
願いを聞き届ける
to grant an application
願の趣き聞届け候事
Your application is hereby granted.
願い書
a written application

content: 3. (=請願)a petition

content.content: 願いを出す
to present a petition―file a petition
願いを聞き届ける
to grant a petition
願の趣き聞届け候事
Your petition is granted.
願いの趣き聞き届け難し
Your petition can not be granted.
願い人
a petitioner

content: 4. (=祈願)a prayer; a petition; an invocation; a supplication

content.content: 神に願いをかける
to put up a prayer―prefer a petition
願いをかなえる
to grant a prayer―answer a prayer―hear a prayer
願いがかなう
to have one's prayer answered―have one's prayer heard
願いがかなった
My prayer is answered―My prayer is heard.

content: 5. (=願望)a wish; a desire

content.content: 願いがかなう
One's desire is fulfilled―One's wishes are realized.
日頃の願いがかなった
I have had my cherished desire fulfilled―realized my cherished wishes.
しからば汝の願いをかなえ得させん
Have then your wish!
願いがかなわない
I can not obtain my wish―get my wish―have my wish.

content:
ねがいごと〔願い事〕
〈名〉One's wishes; one's desire; one's prayer

content.content: 願い事がかなった
My wishes are realized―My desire is fulfilled―My prayer is heard.

content:
ねがいさげ〔願い下げ〕
〈名〉Withdrawal (of a suit)

content.content: 訴訟を願い下げにする
to withdraw a suit
それじゃ願い下げだ
Then I withdraw my suit.
願い下げにして示談に致します
We shall withdraw the suit and settle the matter between ourselves.

content:
ねがいでる〔願い出る〕
〈自他動〉To apply for (examination); to make an application; to come forward

content.content: 官地の払下げを願い出る
to apply for a transfer of government land
志願者を募ると千人以上願い出た
Volunteers were called for, and over a thousand men came forward.

content:
ねがう〔願う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=歎願する)to request (something―one to do something―that one will do something); to beg (one to do something―that one will do something); to ask (one to do something); to entreat (one to do something); to implore (one to do something); to beseech (one to do something); to solicit (a favour―one to do something); to supplicate (to God for mercy); to petition (the government for something); to pray (to the gods for rain, etc.)

content.content: 人に物を願う
to make one a request―ask a favour of one―request a favour of one―solicit a favour of one
君にお願い申したいことがある
I wish to make you a request―I wish to ask a favour of you―I have a favour to ask of you.
ご出席を願います
I beg you will attend―I request your attendance.
どうぞご交際を願います
I request the honour of your acquaintance.
ご留任下さるよう幾重にもお願い申します
I entreat you to stay―I implore you to stay.
ご再考を願う
I beg you will think better of it―I request your reconsideration.
御用命の程願上候
We beg you will favour us with your orders―We request to be favoured with your custom―We solicit your patronage.
後生を願う
to pray for future life
棒ほど願って針ほどかなう
“Pray for a bludgeon, and you get a needle.”［注意］「願います」=「何卒{なにとぞ}」。
ご一報を願います
Please write and let me know.
早速お返事を願います
Please oblige me with an early answer.
その本を拝借願われますまいか
Will you kindly lend me the book?―Will you be so kind as to lend me the book?―Will you have the kindness to lend me the book?―Will you kindly favour me with a loan of the book?
宅へお出でを願われますまいか
Will you do me the favour of calling on me?
万事不都合の無いように願います
See that all is well!

content: 2. (=願望する)to wish (for or to do something); to want (to do something); to desire (something)

content.content: 願う事がかなう
to realize one's wishes―have one's desire fulfilled
ご主人にご面会が願いたいものです
I want to see your master.
これを書留に願います
I want to have this letter registered.
これは願っても無い縁談だ
This is a most desirable match.
それは願っても無いことです
If that isn't just the thing I wish for!
願っても無い好い地位だ
The position is a better one than I could have wished for.

content: 3. (=売る)to sell

content.content: よそよりもお安く願っております
We sell cheaper than at other houses.
毎度願いますからお負け申します
As you are an old customer, you shall have it at the price you name.
おなじみですから安く願っておきます
As you are an old customer, you shall have it cheap.

content:
4. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: ご無理を願ってすみません
I have no claim upon you―no claim on your friendship.
今にお願い申す(君を雇い入れる)ようになるかも知れぬ
The time may come when I shall need your services.
先生、手前どもの小僧をお願い申します(世話を頼む)
I wish to place my boy under your care.

content:
ねがえり〔根返り〕
〈名〉Being torn up by the roots:(=する) to be torn up by the roots

content.content: 木が根返りする
A tree is torn up by the roots.

content:
ねがえり〔寝返り〕
〈名〉
1. Turning in bed:(=する) to turn in bed; to turn in one's sleep
2. (=裏切り)treachery

content.content: 人が寝返り打つ
A man plays false.

content: 3. (=女が乗り換えること)jilting

content.content: 女が寝返り打つ
A woman jilts one lover for another―takes up with another man.

content:
ねがお〔寝顔〕
〈名〉A sleeping face

content.content: あの女は寝顔が好い
She looks well in her sleep.

ねかしもの〔寝かし物〕
〈名〉Dead stock; a drug in the market

content:
ねかす〔寝かす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=寝させる)to put (a child) to bed; to send (a person) to sleep

content.content: 守歌を歌って子どもを寝かす
to sing a child to sleep―lull a child to sleep―lullaby a child
お伽噺を聞かして子どもを寝かす
to talk a boy to sleep
本を読んで聞かして人を寝かす
to read a man to sleep
子どもをそっと寝かしておけ
Let the child sleep!
子どもが終始泣いてお母さんを寝かさない
The child keeps crying, and keeps mamma awake.

content: 2. (=横たえる)to lay (on its side)

content.content: この石を井ばたへ寝かして置け
Lay the stone (on its side) by the well.

content: 3. (=売らずに置く)to let (goods) lie idle

content.content: 品物が寝かしてある
The goods are lying idle.
この品は今売る時機をはぐらすと来年まで寝かさなければならぬ
If we miss this chance to sell these goods, they must lie over till next year.
麹を寝かす
to ferment rice-malt

ねがったりかなったり

content:
ねがったりかなったり〔願ったり叶ったり〕
〈熟語〉To have one's exact desire fulfilled

content.content: それは願ったりかなったりです
That is just what I wish for―If that isn't just the thing I long for!
そんなご相談なら願ったりかなったりです
I should be only too glad to accept such an offer―I would jump at such a proposal.

content:
ねがってもない〔願っても無い〕
〈形〉Most desirable

content.content: それは願っても無い縁談です
It is a most desirable match.
そりゃ願っても無いご相談です
I should be only too glad to accept your offer―I would jump at such a proposal.
それは願っても無いことだ
If that isn't just the thing I wish for!
願っても無い好い地位です
The position is a better one than I could have wished for.

content:
ねがわくは〔願わくは〕
〈副〉I pray (that it may be be so); God grant (that it may be so); I wish, Would that, Would to God (that it may be so); I hope (it may be so); It is to be hoped (that...)

content.content: 願わくは彼の成功せんことを
I hope he may succeed―I wish he may succeed―I pray that he may succeed―God grant that he may succeed!
願わくは味方に勝たしたいものだが
Would that―Would to Heaven―our side may win!
神よ願わくはこの国に幸{さち}を垂れ給え
God bless this land!
願わくは事件の速かに落着せんことを
It is to be hoped that the matter would be brought to a speedy conclusion.

content:
ねがわしい〔願わしい〕
〈形〉Desirable; to be desired

content.content: 平和な解決が願わしい
A peaceful settlement is to be desired.
戦争は願わしくない
A war is to be deprecated―We deprecate war.

content:
ねぎ〔葱〕
〈名〉The Welsh onion; the stone leek

content.content: 玉葱
the onion

content:
ねぎらう〔犒ふ〕
〈他動〉To acknowledge (one's services)

content.content: 労をねぎらう
to thank one for one's trouble―reward one for one's services

ねきりむし〔根切虫〕
〈名〉The cutworm

content:
ねぎる〔値切る〕
〈自動〉To cheapen the price; to beat down the price; to knock down the price; to bargain, chaffer, haggle, higgle (with some one about or over the price)

content.content: ひどく値切る
to drive a hard bargain―beat a bargain―beat down the price
五十円に値切ったら負けた
I beat down the price to 50 yen, and he let me have it for that.
田舎の人は値切らずには物を買わぬ
Country will buy nothing without bargaining.
値切り小切って五十円に負けさした
After much haggling and higgling, I beat down the price to 50 yen.

content:
ねくび〔寝首〕
〈名〉The head of a sleeping man

content.content: 寝首を掻く
to cut off the head of a sleeping man―“murder sleep”

content:
ねぐら〔塒〕
〈名〉A roost; a lie

content.content: 鳥がねぐらに就く
A bird roosts―goes to roost.
鳥がねぐらに就いている
The birds are at roost.
鳥はねぐらへ帰り行く
The birds are flying home to roost.
ねぐらを離れる
to leave the roost

content:
ねぐるしい〔寝苦しい〕
〈形〉Unable to sleep well

content.content: 昨夜は寝苦しかった
I could not sleep last night―I have passed a sleepless night.
寝苦しくて時々目を覚ました
I had a broken sleep.
君も寝苦しそうだった
You had a troubled sleep, too.
寝苦しくて転げまわる
to toss about in bed
夏の夜は寝苦しい
One goes to a sleepless bed in summer.

content:
ねこ〔猫〕
〈名〉
1. A cat:(半固有名詞) puss

content.content: 猫を飼う
to keep a cat
犬は人に付き猫は家に付く
A dog attaches himself to his master, while a cat attaches herself to the house.
猫は鼠を捕る
A cat catches mice.
この猫はよく鼠を捕る
This cat is a good mouser.
猫の留守は鼠の天下
“When the cat is away, the mice will play.”
猫が鳴く
A cat mews or miaows.
牝猫が鳴いて牡猫を呼ぶ
A cat caterwauls.
猫が喉を鳴らす
A cat purrs.
猫が人に顔をこすりつける
A cat rubs her face against you.
猫にひっかかれた
I was scratched by a cat.
猫が顔を洗うと雨が降る
When a cat washes her face, it is a sign of rain.
猫を殺せば七代崇る
“A cat has nine lives.”
猫に鰹節の番
a wolf in the sheepfold―to set a wolf to watch the sheep―trust a cat with milk
窮鼠却て猫を喰む
“A stag at bay is a dangerous foe.”
借りて来た猫のよう
to work like hired people.
(子どもに用をさして)猫にましだ
You are more useful than a cat.
猫の性で熱い物が食べられない
Like the cat, I can not eat anything hot.
猫の目のように変わりやすい
to change colour like the chameleon
猫の額ほどの地面
a bit of ground―a strip of land
猫にまたたび
That is the very thing―just the thing.
猫に小判
to cast pearls before swine
