content:
ねっきょう〔熱狂〕
〈名〉Enthusiasm; fanaticism; mania; craze; rage:(=する) to be enthusiastic; to enthuse; to fanaticize; to have a rage for (books); to have a craze for (curios); to have a mania for (things Western); to be mad on (baseball):(=せる) enthusiastic; fanatic

content.content: 彼は専門に熱狂している
He is enthusiastic in his profession.
珍書に熱狂している
He has a mania for rare volumes.
骨董に熱狂している
He has a craze for curios.
自動車に熱狂している
He has a rage for motoring―He is mad on motoring.
全国民が新説のために熱狂した
The whole nation was wild with enthusiasm for the new doctrine.
氏は熱狂的歓迎を受けた
He was received with an enthusiastic welcome―He received an enthusiastic ovation.
熱狂者
an enthusiast―a fanatic―a zealot

content:
ねつく〔根付く〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: ねづく〔根付く〕

content:
ねつく〔寝付く〕
〈自動〉To get to sleep

content.content: 昨夜は容易に寝つかれなかった
I lay awake for a long while last night.

content:
ねづく〔根付く〕
〈自動〉To take root; to strike root

content.content: この木は根付いたようだ
The tree seems to have taken root.
柳の枝はじきに根付く
A willow-twig easily takes root.

ねつけ〔根付け〕
〈名〉An ornamental button (for suspending a pouch from the belt)

content:
ねっけつ〔熱血〕
〈名〉
1. (=血気)hot blood

content.content: 熱血男子
a hot-blooded man

content: 2. (=熱心)ardour; fervour; heart; soul

content.content: 熱血を注ぐ
to put one's heart into one's work―put one's soul into one's work―put one's life into one's work
熱血を注いだ作だ
It is a work into which he put his heart.
熱血を注いで祈る
to pray fervently―with fervour
熱血を注いで事に従事する
to engage in anything with ardour
満腔の熱血を吐露する
to pour forth one's soul (in song, etc.)

ねっこ〔根っこ〕
〈名〉A stump; a stub

ねつさまし〔熱冷まし〕
〈名〉A febrifuge; an antifebrile

ねっしゃびょう〔熱射病〕
〈名〉Heat-stroke

content:
ねつじょう〔熱情〕
〈名〉Ardour; passion; fire

content.content: 彼は熱情が溢れている
He is full of ardour.
熱情のこもった言葉
impassioned language―burning words
熱情のこもった演説をした
He made an impassioned speech.
この作には天才の熱情が現れている
The work shows the fire of genius.

ねっしょく〔熱色〕
〈名〉A warm colour

content:
ねっしん〔熱心〕
〈名〉
1. Zeal; enthusiasm; ardour; fervour; warmth; eagerness; earnestness; passion; devotion; interest:(=な) zealous (officer); enthusiastic (welcome); ardent (lover of art); fervent (prayer); warm, hearty, cordial (reception); eager (desire); earnest (endeavour); passionate (love of music); devoted (follower); devout (Christian); interested, attentive (listener); assiduous, strenuous (worker); keen (sportsman); close (attention or application); devoted to (one's profession); bent on (gain); intent on (one's studies); keen on (games); mad on (baseball):(=に) zealously; enthusiastically; ardently; fervently; warmly; eagerly; earnestly; passionately; in earnest; with a will:(=する) to enthuse over (a project); to take interest in (educational affairs); to fling oneself into (books); to go, heart and soul, into (a scheme, etc.)

content.content: 彼の熱心は感ずるに余りあり
His zeal is above commendation.
彼がつまらぬことに熱心するのは惜しいものだ
His zeal is worthy of a better cause.
彼の熱心は狂気に近い
His zeal borders on madness.
熱心のあまり用心を忘れてはならぬ
You must not forget your caution in the excess of your zeal―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your zeal must not outrun your caution.
彼は学問に熱心だ
He is an enthusiastic lover of learning.
日本の学生は学問に熱心だ
Japanese students are eager to learn―eager for knowledge―intent on their studies.
あの人は金儲けに熱心だ
He is bent on gain―His heart is set on riches.
彼は芸道に熱心だ
He is an ardent lover of art―an enthusiastic lover of art.
音楽に熱心だ
He has a passion for music―He is a passionate lover of music.
運動に熱心だ
He is keen on outdoor sports―He is an ardent lover of outdoor sports.
銃猟に熱心だ
He is a keen hand at shooting―a keen sportsman.
学事に熱心だ
He takes an interest in educational matters.
職務に熱心だ
He is zealous in his duties―devoted to his duties―intent upon his duties.
専門に熱心だ
He is devoted to his profession―enthusiastic in his profession.
民主主義に熱心だ
He is a warm advocate of democracy―a zealous advocate of democracy.
先生達は授業に熱心だ
The teachers are enthusiastic in their work―They put their heart into their work―Their heart is in their work.
熱心な歓迎
an enthusiastic welcome―a warm reception―a hearty reception―a cordial reception
熱心な愛情
an ardent passion
熱心な祈り
a fervent prayer
熱心な願望
an eager desire―an earnest desire―an ardent desire
熱心な信者
a devout Christian
熱心な門下生
devoted followers
熱心な聴衆
an interested audience―an attentive audience
熱心な働き手
an earnest worker―an assiduous worker―a strenuous worker
熱心な銃猟家
a keen sportsman―a keen hand
熱心な先生
a zealous teacher―an enthusiastic teacher
熱心な学生
an eager student―an earnest student
熱心な改革者
a zealous reformer―a zealous advocate of reform
彼は熱心に働く
He goes about his work in earnest―He works with a will―He puts his heart into his work―His heart is in his work.
熱心に強勉する
He is intent on his studies―He sits close to his studies.
彼は三年の間熱心に英語を研究した
He devoted himself to the study of English―applied himself closely to the study of English―for three years.
先生達は熱心に授業する
The teachers put their heart into their work.
生徒にわからせようと熱心に努める
They earnestly endeavour to make the students understand.
僕は熱心に彼の非を説いた
I earnestly reasoned with him on his folly.
彼は熱心に学者になることを望んでいる
He eagerly desires to make himself a scholar.
熱心に講義を聞いている
He listens to he lecture with attention―with close attention.
熱心に本を読む
He pores over books.
彼らは熱心に彼を賞めている
They are warm in his praises―loud in his praises.
彼らは終夜熱心に祈った
They prayed fervently all night.
彼を熱心に歓迎した
We welcomed him with enthusiasm―accorded him a warm welcome.
彼は熱心に主人に仕える
He serves his master with devotion.
彼は熱心に学校のために尽している
He serves, the school with zeal.
彼は(青年ならば)いかにも青年らしき熱心をもって、(老人ならば)あたかも青年の如き熱心をもって事業に従事した
He engaged in the undertaking with all the ardour of youth.
彼は事業に熱心している
He enthuses over his work.
身体の弱い少年は往々学問に熱心する
Boys of a weak constitution will fling himself into books.
彼は何事にも熱心する質だ
He will go, heart and soul, into any scheme.
金儲けに熱心している
He is bent on gain.
自動車に熱心して居る
He is mad on motoring.
彼は熱心が無い
He lacks enthusiasm―He is wanting in zeal.
彼は仕事に熱心が無い
He has no heart for his work.
熱心を冷ます
to cool one's ardour―damp one's ardour
じきに熱心が冷める
He was soon cool in his ardour―cool in his enthusiasm.

content:
ねっしんか〔熱心家〕
〈名〉An enthusiast; a zealot

content.content: 芸道熱心家
an enthusiastic lover of art―an ardent lover of art
音楽熱心家
a passionate lover of music
銃猟熱心家
a keen sportsman―a keen hand
運動熱心家
an ardent lover of outdoor sports
宗教熱心家
a zealot―a fanatic

content:
ねっする〔熱する〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=熱くなる)to heat; to become heated

content.content: 金属は熱すると膨張する
Metals, when heated, expand.

content: 2. (=激する)to become hot; to get excited

content.content: 皆熱している
They are all excited―in a heat.
非常に熱して議論している
They are arguing at a white heat.
日本人は熱しやすし
The Japanese are an excitable people.
熱しやすきは冷めやすし
“Soon hot, soon cold.”

content: 3. (=熱中する)to enthuse; to be enthusiastic

ねっせい〔熱誠〕
〈名〉Sincerity; devotion; enthusiasm:(=なる) sincere (words); devoted (follower); enthusiastic (welcome, etc.)

content.content: 一言一句氏の熱誠がこもっている
Every word he utters is instinct with sincerity―Every word he utters breathes of sincerity.
彼の熱誠のこもった言葉に感ぜぬ者は無い
His sincere words appeal to every heart.
熱誠をこめて彼の非を説いた
I reasoned with him on his mistake with sincerity.
彼には熱誠な門下がある
He has devoted followers.
彼は熱誠をもって主人に仕えている
He serves his master with devotion.
彼は到る所で熱誠な歓迎を受けた
He met with an enthusiastic welcome wherever he went.
熱誠をもって彼を歓迎した
We welcomed him with enthusiasm.
一行は熱誠をもって迎えられた
The party was received with enthusiasm.
彼は熱誠が溢れている
He is overflowing with enthusiasm.
熱誠溢るる人だ
He is an enthusiastic man.
熱誠湧くが如き歓迎があった
There was an enthusiastic ovation.

ねっせつ〔熱切〕
〈形〉Ardent (passion); fervent (prayer); passionate (lover of music); eager (desire); fiery (words, etc.)

ねっせん〔熱線〕
〈名〉Heat rays; thermic rays

content:
ねつぞう〔捏造〕
〈名〉Fabrication; invention; concoction:(=する) to fabricate, invent, concoct, forge, cook up, trump up, make up (a story)

content.content: これは捏造説だ
This is a fabrication―a trumped up story―a make-up.
全くの捏造説だ
It is a pure fabrication.
根も葉も無い話を捏造する
to make up a story out of the whole cloth

content:
ねったい〔熱帯〕
〈名〉The torrid zone; the tropics:(=の) tropical

content.content: 熱帯地方
the tropical regions―the tropics
熱帯国
a tropical country
熱帯植物
a tropical plant―(集合的に言えば)―the tropical flora

content:
ねっちゅう〔熱中〕
〈名〉Enthusiasm; mania; rage; craze:(=する) to enthuse over, be enthusiastic for (a project); to have a mania for, have a craze for, have a rage for (things Western); to be crazy, be mad (to do something); to be mad for, be mad on (motoring); to burn (to do something); to set one's heart on (riches); to be bent on (money-making); to be intent on (one's studies); to be absorbed in, be engrossed in, be immersed in, be wrapped up in (one's profession); to devote oneself to, give oneself up to (some work); to addict oneself to, abandon oneself to (pleasure); to fling oneself into (books); to go, heart and soul, into (any scheme)

content.content: 彼は何事にでも熱中する質だ
He will go, heart and soul, into any scheme.
いま金儲けに熱中している
He is bent on making money―His heart is set on riches.
この事業に熱中している
He is enthusiastic for the work―He enthuses over the work.
その頃は西洋の文物に熱中する者が多かった
In those days, there was a mania for―a craze for―a rage for―things Western.
彼は何か大事業を為したがって熱中している
He is mad to do―crazy to do―some great deed―He burns to do something great.
あの人は運動に熱中している
He is mad on―mad for―outdoor sports.
語学を修めるには熱中しなけりゃ駄目だ
In order to master a language, you must give your days and nights to its study and practice.
彼は専門に熱中している
He is engrossed in his profession.
仕事に熱中している
He is absorbed in his work―up to the eyes in his work―up to the elbows in his work.
学問に熱中している
He is absorbed in his studies―immersed in his studies―wrapped up in his studies―deep in his studies―intent on his studies.
身体の弱い少年に限って学問に熱中したがる
Boys of a weak constitution are apt to fling themselves into books.

ねつでんき〔熱電気〕
〈名〉Thermoelectricity:(=の) thermoelectric

〈名〉(Degree of) heat

content.content: 熱度を計る
to measure the heat

content:

content.content: 道具などを熱湯消毒する
to scald tools
熱湯で火傷{やけど}する
to get scalded

〈名〉Tumult (of a city)

content:
ねつびょう〔熱病〕
〈名〉A fever

content.content: この熱病は伝染性か
Is this fever infectious?
この熱病は移る
The fever is catching.
熱病にかかる
to sicken of a fever―catch a fever
彼は熱病にかかっている
He has a fever―he is suffering from a fever―ill with a fever―down with a fever.
熱病は一定の経過を経なければ治らなぬ
A fever must run its course.

ねっぷう〔熱風〕
〈名〉A hot wind; a sirocco; a simoom

content:
ねつべん〔熱弁〕
〈名〉Fervour; fervent speech; vehement language; declamation

content.content: 熱弁を揮るう
to declaim―harangue―speak with fervour

content:
ねつぼう〔熱望〕
〈名〉An ardent wish; an eager desire; a longing:(=する) to long for (a sight of one's home); to hunger for or after (knowledge); to thirst for or after (revenge); to pant for or after (freedom); to pine for or after (home); to languish for or after (love); to be eager (for or to do something); to be anxious (for or to do something); to be dying for (something); to be mad for (action); to be crazy for (activity, etc.)

content.content: 彼は成功を熱望している
He is eager for success―eager to succeed.
国民は平和を熱望しておった
The people were longing for peace―dying for peace.
圧制されたる国民は自由を熱望する
An oppressed people pants after liberty.
彼らは知識を熱望すること飢え渇するが如し
They hunger and thirst after knowledge.

ねづもり〔値積り〕
〈名〉Valuation; estimation:(=する) to value (the goods at so much); to estimate (the cost at so much)

content:
ねづよい〔根強い〕
〈形〉
1. Firmly rooted; deeply rooted

content.content: 彼の恨みは根強い(容易に解けぬ)
His enmity is deeply rooted.
日本人の愛国心は根強い(容易に動かぬ)
Japanese patriotism is firmly rooted in the national character.
彼はこの計画に根強く反対する
He makes rooted objections to the scheme.
あの人は何をするにも根強い
He does everything with a firm purpose.
学校を起こすなら根強くやり給え
If you start a school, do it on a firm basis.

content: 2. ［商業］(=強気、上向き)strong, firm (market)

content.content: 市況は根強い
The market is strong―The market is firm.

ねつりきがく〔熱力学〕
〈名〉Thermodynamics

ねつりょうけい〔熱量計〕
〈名〉A calorimeter

content.content: 熱涙を流す

〈形〉Ardent (passion); fervent (speech); passionate (language); vehement (language); hot (words); fiery (temper, etc.)

content.content: 熱烈なる愛情
ardent love―ardent passion
熱烈なる語気
fervent language―vehement language
熱烈なる気性
a fiery temper

content.content: 所有地を根抵当に入れる
to mortgage an estate for cash credit

content:
ねてもおきても〔寝ても起きても〕
〈副〉Waking or sleeping

content.content: この事は寝ても起きても忘れられぬ
I can not forget the matter waking or sleeping―The matter haunts my mind night and day―The matter forms part of myself.
専門のことは寝ても起きても忘れてはならぬ
Your profession must form part of your very existence―You must live your profession.

content:
ねてもさめても〔寝ても覚めても〕

content.content: ねてもおきても〔寝ても起きても〕

content.content: 子どもは根問いする

content.content: 寝床に寝る
to lie in bed―sleep in bed
この寝床に寝た者がある
The bed has been slept in.
この寝床に寝た様子が無い

寝床に入る

寝床を離れる
to get out of bed
寝床を跳び離れる

the anniversary of the death of Buddha

content.content: 夏の病気は寝冷えが多い
Diseases in summer are often due to chills caught in sleep.

content:

content.content: 本は皆値引をして売っている
The books are all sold at reduced prices.
二割の値引きをして売る
They are sold at 20 percent discount.
たくさんお買いになれば多少は値引き致します
If you buy a large quantity, we can reduce the price―shade the price―somewhat.
勧工場ではいっさい値引きをしない

content:

content.content: お指値にては値開き無之候

content.content: 寝不足で気分が悪い

content.content: この家は一万円と値踏みしてある
The house is valued at 10,000 yen.
この品を値踏みしてみて下さい
Please appraise the article―Tell me what it is worth.

content:
ねぶる〔舐る〕
〈他動〉To lick

content.content: 始めは飴をねぶらしておく
I give him line at first.

content:
ねぼう〔寝坊〕
〈名〉
1. (=朝寝坊)a late riser; a lie-a-bed:(=する) to rise late; to oversleep oneself

content.content: 今日は寝坊をした
I have overslept myself this morning.
僕は寝坊の癖が直らなくて困る
I can not break myself of the habit of late rising.

content: 2. (=目覚め難い人)a heavy sleeper; a sound sleeper; a sleepyhead

content.content: 僕は寝坊だが弟は目ざとい
I am a heavy sleeper, while my brother is a light sleeper.

content:
ねぼける〔寝惚ける〕
〈自動〉To be half asleep; to be only half awake

content.content: お前は寝ぼけているから目を覚ませ
You are still half asleep―only half awake. Rouse yourself a bit.
彼は寝ぼけて妙なことを言う
He gets up half asleep, and says queer things.
お門違いだ寝ぼけるない
You have come to the wrong shop. Look sharp about you!
寝ぼけ面
a sleepy face

content:
ねほりはほり〔根堀り葉堀り〕
〈副〉Inquisitively

content.content: 根堀り葉堀り聞く
to be inquisitive
根堀り葉堀り聞く人だ
He is an inquisitive person.
根堀り葉堀り問いただされた
I was subjected to a searching inquiry.

ねま〔寝間〕
〈名〉A sleeping-room; a bedroom; a bedchamber

content:
ねまき〔寝間着〕
〈名〉Night-clothes; a night-shirt

content.content: 彼は寝間着のままで出て来た
He appeared in his night-clothes.

ねみだれがみ〔寝乱れ髪〕
〈名〉Hair dishevelled in sleep

content:
ねみみにみず〔寝耳に水〕
〈名〉A great surprise; a thunderclap

content.content: それを聞いた時は実に寝耳に水であった
The news came as a great surprise to me―The news was a thunderclap to me―I was thunderstruck at the news.

content:
ねむい〔睡い、眠い〕
〈形〉
1. Sleepy; drowsy

content.content: 眠い
I feel sleepy―feel drowsy.
眠くて眠くて目を明けていられない
I am so very sleepy that I can't keep my eyes open.
眠くくなってきた
A sleepy feeling came over me.
うとうと眠くなってきた
A drowsy feeling crept over me.
今日は眠い日だ
It is drowsy weather today.
飯をたくさん食うと眠くなる
A full meal makes one feel sleepy.
春は朝眠い
In spring, it is hard to get up in the morning.

content: 2. (=単調で面白くない)dull; monotonous; humdrum; jog-trot

content.content: 今日は眠い講義を聞いた
I have had to listen to a dull lecture today.
あの先生の講義は眠くなる
His lectures are dull and monotonous―He will send you to sleep.
眠い生活
a humdrum life―a jog-trot existence

content:

〈名〉A sleepy feeling; sleepiness; a drowsy feeling; drowsiness

to feel sleepy―feel drowsy
眠気がさす
A sleepy feeling comes over one.
うとうと眠気がさしてきた
A drowsy feeling stole over me.
眠気を覚ます

〈名〉A cure for sleepiness; something to shake off one's drowsiness; something to keep one awake

content.content: 眠気覚ましに散歩した
I took a walk to shake off my drowsiness.
眠気覚ましに本を開いてみた
I opened a book to keep myself awake―to kill time.

〈形〉Sleepy; drowsy; heavy

君は眠そうな目をしている
You have sleepy eyes―heavy eyes.
彼は眠そうな声で本を読んでいる
He is reading in a drowsy tone.

content:
ねむり〔眠り〕
〈名〉Sleep:(雅文にては) slumber:(昼寝) a nap:(居眠り) a doze

content.content: 眠りに就く
to go to sleep
眠りが覚める
to awake from sleep
昨夜は眠りが足らなかった
I did not get enough sleep last night.
眠りが足らないので気分が悪い
I feel ill from want of sleep.

ねむりぐすり〔眠り薬〕
〈名〉A sleeping-draught; a soporific

content:
ねむる〔眠る〕
〈自動〉To sleep; to slumber:(寝入るの意味なら) to fall asleep; to go to sleep; to fall into a slumber; to sink into a slumber

content.content: 子どもが眠りました
The child has gone to sleep.
子どもが眠っている
The child is asleep.
よく眠っている
The child sleeps well.
僕は枕を付けるとすぐ眠る
I fall asleep as soon as I lie down.
昨夜はよく眠られましたか
Did you sleep well last night?―Have you slept well?―Have you had a good night?
よく眠りました
I have slept well―I have had a good night.
よく眠りません
I slept badly last night―I have had a bad night.
昨夜は少しも眠られなかった
I could not get to sleep last night―I did not sleep a wink last night―I did not get a wink of sleep last night.
夜通し眠られなかった
I kept awake all night.
暑くて眠られなかった
I could not sleep for the heat―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The heat kept me awake.
心配で夜眠られない
I can not sleep for anxiety o'nights―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Anxiety keeps me awake o'nights.
騒々しくて眠られなかった
I could not sleep for the noise―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The noise kept me awake.
犬が一晩中ほえて眠られなかった
The dogs kept barking all night, and kept me awake.
寝る前に話をして寝ると眠れる
A chat makes me sleep.
茶を飲んで寝ると眠れない
Tea keeps me awake.
眠ってはいけませんよ
You must not go to sleep―You must keep awake.
よく眠る男だ
He is a good sleeper―a heavy sleeper.
ぐっすり眠る
to sleep soundly
ぐっすり眠っている
He is sound asleep―fast asleep.
子どもがすやすや眠っている
The child is sleeping calmly―sleeping peacefully.
僕は眠くない時は本を読んで眠る
When I do not feel sleepy, I read myself to sleep.
彼は眠るように死んだ
He passed away calmly―died a calm death.
眠れる獅子
a sleeping lion
(冬期)眠れる熊
a dormant bear
草木も眠る丑満時
It is the witching hour of night.

ねめつける〔睨め付ける〕

I sat down at the root of a tree.
根本から髪を切る
to cut off the hair at the root
マストが根本から折れた
The mast went over the side.

根も葉も無い話をこしらえる
to make up a story out of the whole cloth

content.content: 閨の睦言
the soft whisperings of the bedchamber
閨のお伽をする
to do bedservice

content:

〈名〉Aim

content.content: 狙いをつける
to take aim
よく狙いをつけて撃て
Take a good aim before you shoot!
狙いを定める
to take a steady aim
狙いが定まらぬ
His aim is unsteady.
手が震えて狙いが定まらぬ
My hands shake, and prevent my taking a steady aim.
彼は狙いが好い
He shoots well―shoots straight.
狙いが悪い
He shoots wide―shoots wild.
狙いがはずれる
to miss one's aim―miss one's mark
あの人は狙いがはずれたことが無い
He never missed his mark―He is a dead shot.
狙いが狂う
One's aim is disturbed.
何かで狙いが狂った
Something disturbed my aim.
狙い違わず弾は命中した
True to its aim, the shot hit the mark.

1. To aim at (a mark); to point, level (a gun at a man); to present (a pistol at a man); to cover (a man with a pistol); to draw a bead on (a bird); to sight, lay (a gun):(自動詞に用いれば) to take aim; to take a sight

content.content: 標的を狙う
to aim at a mark
標的を狙って撃つ
to shoot at a mark
人を狙って発砲する
to fire at a man
鳥を狙う
to aim at a bird―draw a bead on a bird
鹿を狙って一発撃った
I got a shot at―had a shot at―a stag.
小銃を狙う
to level a gun―point a gun―at a mark
大砲を狙う
to lay a gun―sight a gun
ピストルで泥棒を狙った
I presented a pistol at the burglar―covered the burglar with a pistol.
よく狙って撃て
Take a good aim before firing!

content: 2. (=窺う、目ざす)to watch for (the enemy); to have an eye to (one's property); to aspire to (a lady's hand); to mark, fix upon, fasten upon (one for a victim)

content.content: 猫が鼠を狙っている
The cat is watching for a mouse.
相手の隙を狙え
Watch for a moment when your man is off his guard!
悪党の伯(叔)父が彼の財産を狙っている
A scoundrel of an uncle has an eye to his property.
彼は女の金を狙って貰ったのだ
He married her with an eye to her money.
彼は校長の椅子を狙っている
He has an eye to the post of principal.
その地位を狙って運動している
He is making interest with an eye to the position.
彼は主人の娘を狙っている
He aspires to the hand of his master's daughter.
スリに狙われた
I was fastened upon by a pickpocket for a victim.
彼は僕の命を狙っているのか
Does ha seek my life?

content.content: 行列を成して市中を練りまわす
They make a procession, and march through the streets―parade the streets.

content:
ネル
〈名〉Flannel

content.content: 綿ネル
cotton-flannel

content:
ねる〔寝る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=臥す)to lie down; to lay oneself down; to stretch oneself; to throw oneself

content.content: 彼は寝たっきりとうとう起きなかった
He lay down, never to rise again.
草の上に寝た
I threw myself on the grass.
彼は草の上に寝ている
He is lying on the grass.
座敷の真中に寝ている
He is stretched in the middle of the room.
背中合わせに寝よう
Let us lie back to back!
恩人の方へ足を向けても寝ない
I do not lie down at night with my feet toward my benefactor.
誰と寝る、抱いて寝る、抱かれて寝る
to lie with―sleep with―a man or a woman
寝て食えば山も空し
Idleness will consume a mountain of wealth.

content: 2. (=床に就く)to go to bed; to retire to repose; to turn in

content.content: もう寝る時間だ
It is time to go to bed―It is bed-time.
まだ寝るには早い
It is too early to go to bed.
何時に寝るか
What time do you go to bed?―retire?―turn in?
今晩は早く寝よう
Let us go to bed early tonight.
昨夜は遅く寝た
We went to bed late―retired late―last night.
僕は早く寝て早く起きる
I keep early hours―keep good hours.
彼は遅く寝て遅く起きる
He keeps late hours―keeps bad hours.
九時か十時頃まで寝ている
He lies in bed till nine or ten.
皆はまだ寝ている(まだ夜中だ)
They are still in bed―snug in bed.
もう寝ている(もう夜中だ)
They are already in bed―snug in bed.
この薬は夜寝る前にお飲みなさい
Take the medicine the last thing at night.
夜寝ずにいる
to sit up―stay up
彼は遅くまで寝ない(夜更しする)
He sits up till late.
ひと晩寝なかった(徹夜した)
I sat up all night.
寝ずに人の帰りを待つ
to sit up for one
今晩は帰りが遅いから寝てくれ(寝ずに待つことはない)
Do not sit up for me, for I shall be late this evening.
寝ずに介抱する
to sit up with an invalid―watch with an invalid

content: 3. (=眠る)to sleep; to slumber:(寝入るの意味なら) to fall asleep; to go to sleep; to fall into a slumber; to sink into a slumber

content.content: 子どもが寝ましたね
The child has gone to sleep.
子どもが寝ている
The child is asleep.
子どもがよく寝ている
The child sleeps well.
僕は枕をつけるとすぐ寝る
I fall asleep as soon as I lie down.
昨夜はよく寝ましたか
Have you slept well?―Have you had a good night?
よく寝ません
I have not slept well―I have had a bad night.
昨夜は少しも寝られなかった
I did not sleep a wink last night―I did not get a wink of sleep last night―I kept awake all night.
寝ても時々目を覚ます
I have a broken sleep.
ぐっすり寝られない
I have a troubled sleep.
おちおち寝られない
I can not sleep in peace.
暑くて寝られなかった
I could not sleep for the heat―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The heat kept me awake.
心配で寝られなかった
I could not sleep for anxiety―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Anxiety kept me awake.
騒々しくて寝られなかった
I could not sleep for the noise―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The noise kept me awake.
犬がひと晩吠えて寝られなかった
The dogs kept barking all night, and kept me awake.
よく寝る男だ
He is a good sleeper―a heavy sleeper―a sound sleeper.
寝てはいけませんよ
You must not go to sleep―You must keep awake.
ぐっすり寝る
to sleep soundly―sleep a sound sleep
ぐっすり寝ている
He is sound asleep―fast asleep.
子どもがすやすや寝ている
The child is sleeping calmly―sleeping peacefully.
僕は眠くない時は本を読んで寝る
When I do not feel sleepy, I read myself to sleep.
昼間寝て夜働く人がある
Some people sleep by day and work by night.
野獣は日中寝て夜間出て来る
The wild beasts sleep by day and come out by night.
(即答をせずに)一晩寝て考える
to sleep on a question―sleep over a question
一晩寝ると治る
A night's rest will set you up.
寝ると酔いが醒める
You will sleep yourself sober―sleep off your debauch.
この寝床に寝た者がある
The bed has been slept in.
一つ寝床に二人で寝る
to sleep double
枕を高うして寝る
to sleep in peace―sleep on a calm conscience
市民は枕を高うして寝られる
The townspeople can now sleep in peace.
悪事を為す者は枕を高うして寝られぬ
Evil-doers can not sleep on a calm conscience.
寝て暮らす
to sleep one's life away
このことは寝ても起きても忘れられぬ
I can not forget the matter waking or sleeping―The matter haunts me night and day―The matter forms part of myself.
専門のことは寝ても起きても忘れられぬ
My profession forms part of my very existence―I live my profession.

content: 4. (=病床に臥す)to lie on a bed of illness; to be laid on one's back; to be laid up with (an illness); to be confined to one's bed; to keep one's bed; to take to one's bed

content.content: 彼は病気で寝ている
He is laid up with an illness―He is ill abed―He is confined to his bed―He is laid by the heels―He must keep his bed―(文章なら)―He lies on a bed of illness―He is laid on his back.
久しく病気で寝ている
He has long been confined to his bed―long been laid on his back―long been laid up―He is bedridden.
大病で寝ている
He is laid up with a serious illness.
リウマチが起こって寝ている
He is laid up with an attack of rheumatism.
熱病で寝ている
He is down with a fever.
寝てからひと月になる
It is a month since he took to his bed.
君は寝ていなけりゃいけませんよ
You must keep your bed.
寝るほどのことでもない
I need not keep my bed.
商品が寝る
Goods lie idle.
資本が寝ている
The capital is lying idle.

content:
ねん〔念〕

The sight of smoke suggests to one's mind the idea of fire.

content: 2. (=感情、感覚)feeling; sense

content: 3. (=希望)desire; wish

One's desire is fulfilled―One's wishes are realized.

content: 4. (=注意、用心)attention; care; caution; precaution

念を入れて選んだ

It is an elaborate design.
念の入り過ぎた意匠だ

〈名〉The Department of Agriculture and Forestry

content:
のがい〔野飼い〕
〈名〉Pasturage

content.content: 野飼いにする
to pasture cattle―put cattle to pasture―turn out a horse to grass
馬が野飼いにしてある
The horses are allowed to run wild.

content:
のがけ〔野掛け〕
〈名〉A picnic

content.content: 野掛けに行く
to go on a picnic―go picnicking

content:
のがす〔遁す〕
〈他動〉To let go

content.content: 機会を遁す
to miss an opportunity―let slip an opportunity

content:
のがれる〔遁れる〕
〈自他動〉To escape (punishment); to evade (a tax); to elude (pursuit); to shirk (one's duty); to shuffle off (one's responsibility); to miss (an accident); to be freed from, free oneself from (an obligation); to be excused from, excuse oneself from (a task); to be exempted from, be rejected from (military service); to be released from (a promise); to be discharged from (obligations); to be delivered from (a danger); to be rid of, get rid of (trouble); to be relieved of (trouble); to get off

content.content: 徴兵を遁れる
to be exempted from military service―miss being a soldier
彼は身体不合格のため徴兵を遁れた
He was rejected from military service owing to physical disqualification―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Physical disqualification exempted him from military service.
危難を遁れる
to escape danger―be delivered from a danger
死を遁れる
to escape death―save oneself from death―save one's life―save one's neck
万死を遁れる、虎口を遁れる
to be snatched from the jaws of death
死は遁れられぬ
Death is inevitable.
困難を遁れる
to escape a difficulty
この煩いを遁れたらありがたい
I should be thankful to be rid of―be relieved of―this trouble.
罰を遁れる
to escape punishment―elude punishment―evade punishment―go scot-free―get off
罰金で遁れた
I got off with a fine.
法網を遁れる
to get out of the clutches of the law
義務を遁れる
to shirk one's duty―evade a duty―be freed from one's obligations―be discharged from one's obligations
責任を遁れる
to shirk one's responsibility―shuffle off one's responsibility
危ないところを遁れた
I had a narrow escape―It was a close shave.
間髪を容れずというところを遁れた
I had a hairbreadth escape―I escaped by a hair's breadth―I missed it by the skin of my teeth.
彼は僅に身をもって遁れた
He escaped with bare life.
その場を遁れる
to effect one's retreat―make good one's escape

content:
のき〔軒〕
〈名〉The eaves

content.content: 軒の玉水
raindrops falling from the eaves
軒の玉水がポタポタ落ちる音を聴いて寝ておった
I lay listening to the drip-drop from the eaves.
燕は軒の下に巣を食う
The swallow builds under the eaves.
軒の下に雨宿りする
to take shelter from the rain under the eaves
ちょっと軒下を拝借しました
I have taken shelter under your eaves.
軒下に忍ぶ
to eavesdrop―stand under one's window
軒下に忍ぶ者があるとは夢にも知らずに二人は打ち明け話をした
They were making confidences, quite unconscious that there was an eavesdropper.
家は軒を並べている
The houses stand in a row―(二軒の家なら)―The houses stand side by side.

のぎく〔野菊〕
〈名〉The wild chrysanthemum

content:
のきなみ〔軒並〕
〈名〉A row of houses

content.content: 軒並みが揃っている
The houses are of the same height―The street is regular.

content:
のきば〔軒端〕
〈名〉The edge of the eaves

content.content: 軒端の梅
the plum-tree by the eaves

content:
のく〔退く〕
〈自動〉To get out of the way; to make way (for some one); to clear the track

content.content: 邪魔だからそこ退け
Get out of my way!
自動車が通るから退け
Get out of the way of the motor-car!
殿様がお通りだから皆退け
Make way for the prince!
(競走が始まるから)そこ退け
Clear the track!
(巡査が乞食に向かって)そこ退け
Move on!

のけぞりかえる〔のけ反り返る〕
〈自動〉To lean back; to throw oneself back; to throw back one's head

content:
のけもの〔除け者〕
〈名〉One left out in the cold

content.content: あれは除け者だ
He is left out in the cold.
除け者にする
to leave one out in the cold
除け者になる
to be left out in the cold

content:
のける〔除ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=除く)to exclude; to get rid of (anything); to leave (one) out in the cold

content.content: 新内閣を組織した時、伯は除けられた
When the new ministry was formed, the count was left out in the cold.
分数を除ける
to get rid of fractions

content: 2. (=省く)to omit; to leave out

content.content: 余計なものを除ける
to omit superfluities―leave out superfluities

content: 3. (=取り去る)to remove; to get (anything) out of the way

content.content: 邪魔者を除ける
to remove an obstacle―get anything out of the way
この卓子が邪魔だから除けろ
Get this table out of the way!

content:
のこぎり〔鋸〕
〈名〉A saw

content.content: 鋸で木を挽く
to saw wood
鋸の歯
the teeth of a saw
鋸の目を立てる
to set a saw
機械鋸
a sawing-machine
円盤鋸
a circular saw
鉉掛鋸
a frame-saw

のこぎりざめ〔鋸鮫〕
〈名〉The saw-fish

のこぎりそう〔鋸草〕
〈名〉The milfoil; the yarrow

のこぎりびき〔鋸挽き〕
〈名〉(The penalty of) being sawn

content:
のこす〔残す〕
〈他動〉
1. To leave:(死んで残す、残して行く)to leave (anything) behind one; to bequeath (a fortune to one)

content.content: ご馳走はきれいに食ってしまわないで体裁に少し残すものだ
You should leave some for manners' sake.
僕を一人残して皆行ってしまった
They all went away, leaving me to myself.
僕一人残された
I was left to myself.
虎は死して皮を残す
A tiger leaves a skin behind him.
人死して名を残す
A man leaves a name behind him.
彼は妻子を残して死んだ
He left a wife and family behind him.
彼が死んで残すものは借金ばかりだ
He will leave nothing but debts behind him.
彼女は田舎に子どもを残して来た
She has left her children behind her in the country.
彼の父は彼に身代を残した
His father left him a fortune―bequeathed a fortune to him.
後世に名を残す
to leave one's name to posterity―immortalize one's name―perpetuate one's fame
歴史に名を残す
to leave one's mark on history
文学に名を残す
to leave one's mark on literature
仕残した仕事がたくさんある
I have left many things undone.
読み残した本がまだある
I have left some books unread.

content: 2. (=取って置く、惜しんで置く)to save (something for future use); to reserve (something for some one)

content.content: 米を残して飢饉年の備えにする
to save rice for a bad year
この仕事を君の分として残しておいた
I have reserved this task for you.
金を残す
to save money
彼はだいぶ残したらしい
He seems to have saved much.
残すどころか借金をせぬというばかりだ
So far from saving, it is all I can do to keep out of debt.
彼は金を残して死んだ
He died rich.
百万円残して死んだ
He died worth a million.

content:
3. 
〈その他〉

content.content: そんなことをすると悪例を残す
It will create a bad precedent.
一銭も残さずに金を使ってしまった
I have spent the money to the last sen―I have spent every sen of the money.
彼は一滴も残さずに酒を飲んでしまった
He has drunk every drop of the wine.
一粒も残さずに飯を食ってしまった
He has eaten every grain of the rice.

content:
のこのこ
〈副〉Coolly; calmly; unconcernedly; shamelessly

content.content: 彼は会がすむ時分になってのこのこやって来た
He coolly put in an appearance when the meeting was about close.
案内も無くのこのこ入って来た
He came in with a calm air without being shown in.
あれ見給え、のこのこやって来おる
Look there! He comes along with an unconcerned air.
あんな失敗をやっておいてよくものこのこ帰って来られたものだ
I wonder how he can have the face to come back after such a failure.
こんな下手をやっておいてどうしてのこのこ帰られよう
How can I have the face to go home after such a blunder!

content:
のこらず〔残らず〕
〈副〉All; one and all; everything; every one of them; to the the last man; to a man; without (an) exception

content.content: 委細の様子は残らず聞いておりました
I have overheard all your talk.
これで残らずです
(数なら)These are all―(量なら)―This is all.
知っていることを残らず申し上げます
I will tell you everything I know.
生徒は残らず知っている
I know all the students―I know the students, every one of them―every mother's son of them.
残らず戦死した
They fell fighting to a man―to the last man.
借金を残らず返した
I have paid all my debts―I have paid my debts to the last sen.
船長は残らず日本人だ
The captains are all Japanese, without an exception.

content:
のこり〔残り〕
〈名〉
1. The rest; the remainder; the remnant; the residue; what is left:(=の) remaining; residual

content.content: 半分食って残りをやってしまった
We are half, and gave away the rest.
食えるだけ食って残りは缶詰めにする
We eat all we can, and can the remainder.
彼はもと有った財産の僅かばかりの残りで暮らしている
He lives on a small remnant of his property―what is left of his property.
借金を払って財産の残りは親類に分配した
After the debts were paid, the residue of the property―what was left of the property―was distributed among his relations.
残り無く
exhaustively
彼は残り無く英語を研究した
He has made an exhaustive study of English.
事件は残り無く調査した
The matter has been exhaustively investigated―probed to the bottom.
残り少なになる
There is little left―There is not much left.
今年も残り少なになった
The year draws to a close.
金は残り少なになった
My money is running low.

content: 2. (=金の残り)the balance

content.content: この金で勘定を払って残りはお前にやる
Pay the bill with this money, and you shall have the balance.
まだ金の残りがあるか
Is there any money left?

content: 3. (=残り物)leavings; remains; remnants

content.content: お残りを頂戴
Give me your leavings!
お残りを頂戴さしてやる
You shall have the remains of the feast―the remnants of my dinner.

content:
のこりおしい〔残り惜しい〕
〈形〉Regrettable

content.content: 彼が死んだのはいかにも残り惜しい
His death is deeply to be regretted.
実に残り惜しいことだ
It is, indeed, a regrettable event.
皆君の去るのを残り惜しく思っている
Everybody regrets your departure.
彼は残り惜しそうにして家を出た
He left the house with a regretful look―with a lingering air.
皆去っても彼一人残り惜しそうに後へ残った
All left, but he alone lingered behind.

のこりに〔残り荷〕
〈名〉Unsold stock

content:
のこりもの〔残り物〕
〈名〉Leavings; remains; remnants; scraps; the last one left

content.content: 残り物になる
to be left in the basket
ご馳走の残り物
the remnants of one's dinner―the remains of the feast
膳部の残り物
leavings and scraps from the table
(豚に食わせる)台所の残り物
swill―hogwash
残り物に福あり
The last one brings luck―(英国では)―The last one brings “a beautiful wife and ten thousand pounds a year.”

content:
のこる〔残る〕
〈自動〉To remain; to be left

content.content: 金が残っているか
Is there any money left?―Have you any money left?
十円残っている
There is ten yen left―We have ten yen left.
ビタ一文も残らぬ
There is not a farthing left.
本がだいぶ残った
We have left much of the book unread.
酒が少し残った
There is some wine left undrunk.
彼が死んで残るものは借金ばかりだ
He will leave nothing but debts behind him.
疱瘡は痕が残る
The smallpox leaves marks behind it.
皆行って僕だけ後に残った
They all went, myself alone remaining behind―They all went, leaving me behind.
僕が一人残った
I was left to myself.
火事で金庫だけ無事に残った
In the fire, the safe alone remained intact.
品物が売れ残っている
Some goods are left unsold―left on my hands.
最後まで残ったのは四十七人
Forty-seven men remained faithful to the last.
名が残る
One lives in the memory of men―One lives in song and tale.
この出来事は今なお村の伝説に残っている
The event still lives in the village tradition.
その時は雪がまだ残っていた
The snow still lay on the ground.
彼の声はまだ耳に残っている
His voice still rings in my ears.
記憶に残る
to be impressed on one's memory
あの出来事は深く記憶に残っている
The event is deeply impressed on my mind.
金が残る
to grow rich
彼は金が残るばかりだ
He can not help growing rich.
いくら働いても残らぬ
However hard I may work, I do not find myself growing rich.
城には昔日の面影が残っている
The castle still retains some traces of its former grandeur.
民主主義は永く残りそうだ
Democracy has come to stay.
君は残って大詰めを見て行くか
Will you stop for the final act?
僕は残って課外講義を聴いて行く
I shall stop for the special lecture.
後に残りし妻や子は
My wife and little ones I leave behind―
どうして其日を送るやら
How shall they their means of living find?

content:
のこるくまなく〔残る隈無く〕
〈副〉Everywhere; in every nook and corner:(前置詞に用いれば)all over; throughout

content.content: 残る隈無く捜した
I have looked everywhere―in every nook and corner.
彼は日本国中残る隈無く歩いている
He has travelled all over the country―throughout the land―over the length and breadth of Japan.

のさばる
〈自動〉To have everything one's own way; to carry matters with a high hand; to lay down the law; to be arrogant

content:
のし〔熨斗〕
〈名〉A thin strip of dried sea-ear folded up in paper of a certain shape; a symbol of good will (attached to a present)

content.content: 熨斗を付ける(相当するは)
to tie a present with a ribbon
熨斗を付けて進呈する
to present one with anything in due form
熨斗を付けて進上しよう
It shall be a present to you―a free gift to you.
欲しけりゃ熨斗を付けて上げる
If you want it, you are welcome to it―You may have it, and welcome!
紙入を掏られた、欲しけりゃ熨斗を付けてやらぁ
A pickpocket has taken my pocket-book. He may have it, and welcome!
そんな物は熨斗を付けられてもまっぴらだ
I would not have it at a gift.
彼がそんなことを言ったか、その悪口なら熨斗を付けて返上する
Whatever he may say of me, I can say it of him with interest―“What is sauce for the goose is sauce for the gander.”

のじ〔野路〕
〈名〉A path across a field

content:
のじゅく〔野宿〕
〈名〉Bivouac:(=する) to bivouac; to camp out; to sleep in the open air

content.content: 彼らは人の軒の下に野宿する
They sleep under people's eaves.

content:
のじん〔野陣〕
〈名〉Bivouac

content.content: 野陣を張る
to bivouac

content:
のす〔伸す〕
〈他動〉(=のばす)to spread (a piece of paper); to smoothe out (crumpled paper); to planish (sheet-metal, etc.)

content.content: 布を火のしでのす
to iron linen―smoothe linen
Roller で鉄板をのす
to roll an iron-plate
写真をのす
to planish a photograph
羽翼を十分にのす
to give free play to one's ability―give full scope to one's talent―give full swing to one's genius

content:
〈自動〉
1. (=立身する)to get on in life; to rise in the world
2. (=金持ちになる)to grow rich

のせる〔載せる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=物を物の上に載せる)to place, put, set, lay (one thing on another); to put (anything) on the top of (a pile)

content.content: この本をあの棚に載せて
Place this book on that shelf!
茶碗を盆に載せて(持って行け)
Set the cups on a tray―Take the cups on a tray.
僕の手の上に君の手を載せてご覧
Lay your hand on mine.
薪を積んだ上に棺を載せた
They put the coffin on the top of a pile of wood.

content: 2. (=記載する)to record (an event in history); to put (one's name on the books); to enter (one's name in the books); to place (one's name on the list); to give (an account in a newspaper); to publish (an article in a newspaper); to insert, put (a notice in the papers)

content.content: 出来事を記録に載せる
to put an event on record
出来事を歴史に載せる
to record an event in history
この出来事は歴史に載せる価値がある
The event is worth recording in history―worth putting on record.
名前を名簿に載せる
to place one's name on the list―enter one's name in the books―put one's name on the rolls―enroll one's name―register one's name
各新聞がその記事を載せている
All the papers give an account of the affair.
あなたの論文は明日の新聞に載せます
We shall publish your article in tomorrow's issue.

content:
のせる〔乗せる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=馬や車や船が人を乗せる)(a horse) carries (a man); (a train or a ship) carries (passengers); (a train) takes in (passengers at a station); (a ship) takes (passengers) on board; (a ship can) accommodate (so many passengers)

content.content: 馬が人を乗せる
A horse carries a man.
あの列車は貨物列車で乗客を乗せない
That is a goods train, and does not carry passengers.
列車が停車して乗客を乗せる
A train stops at a station to take in passengers.
乗客を乗せる船は客船
A passenger-boat carries passengers.
船は横浜で乗客を乗せる
The ship takes passengers on board at Yokohama.
あの船は軍隊を乗せている
That ship has troops on board.
この汽船は三千人の乗客を乗せることができる
The steamer can accommodate 3,000 passengers.
船が途中で乗客を乗せる
A steamer picks up passengers.

content: 2. (=人を馬や車や船に乗せる)［注意］訳語一定せず。

content.content: 人を馬に乗せる
to give one a ride on a horse
人に手を貸して馬に乗せる
to give one a leg up
僕の自動車に乗せてやろう
I will give you a lift in my motor-car.
人に手を貸して馬車に乗せる
to help one into a carriage
人を舟に乗せる
to give one a ride in a boat
人を船に乗せる
to take one on board
僕をその船に乗せてくれんか
Will you take me on board?
人を汽車に乗せる
to place one in a train

content: 3. (=だます)to impose upon, put upon (one); to take (one) in; to do (one)

content.content: うっかりすると乗せられるぞ
You must not suffer yourself to be imposed upon.
まんまと乗せられた
I was nicely taken in―done brown.
口車に乗せる
to cajole one―wheedle one
口車に乗せられた
I was cajoled―wheedled.
計略に乗せられた
I fell into a snare―walked into a trap―fell a victim to his schemes.

content:
のぞいて〔除いて〕
〈前置詞相当〉But; except; save:(文頭に置けば)excepting:(文尾に置けば)excepted:(その他)with the exception of ; exclusive of ; beyond; outside

content.content: 一つ除いて皆知っている
I know all of them but one.
一つ除いて皆知らぬ
I know none of them but one.
彼の作は最近のを除いて皆読んだ
I have read all his works except his last―save his last.
最近の作を除いて彼の作を皆持っている
Excepting his latest,―With the exception of his latest,―I have all his works.
人は皆金銭のために働く、ここにいる人は無論除いて
Men work for money, the present company always excepted.
生徒は少数を除いては皆地方出だ
The students are, with a few exceptions, all from the provinces.
召使いを除いて家族十人
There are ten of us, exclusive of the servants.
彼の家族を除いては彼を知っている者は無い
Outside his family, no one knows him.
人類を除いては泣くことや笑うことのできるものはない
Beyond humanity, no creature can weep or laugh.

content:
のぞく〔除く〕
〈他動〉To exclude; to except; to remove; to eliminate; to obviate; to omit; to leave out; to get rid of

content.content: 組合から除く
to exclude a man from the union
戸主を除く
Householders are excepted.
二三人除いては皆有妻だろう
If we except a few, they must all be married.
役人を除く
to remove an official
原因を除く
to remove the cause
煩いを除く
to get rid of troubles―obviate troubles
情実を除く
to eliminate personal considerations
余計な言葉を除く
to omit unnecessary words―leave out superfluous words
無能者を除く
to weed out the incompetent
この一章を除いたらこの本は無価値になる
If this chapter is omitted, the book will be worthless.
君側の奸を除く
to rid the court of wicked men
戸籍を除く
to remove one's name from the register

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 国籍を除く
to denationalize a citizen
艦籍を除く
to withdraw a ship from the navy
学籍を除く
to strike one's name off the books
名前を名簿から除く
to strike one's name off the list
悪弊を除く
to put down evils―suppress evils
道路の障害物を除く
to clear the passage of obstacles
水道の水は黴菌が除いてある
The city-water is free from bacilli.
この品を除いて後は皆買おう
I will leave this article, and take all the rest―I will buy all the articles except this one.(何を)除いて→『のぞいて〔除いて〕』

content:
のぞく〔覗く〕
〈自他動〉
1. To look (in at the window―out of the window); to peep (into a room―at or through a hole)

content.content: 窓から覗く
(外からなら)to look in at the window―(内からなら)―look out of the window
室内を覗く
to peep into a room
鍵孔から覗く
to peep at the keyhole―peep through the keyhole
節孔から覗く
to peep in at a knot-hole―peep through a knot-hole
隙間から覗く
to peep through a crevice
隣りの人の答案をそっと覗く
to peep at one's neighbour's paper
垣の上から覗く
to look over the fence
崖から下を覗く
to look over a precipice
井戸を覗く
to look down a well
人の顔をこっそり覗く
to look furtively in one's face
本を覗いて見る
to peep into a book―dip into a book
フランス語はちょいと覗いただけだ
I have only peeped a little into French.
芝居などは覗いたことも無い
I have never been inside a theatre.
ちょっと芝居を覗いて行こうじゃないか
Let us have a look at the play!
足の親指が靴の穴から覗いている
The toe sticks out of the shoe.

content: 2. (=ちょいと訪問する)to look in; to drop in; to blow in; to pop in

content.content: いつか晩にでもお覗きしよう
I will drop in of an evening some day.

content:
のそだち〔野育ち〕
〈形〉Wild

content.content: 子どもらは野育ちだ
The children are allowed to run wild.

content:
のそのそ
〈副〉In a hulking manner:(=した) hulking; unwieldy; ungainly

content.content: のそのそ歩く
to hulk about―hulk along
のそのそした男だ
He is a big hulking fellow.
のそのそした身体
an unwieldy body
のそのそした姿
an ungainly figure

content:
のぞましい〔望ましい〕
〈形〉Desirable; to be desired

content.content: 望ましい地位だ
It is a desirable position.
平和な解決が望ましい
A peaceful settlement is to be desired.
戦争は望ましくない
A war is undesirable―A war is to be deprecated―We deprecate a war.

content:
のぞみ〔望み〕
〈名〉
1. (=願望)a wish, wishes; a desire; an aspiration, aspirations

content.content: 望みを懐く
to cherish a desire
彼は洋行の望みを懐いている
He wishes to go abroad―He is desirous to go abroad.
法外な望みを懐いている
He cherishes inordinate desires.
望みを遂げる、望みを達する、望みがかなう
to obtain one's desire―realize one's wishes―get one's wish―have one's wish
望みがかなった
I have realized my wishes―My wishes are realized―My wishes are fulfilled―My desire is gratified.
人の望みをかなえる
to fulfill one's wishes
親の望みをかなえるようにしたいものだが
I should be glad to fulfil my father's wishes.
望みを満たす
to gratify one's desire
望みにかなう(望み通りにいく)
to meet one's wishes
お望み通りにいけばよいか
I wish things would meet your wishes―turn out as you wish.
地位は望み通りの地位です
The position is all I can wish―all I can desire.
望み以上の地位です
The position is a better one than I could have wished.
人の望みに応ずる(望み通りにする)
to comply with one's wishes
お望み通りに致します
I will comply with your wishes―do as you wish.
お望み通りに規則を変更しました
I have altered the rule in compliance with your wishes.
望みに反する
to run counter to one's wishes
君の行動は僕の望みに反する
You have acted contrary to my wishes―against my wishes.
彼はあの地位に望みをかけている
He wishes to secure the position―He is desirous to secure the position.
望みを起こす
to be seized with a desire
彼はにわかに結婚の望みを起こした
He was seized with a sudden desire to get married.
人の望みに任せる
to indulge one in one's wishes―let one have one's wish
病人の望みに任せよ
Humour the invalid (in his wishes)!
子どもの望みに任せよう
I will let my boy have his own way.
しからばお望みに任せん
Have, then, your wish!
お望みによってその人と会見したのだ
I saw the man by your desire.
たってのお望みなら何とも申しません
If you particularly wish it,―If you will have it so,―I have nothing to say against it.
お望みとあれば何でも致します
I will do anything if you wish it―if it is your wish.
お望み次第
as much as you wish―whatever you wish―anything you may wish
褒美は望み次第
You shall have any reward you may desire.
価は望み次第
You shall have whatever price you may name.
彼は望みが高い
He has high aspirations―He aims high―He looks high.
望みが低い
He aims low―He looks low.
もっと高い望みを懐いている
He looks higher―flies at higher game.
望みの品
the desired article
望みの物
one's wish―one's desire
望みの者
an applicant for a position―a candidate for a position―a purchaser of an article

content: 2. (=希望、期待)hopes; expectations ［注意］打消、成句のほかは複数。

content.content: 成功の望みを懐いている
I entertain hopes of success.
成功の望みを懐いていない
I entertain no hope of success.
望みがかなう
to realize one's hopes
望がかなった
I have realized my hopes―My hopes are realized―My hopes are fulfilled.
望みにかなう(望み通りにいく)
to answer one's hopes―meet one's expectations―fulfil one's expectations―come up to one's expectations
成績は望み通りにいった
The result has come up to my expectations.
望み通りにいかぬ
The result has fallen short of my expectations.
今度の人は望みにかなわぬ
The new man does not fulfil my expectations―does not come up to my expectations―falls short of my expectations.
成功の望みを捨てた
I have given up all hope of success―abandoned all hope of success.
成功の望みを絶った
I now despair of success.
また成功の望みを絶たぬ、まだ成功の望を捨てぬ
I have not given up all hope of success―I do not despair of success.
望みが絶える
One's hopes go to the ground―One's hopes are dashed to the ground―One's hopes are dashed to earth―One's hopes are blighted―One's hopes are blasted―One is in despair.
望みを絶やす
to dash one's hopes―blight one's hopes―blast one's hopes―extinguish one's hopes
望みの綱
one's only hope―one's last hope
望みの綱が切れた
My only hope is gone―My last hope is gone―All hope is gone.
一縷の望みがある
There is a ray of hope―a gleam of hope―a glimmer of hope.
一縷の望みも無い
There remains not a ray of hope―not a gleam of hope―not a glimmer of hope.
人に望みを嘱す
to expect much of one―hope much from one
失望するといけないから僕にあまり望みを嘱しては困る
You must not expect too much of me, lest you should be disappointed.
望みを嘱さるる人
the centre of one's hopes
僕らは彼に望みを嘱している、僕らの望みは彼にかかっている
He is the centre of our hopes―Our hopes are centred on him.
友人に逢える望みをもって会に出席した
I attended the meeting in the hope that I might meet some friends―in hopes of meeting some friends.

content: 3. (=見込)hopes, chances, prospects(は打消、成句のほかは複数):(好望は)promise

content.content: 彼は成功の望みがあるか
Are there any hopes of his success?―any chances of his success?
多少成功の望みがある
There are some hopes of his success―some chances of his success.
成功の望みが無い
There is no hope of his success―no chance of his success.
この事業は成功の望みがある
The project promises to be a success―It bids fair to be a success―It is likely to be a success.
病人は全快の望みがあるか
Are there any hopes of his recovery?
全快の望みが無い
There is no hope of his recovery.
まだ望みがある
There is yet hope.
全然望みが無い
He is past all hope―He is a hopeless case―He is a gone case―It is all over with him―It is all up with him.
医者は全快の望みがあると言う
The doctor holds out hopes of recovery.
治療の望み無し
He is past cure.
当分物価の下がる望みが無い
There is no prospect of the prices falling for the present.
ドイツの勝つ望みが無かった
There was no hope of―no chance of―no prospect of―no possibility of―Germany winning.
こんな処に居ては末の望みが無い
If I remain here, I shall have no chance of getting on―My present position offers no prospect of advancement.
今年は良作の望みがある
This year promises a good harvest.
この商売はだいぶ儲かる望みがある
The business promises large returns.
この商売は先の望みがあるか
Has the business a future?
先の望みは充分ある
It has a bright future before it―It has bright prospects.
永続の望みが無い
It does not promise to last long―It is not likely to last long.
あれは前途望みのある青年だ
He is a young man of great promise―a promising young man.
彼に勝てる望みがあるか
Do you stand a chance against him?
勝てる望みが充分ある
I stand a good chance against him.
勝てる望みが無い
I stand no chance against him.
彼は改心の望みが無い
There is no hope of his reforming―He is irreclaimable―irredeemable―incorrigible―past praying for.

content:
のぞみて〔望み手〕
〈名〉An applicant, a candidate (for a position); an aspirant (to some honours); a suitor (for a lady's hand); a buyer, a purchaser (of some article)

content.content: この地位は望み手が多い
There are many candidates for the position―many applicants for the position.
外交官は望み手が多い
There are many aspirants to diplomatic honours.
あの娘は望み手がたくさんある
She has many suitors―She is much run after.
この品は望み手が多い
The article is much sought after―in great demand―in great request.
(この家を売りたいが)望み手があったら周旋してくれ給え
Will you let me know if there is a purchaser?
望み手が無い
It goes a-begging.

content:
のぞむ〔望む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=願望する)to wish for (anything); to care for (wealth or fame); to want (anything); to desire (peace); to be desirous of (peace); to aspire to (some honours)

content.content: 敵は平和を望む
The enemy wish for peace―The enemy desire peace―The enemy are desirous of peace.
彼はこの地位を望んでいる
He wishes to secure the position―He is desirous to secure the position.
彼は英語教員の地位を望んでいる
He wants a position as teacher of English.
何でも望むものを上げる
You shall have whatever you want.
それが即ち僕の望むところだ
That's what I want.
価はいくらでも望むだけ出す
You shall have whatever price you may name.
僕は名利を望まぬ
I do not care for wealth or fame.
もうこの世に望むものは無い
I have nothing left to wish for in this world.
彼は外交官を望んでいる
He aspires to diplomatic honours.
僕は高位高官を望まぬ
I do not aspire to high honours.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 報酬は望む処にあらず
Emolument is no object with me.
子どもの望み通りにさしてやれ
Let the boy have his own way!
彼女は自分から望んであの人の処へ嫁に行ったのだ
She married him of her own choice.
彼は自ら望んで金を出したのだ
He gave the money of his own accord.
隴を得て蜀を望む
“Avarice knows no bounds.”

content: 2. (=希望する、期待する)to hope for, look for, expect (success, etc.)

content.content: そんな成功はとても望まれぬ
We dare not hope for such a success―Such a success is not to be expected―not to be looked for.
ご賛成あらんことを望みます
I hope you will approve of my plan.
彼には大したことは望めない
We can not expect much of him―hope much from him.
褒美を貰うことを望んでしたのではない
I did not do it in hopes of getting a reward.

content: 3. (=見晴す)to command a view of (a mountain); to look out on (the sea); to look out across (a lake or a river)

content.content: そこからはるかに富士山を望む
The place commands a distant view of Mt. Fuji.
三保の松原より富士を望むの景
the view of Mt. Fuji from the pinery of Miho

content:
のぞむ〔臨む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=面する、見晴す)to face (the sea); to front on (the lake); to look out on (the sea); to look out across (a lake or a river); to command a view of (a mountain)

content.content: その家は海に臨んでいる
The house faces the sea―fronts on the sea―looks out on the sea.
宮は湖水に臨んでいる
The shrine faces the lake―fronts on the lake―looks out across the lake.
懸崖湖水に臨む
The cliff hangs over the lake.

content: 2. (=事に接する)to stand in the presence of (danger); to be on the eve of (an event)

content.content: 危険に臨む
to be in the presence of danger
彼はどんな危険に臨んでもびくともせぬ
He will not turn a hair in the presence of any danger.
死に臨む
to stand in the presence of death―stand face to face with death―meet one's end
死に臨んで自若たり
He was calm in the hour of death―He met his fate like a man.
国家は大難に臨んでいる
The country is on the eve of a great calamity.
深淵に臨む
to stand on the brink of an abyss
その場に臨んで苦情を言い出した
He began to complain on the scene of action.
君と別れるに臨んで言いたいことがある
I want to say something to you on the eve of separation―at parting.
終りに臨んで一言将来に関して
To conclude,―In conclusion,―I wish to say a word in regard to the future.
機に臨み変に応ずる
to act according to circumstances―accommodate oneself to circumstances
偉人は事に臨んで大なり
A great man is equal to any occasion―A great man will rise to the occasion.

content: 3. (=臨場する)to attend (a ceremony); to assist at (a function); to be present at (a meeting)

content.content: 式に臨む
to attend a ceremony―assist at a function―be present at a ceremony
卒業式に臨んで一場の演説をした
I gave an address at the graduation ceremony.
戦場に臨む
to go into action
兵は実戦に臨んで悪びれず
The men behaved will under fire.

content: 4. (=人や世に対す)to deal with (a person or thing)

content.content: 厳格もって子弟に臨む
He is severe with his pupils.
君は天下に臨む
The sovereign rules over the country―reigns over the land.

content:
のぞむらくは〔望むらくは〕
〈副〉It is to be hoped that...; it is to be desired that...

content.content: 望むらくは彼の成功せんことを
It is sincerely to be hoped that―I hope―he will succeed.
望むらくは事件の速かに落着せんことを
It is very much to be desired that―I wish―the matter would be brought to a speedy conclusion.

content:
のたうつ〔のた打つ〕
〈自動〉To writhe; to wriggle; to squirm

content.content: 苦しんでのたうつ
to writhe in agony
寝苦しくてのたうつ
to toss about in bed

content:
のたくる
〈自動〉To writhe; to wriggle; to squirm

content.content: のたくりまわる
to wriggle about
苦しんでのたくる
to writhe in agony

content:
のだち〔野立ち〕
〈名〉Field inspection

content.content: 御野立所
the Imperial field-headquarters

content:
のだて〔野立て〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: のだち〔野立ち〕

のたまう〔宣う〕
〈他動〉(Honorific for) to say

のたれじに〔のたれ死に〕
〈名〉Dying by the roadside:(=する) to die by the roadside; to die in a ditch

content:
のち〔後〕
〈名〉After time; the future:(前置詞に用いれば) after (the war); subsequently to (the Restoration):(=の) after (ages); later (events); subsequent (occurrence); future (occasion):(=に) after; afterward; afterwards; later; later on; farther on; in future; subsequently; (so many years) hence

content.content: また後にお目にかかります
I shall see you again afterwards.
後に聞かせよう
I will tell you later on.
これは後に説明します
I will explain it farther on.
日露戦争の後であった
It was after the Russo-Japanese War.
維新の後にあったことだ
It happened subsequently to the Restoration.
それから二三日後に逢った
I met him after a few days―a few days after―a few days later.
百年後の日本が見たい
I should like to see Japan a hundred years hence.
用事を先にして遊びを後にする
Business first, and pleasure afterwards.
後の為に備える
to provide for the future
説明は後に譲る
I shall reserve the explanation for some future occasion.
後の世
(後世の意味なら)after ages―posterity―(来世の意味なら)―the future life―the next world
後の世の模範となれ
Set an example to posterity!
このことは後の事にしよう
We will put off the matter―postpone the matter―defer matters.
後の百より今の五十
“A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.”

のちぞえ〔後添え〕
〈名〉A second wife

content:
のちのち〔後々〕
〈名〉The future; the distant future

content.content: このご恩は後々までも忘れません
I shall not forget your kindness the longest day I have to live.
(己が死んでから)後々の事を頼む
See that all is well after I am gone!
彼は僕に後々の事を頼むと言った
He charged me to see to his affairs after his departure.
彼は僕に後々の事を託して死んだ
He died leaving his affairs in my hands.
後々の為を図る
to consult the welfare of one's descendants―look to the interests of posterity
彼は後々の事まで考える
He takes long views―looks far ahead.

content:
のちほど〔後程〕
〈副〉Afterward; afterwards; later on

content.content: のちほど伺います
I shall call on you later on.

content:
のっそり
〈副〉→『

content.content: のそのそ

content:
のっと〔祝詞〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: のりと〔祝詞〕

content:
のっと〔節<ノット>〕
〈名〉A knot

content.content: この船は二十ノット出る
The ship is good for 20 knots.
十五ノットは関の山だ
She can only make 15 knots―develop a speed of 15 knots―at her best.

content:
のっと〔節<ノット>〕
〈名〉A knot

content.content: この船は二十ノット出る
The ship is good for 20 knots.
十五ノットは関の山だ
She can only make 15 knots―develop a speed of 15 knots―at her best.

content:
のっとる〔乗取る〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: のりとる〔乗り取る〕

content:
のっとる〔則る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=従う)to follow (one's teachings); to act upon (a principle); to go by (a rule); to walk by (faith); to live by (a doctrine); to live up to (one's faith)

content.content: 教えに則る
to follow one's teachings―walk by faith―live by a doctrine―live by one's faith―live up to one's faith
規則に則る
to go by rule―act upon a rule
先例に則る
to follow a precedent
主義に則る
to act upon one's principles
天に則る
to walk with God

content: 2. (=倣う)to model after or on (some pattern)

content.content: 日本の海軍は英国の海軍に則ったものだ
The Japanese navy has been modelled after the English.

content:
のっぴきさせぬ〔退引きさせぬ〕
〈形〉Pressing; urgent

content.content: のっぴきさせぬ掛合い
a pressing demand―an urgent demand

content:
のっぴきならぬ〔退引きならぬ〕
〈形〉Impossible to escape; admitting of no excuse; unavoidable (business); imperative (necessity)

content.content: のっぴきならぬ用があって来られなかった
Unavoidable business prevented my coming
僕が去るのはのっぴきならぬわけがある
There is an imperative necessity for my leaving.
のっぴきならぬわけでも無ければ去りはせぬ
I do not leave unless there is an imperative necessity―unless it is absolutely necessary.
(もうこうなりゃ)のっぴきならぬ場合だ、いやと言えぬ
The case admits of no excuse―You are in for it.
のっぴきならぬ場合になって仕事を引き受けたのだ
I undertook the work, because I could not excuse myself from it―because I could not escape―because I was in for it.

のっぺらぽう〔のっべらぽう〕
〈形〉Smooth, featureless, egg-like (face)

のっぺらぽう〔のっべらぽう〕
〈形〉Smooth, featureless, egg-like (face)

content:
のっぽ
〈名〉A tall fellow

content.content: ずいぶんのつぼだ
He is as tall as a steeple.

content:
ので
〈接続詞〉Because; as:(前置詞に訳せば) on account of; owing to

content.content: 雨が少ないので作物が弱っている
The crops are suffering because the rain is scarce―owing to the scarcity of rain.
暑いので眠られない
I can not sleep on account of the heat―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The heat keeps me awake.

content:
のてん〔野天〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: のでん〔野天〕

content:
のでん〔野天〕
〈名〉The open air

content.content: 野天で寝る
to sleep in the open air
野天で興業する
to give performances in the open air―under the blue sky

content:
のど〔喉〕
〈名〉
1. The throat; the throttle:(食道の意味なら) the gullet:(気管の意味なら) the windpipe; the weasand; the whistle

content.content: 喉を通る
to go down the throat
食物が喉を通らない
Food will not go down my throat―I keck at food.
病人は何を食っても喉を通らぬ
No kind of food will go down his throat―He rejects all kinds of food.
心配で飯も喉を通らない
Anxiety has deprived me of my appetite.
喉が乾いた
I am thirsty.
喉が乾いて水を飲む
to quench one's thirst
喉を痛めた
I have a sore throat.
喉に骨が立った
A bone sticks in my throat.
(泣きたくて)喉が詰まる
to feel a lump in one's throat
言おうと思うことが喉につかえて出なかった
The words stuck in my throat.
その名が喉まで出かかっていた
His name was on the tip of my tongue.
喉を締める
to grip one's throat―(締め殺せば)―strangle one―throttle one
喉を突く
to cut one's throat―slit one's weasand
喉を鳴らす
(豚なら)to grunt―(猫なら)―purr
喉が鳴る、喉から手が出そう
He is licking his chaps.
喉を湿す
to wet one's whistle
喉もと過ぐれば熱さを忘る
“Danger past, God forgotten.”

content: 2. (=声)voice

content.content: 君は喉が好い
You have a good voice.
好い喉ですね
What a sweet voice you have!
彼は喉自慢だ
He prides himself on his voice.
喉をお聞かせなさい
Please sing to me!―Please sing me a song!

のどあて〔喉当て〕
〈名〉(=鎧の喉当て)The gorget

content:
のどか〔長閑〕
〈形〉Serene; tranquil; calm

content.content: のどかな天気
serene weather―genial weather
のどかな春の日
a genial day in spring
のどかな心
a serene mind―a tranquil mind

のどびこ〔喉懸垂〕
〈名〉The uvula

のどぶえ〔喉笛〕
〈名〉The windpipe; the weasand; the trachea

のどぼとけ〔喉仏〕
〈名〉Adam's apple

content:
のなか〔野中〕
〈形〉In the middle of the field; in the middle of the plain

content.content: 野中の清水
the fountain of the plain

content:
のに
〈接続詞〉
1. (=にもかかわらず)though:(前置詞に訳せば)notwithstanding; in spite of

content.content: 彼は金も無いのにぜいたくをしている
He lives in luxury, though he is poor―in spite of his poverty.
用も無いのに時々来る
He often comes to my house, though he has no business with me.

content: 2. (=時に)when; while

content.content: この寒いのに座敷を開け放しておくね
You keep the windows open when it is so cold―in this cold weather.
彼は試験だというのに遊んでばかりいる
He keeps idling when he has an examination before him―with an examination before him.
人が勉強しているのに彼はなまけている
He is idle, while the others are at work.

content: 〈前置詞相当〉(=ために)for:(または不定法)

content.content: 本を買うのに金が要る
I want some money to buy a book with.
それをするのに金を取っておいた
I have kept the money for the purpose.
勘定を払うのに金がこれでたくさんか
Is the money enough for paying the bill?―Will this money do to pay the bill?

content: 〈副〉［注意］訳語一定せず。

content.content: 行けばよいのに
You ought to have gone.
止せばよいのに
He might have spared himself the trouble.
止せと言うのに
Don't, I say!
そうだとよいのに
I wish it were so.

content:
ののしる〔罵る〕
〈他動〉To speak ill of (one); to abuse, revile, vituperate (a man); to inveigh against, rail against, rail at (a man or his conduct)

content.content: 蔭で人を罵るものでない
You should not speak ill of a man behind his back.
彼は口を極めて僕を罵った
He abused me in every key―abused me in no measured terms―inveighed against me.
口汚く人を罵る
to use foul language―use scurrilous language―fling dirt at one―revile one
彼は口汚く人を罵る
He is a scurrilous reviler.
天を罵る
to blaspheme against Heaven

content:
のばす〔延ばす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=延期する)to postpone (an event); to defer (matters); to extend (the time); to put off (anything to be done); to hold over (a bill); to let (a bill) lie over; to let (a debt) stand over; to shelve, pigeon-hole, table (a bill or a measure)

content.content: 雨天ならば順に延ばす
It will be postponed till the first fine day.
戦争のために事を延ばした
We deferred matters owing to the war.
日限を延ばす
to extend the term
明日まで延ばせ
Put it off till tomorrow!
払いを延ばす
to hold over a bill―let a bill lie over
借金を払うのを延ばす
to let a debt stand over

content: 2. (=延引する)to delay; to procrastinate; to put off (what ought to be done)

content.content: お返事を延ばしてすみません
I must apologize for delaying my answer.
今日できることを明日まで延ばすな
“Do not put off till tomorrow what can be done today.”
一日延ばしに延ばす
to put off from day to day
いよいよという時まで延ばす
to drive it to the last minute
一日でも延ばせば延ばしただけこちらの得
Time is in our favour.
一日でも延ばせば延ばしただけ先方の損
Time is against them.

content:
のばす〔伸ばす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=伸長する)to stretch (one's arm); to reach out (one's hand); to lengthen (a house); to make (a ship) longer; to extend (a line); to elongate (a sentence); to prolong (pleasure); to protract (one's stay); to draw out (a subject into many columns)

content.content: 手を伸ばす
to stretch one's hand―reach out one's hand―make a long arm
手を伸ばして花を取ろうとした
I reached at a flower.
手を伸ばして人の時計を取ろうとする
to reach for a watch
手を伸ばして人に物を渡す
to reach one anything
獲物は手を伸ばせば取れる
The prize is within my grasp.
頸を伸ばす
to stretch one's neck―crane one's neck
彼は頸を伸ばして待っている
He is waiting with a craned neck―on the tiptoe of expectation.
短かければ伸ばす
If it is too short, make it longer.
船を伸ばす
to lengthen a ship
この船を百フィート(だけ)伸ばすのだ
The ship is to be lengthened by 100 feet.
線路を伸ばす
to extend a line
この路線は百マイル(だけ)伸ばした
The line has been extended by 100 miles.
彼は髪を伸ばしている
He wears his hair long.
爪を伸ばしいる
He allows his nails to grow long.
金を打ち伸ばす
to beat out gold
革を打ち伸ばす
to hammer out a piece of leather
金を引き伸ばして針金にする
to draw out metal into wire
手足を伸ばす
to stretch one's limbs
彼は身体を長々と伸ばして寝ておった
He was stretched at full length.
寿命を伸ばす
to prolong one's life―lengthen one's days―add to one's natural term of existence―take a new lease of life
鼻毛を伸ばす、鼻の下を伸ばす
to be spooney (on a girl)

content: 2. (=濃いものを薄くする)to thin; to dilute

content.content: 糊を伸ばす
to thin the paste―make the paste thinner
紙の皺を伸ばす
to smoothe out crumpled paper
顔の皺を伸ばす
to smoothe away the wrinkles on one's brow―feel relieved
木が枝を伸ばす
A tree spreads its branches.
巻いた針金を伸ばす
to uncoil a wire―stretch a coiled wire
身代を伸ばす
to increase one's wealth―grow richer
羽翼(才能)を伸ばす
to give free play to one's abilities―give ample scope to one's talents―give full swing to one's genius
彼は天才を充分に伸ばしている
His genius has full swing.
彼に天才を伸ばす機会を与えよ
Let his genius have its swing!
才能を伸ばすことのできる仕事を選べ
Choose some work which will give play to your abilities―call your abilities into play.
彼は才能を伸ばす機会を求めている
He seeks scope for his talents.

content:
のばなし〔野放し〕
〈名〉Pasturage:(=する) to pasture (cattle); to put (cattle) to pasture; to turn out (a horse) to grass; to allow (horses) to run wild

content.content: 子どもらは野放しにしてある
The children are allowed to run wild.

content:
のはら〔野原〕
〈名〉A plain:(英国にては) a moor:(北米にては) a prairie

content.content: 全市まる焼けで野原になった
The whole city was laid level with the dust.
幾里も幾里も野原続きだ
A plain stretches for miles―There is a stretch of plain for miles.
もと都があった処は今は野原だ
A bare plain now stretches where once the city stood.

のばら〔野薔薇〕
〈名〉The wild rose

content:
のび〔伸び〕
〈名〉
1. (=背伸び)stretching

content.content: 伸びをする
to stretch oneself

content: 2. (=生長)growth

content.content: (子どもの着物をこしらえる時に)伸びを見る
to allow for growth
この木は伸びが好い
The tree grows well.

content: 3. (=長さや面積の余分)excess (of length or area)

content.content: この反物は(五尺)伸びがある
The cloth exceeds the usual length (by five feet)
この地面は坪に伸びがある
The ground exceeds the registered area.

のび〔野火〕
〈名〉A field fire; a prairie fire

content:
のびあがる〔伸び上がる〕
〈自動〉To stretch oneself up; to draw oneself up ; to stand on tiptoe

content.content: 伸び上がってようやく届く窓だ
You can just reach the window by standing on tiptoe.
伸び上がって塀越しに見た
I drew myself up to look over the wall.
伸び上がって花を取ろうとする
to reach at a flower

のびちぢみ〔伸び縮み〕
〈名〉Expansion and contraction:(=する) to expand and contract; to be elastic

content:
のびのび〔延び延び〕
〈名〉Long delay

content.content: ついお返事が延び延びになりました
My answer has been delayed too long.
仕事をそう延び延びにされちゃ困る
It is awkward to have the work delayed so long.

content:
のびのび〔伸び伸び〕
〈名〉A sense of relief:(=する) to feel relieved

content.content: 仕事が片づいて気が伸び伸びする
It is a relief to have my work off my hands.
我が家へ帰って洋服を脱いで浴衣を着ると気が伸び伸びする
To come home and change my foreign clothes for a yukata, gives me much relief.
久しぶりで野原へ出てみると気が伸び伸びする
The sight of an open field relieves the eye after a long confinement in the city.

content:
のびる〔延びる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=延期になる)to be postponed; to be deferred

content.content: 河開きが延びた
The river f?te has been postponed.

content: 2. (=延引される)to be delayed; to be put off

content.content: 出発が延びてしまった
My departure has been delayed.

content:
のびる〔伸びる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=伸長する)to lengthen; to grow longer

content.content: 春は日が伸びる
The days grow longer in spring.
日が伸びて夜が詰まる
The day gains on the night.
着物の丈はもう伸びないか
Can't the gown be lengthened?
いくらでも伸びます
It can be lengthened as much as you like.
寿命が伸びる
One takes a new lease of life.
一寸伸びれば尋伸びる
Get an inch, and you get an ell.

content: 2. (=成長する)to grow

content.content: この子は一年間に五寸伸びた
The child has grown six inches in a year.
君は急に丈が伸びた
You are shooting up.
この木はよく伸びる
This tree grows well.
髪が伸びた
My hair has grown too long.
爪が伸びた
My nails have grown long.

content: 3. (=発達する)to develop; to grow

content.content: あの男はまだ伸びる
He is capable of further growth.
あれっきりでもう伸びないかと思う
I am afraid he is incapable of further growth.
ひねくれた人間は伸びない
Crabbed natures do not grow.
才能が伸びる
One's faculties come into play.

content: 4. (=増す)to increase; to grow

content.content: あそこの身代は伸びるばかりだ
They go on growing richer―go on growing in wealth.

のびる〔野蒜〕
〈名〉The wild onion

のぶし〔野武士〕
〈名〉A lordless samurai; a free lance

のぶどう〔野葡萄〕
〈名〉The wild grape

content:
のべ〔延べ〕
〈名〉
1. (=延取引)a time-bargain; a transaction in futures
2. (=延べ金)beaten-out metal:(殊に) a sword
3. (=総計)total; aggregate

content.content: 延べ日数
the total number of days
延べ人員
(工場なら)the total number of attendances (in a given time)―(鉄道なら)―the total number of passengers (carried one mile)

content:
のべ〔野辺〕
〈名〉The field

content.content: 野辺の送り
a funeral―a burial
野辺の送りをする
to hold a funeral―perform a funeral service―do the last honours to the dead

content:
のべおくり〔野辺送り〕
〈名〉A funeral; a burial

content.content: 野辺送りをする
to hold a funeral―perform a funeral service―do the last honours to the dead

のべかがみ〔延べ鏡〕
〈名〉Looking at anything reflected in a mirror

のべがね〔延べ金〕
〈名〉Beaten-out-metal:(殊に) a sword

content:
のべたてる〔述べ立てる〕
〈他動〉To expatiate on, amplify on, descant on, dilate on, enlarge on (one's merits, etc.)

content.content: 彼は効能を述べ立てる
He likes to expatiate on its virtues.

content:
のべつ
〈副〉Constantly; continually; incessantly; unceasingly; without intermission

content.content: 彼はのべつ何か食っている
He is constantly eating.
のへつこぼして居る
He is continually grumbling.
あの女はのべつまくなしにしゃべっている
She talks incessantly―talks without intermission―talks nineteen to the dozen.

content:
のべつまくなし〔のべつ幕無し〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: のべつ

content:
のべとりひき〔延取引〕
〈名〉A time-bargain; a transaction in futures

content.content: 延取引をする
to deal in futures

content:
のべる〔述べる〕
〈他動〉To state (the fact); to express (one's wishes); to relate (the circumstances); to give (one's opinion); to deliver (an opinion); to set forth (one's views); to utter, voice (one's sentiments); to dwell on, touch on (a subject); to expatiate on, amplify on, descant on, dilate on, enlarge on (one's merits, etc.)

content.content: 事実を述べる
to state the fact
事実だけをありのままに述べて後は各自の独立判断に任せます
I will state the facts as they are, and leave you to judge for yourselves.
ただ事実の概略だけを述べます
I shall nearly outline the facts―summarize the facts.
意見を述べる
to give one's opinion―deliver an opinion―advance an opinion―set forth one's views―air one's views―utter one's sentiments―voice one's sentiments―make a suggestion―make oneself heard
彼はこういう意見を述べた
He delivered himself of this opinion.
ご参考までに意見を述べておきたい
I wish to make a suggestion.
理由を述べる
to state one's reason―give one's reason
君の希望を述べてみ給え
You may express your wishes.
礼を述べる
to express one's thanks―offer one's thanks―tender one's thanks
事情を述べて猶予を求めた
I related the circumstances, and asked for time.
この問題についてはくわしくは述べません
I shall not dwell on the subject at any length.
要点だけを簡単に述べておきます
I shall only touch on the chief points.
少々述べておきたいことがある
I wish to make a few remarks.
彼はしきりに効能を述べる
He likes to expatiate on its virtues.

content:
のべる〔伸べる〕
〈他動〉To smoothe out (a piece of paper); to spread (a blanket)

content.content: 床を伸べる
to spread a bed―make a bed

content:
のぼせ〔上せ〕
〈名〉
1. (=逆上)a rush of blood to the head; a determination of blood to the head; feverishness:(=る) to have a rush of blood to the head; to be feverish

content.content: ストーブはのぼせる
The stove causes a rush of blood to the head.
のぼせを下げる
to take a sedative
運動するとのぼせが下がる
Exercise acts as a sedative.
僕はのぼせ性だ
I am subject to rushes of blood to the head.
今日も少しのぼせている
I am rather feverish today.

content: 2. (=血迷い)excitement; distraction; frenzy; madness; heated imagination:(=る) to get excited; to go distracted; to be frenzied; to go mad; to be beside oneself

content.content: 彼はだいぶのぼせている
He is greatly excited.
あの女優にのぼせている
He is running mad after the actress.
あの男は女を見るとのぼせてしまう
A woman unsettles him.
彼は成功してのぼせている
Success has turned his head―He is beside himself with success.
のぼせているからそんなものが見えたのだ
It was the vision of a heated imagination.

content: 3. (=る)(=上げる) to raise

content.content: 脚本を舞台にのぼせる
to stage a play
料理を膳にのぼせる
to serve a dish

content: 4. (=る)(=記載する) to enter

content.content: 記録にのぼせる
to enter anything in the record―record anything

のぼせかえる〔上せ返る〕
〈自動〉To get excited; to go distracted

content:
のぼり〔上り〕
〈名〉Ascent; going uphill; going up (to town)

content.content: 道が上りだ
The road is uphill.
上りは骨が折れる
It is hard work going uphill.
この汽車は上りか下りか
Is the train going up or down?
上りです
It is gong up.
上り列車
an up-train

content:
のぼり〔幟〕
〈名〉A flag

content.content: 五月幟が立っている
The flags of the May F?te are up.

のぼりくだり〔上り下り〕
〈名〉Ascent and descent:(道路なら) the ups and downs (of a road):(旅行なら) the up down trips (of a journey); going up and down

content:
のぼりざか〔上り坂〕
〈名〉An upward slope; an uphill road; an ascent; an acclivity:(鉄道のは) an up grade

content.content: 道は上り坂だ
The road is uphill.
道は上り坂になる
The road is running uphill―The ground is rising.
上り坂は骨が折れる
It is hard work going uphill.

content:
のぼる〔上る、昇る、登る〕
〈自他動〉
1. To rise; to go up, come up (a hill); to ascend (a mountain); to mount (a hill); to climb (a tree); to scale (the wall)

content.content: 日が昇る
The sun rises.
日が昇るところだ
The sun is rising―coming up.
日が昇った
The sun has risen―The sun is up.
日がもう高く昇っている
The sun is high up already.
天に昇る
to go to Heaven―ascend into Heaven
天にも昇る心地
I was in the Seventh Heaven.
木に登る
to climb a tree
彼はあの木に登っている
He is up in that tree.
山に登る
to ascend a mountain―climb a mountain―scale a mountain―mount a hill―go up a hill
昨年の夏富士山へ登った
I made an ascent of Mt. Fuji last summer.
船頭多くして船山に登る
“Too many cooks spoil the broth.”
土手を登るべからず
It is not allowed to climb the bank.
河を上る
to go up a river―sail up a river―ascend a river
坂を上る
to go up a slope―mount a slope―ascend a slope
坂を上ったところに宮がある
There is a shrine at the head of the slope.
位に登る
to ascend the throne―mount the throne―(位に即くの意味なら)―accede to the throne―come to the throne
演壇に上る
to ascend the platform―mount the rostrum
階段を上る
to go up the stairs―mount the stairs―ascend the stairs
梯子を上る
to go up a ladder―mount a ladder
城壁を登る
to scale the wall
帆柱に登る
to go aloft
煙は空中へ上る
Smoke rises into the air.
空中へ登れば登るほど寒くなる
The higher up you go into the air, the colder it becomes.
寒暖計が九十度に上った
The mercury has risen to 90°―gone up to 90°.
寒暖計が十度上った
The mercury has risen by 10°.

content:
2. (=上京する)to go (up) to town; to come (up) to town
3. (=昇進する)to be promoted; to rise

content.content: 彼は一兵卒より身を起こして大将に昇った
He rose from the ranks to be a general.

content: 4. (=騰貴する)to rise; to go up; to advance in price; to appreciate:(暴騰する) to jump; to soar

content.content: 物価は騰るばかりだ
The prices go on rising.
物価はだんだん騰る
The prices are rising―on the rise.
物価は梯子登りに登る
The prices rise hand over hand―rise by leaps and bounds.

content: 5. (=〆ていくらになる)to mount to, come to (so much); to mount up to, run up to, foot up to (so much)

content.content: 税金が一万円に上る
The taxes amount to―come to―10,000 yen.
雑費が千円に上る
The expenses amount up to―run up to―foot up to―1,000 yen.
収入が十万円以上に上る
The income comes to over 100,000 yen―exceeds 100,000 yen.
議に上る
to come up for discussion―be brought up for discussion
この問題はこの前の会に議に上った
The matter came up for discussion at the last meeting.

content:
のぼる〔上る、昇る、登る〕
〈自他動〉
1. To rise; to go up, come up (a hill); to ascend (a mountain); to mount (a hill); to climb (a tree); to scale (the wall)

content.content: 日が昇る
The sun rises.
日が昇るところだ
The sun is rising―coming up.
日が昇った
The sun has risen―The sun is up.
日がもう高く昇っている
The sun is high up already.
天に昇る
to go to Heaven―ascend into Heaven
天にも昇る心地
I was in the Seventh Heaven.
木に登る
to climb a tree
彼はあの木に登っている
He is up in that tree.
山に登る
to ascend a mountain―climb a mountain―scale a mountain―mount a hill―go up a hill
昨年の夏富士山へ登った
I made an ascent of Mt. Fuji last summer.
船頭多くして船山に登る
“Too many cooks spoil the broth.”
土手を登るべからず
It is not allowed to climb the bank.
河を上る
to go up a river―sail up a river―ascend a river
坂を上る
to go up a slope―mount a slope―ascend a slope
坂を上ったところに宮がある
There is a shrine at the head of the slope.
位に登る
to ascend the throne―mount the throne―(位に即くの意味なら)―accede to the throne―come to the throne
演壇に上る
to ascend the platform―mount the rostrum
階段を上る
to go up the stairs―mount the stairs―ascend the stairs
梯子を上る
to go up a ladder―mount a ladder
城壁を登る
to scale the wall
帆柱に登る
to go aloft
煙は空中へ上る
Smoke rises into the air.
空中へ登れば登るほど寒くなる
The higher up you go into the air, the colder it becomes.
寒暖計が九十度に上った
The mercury has risen to 90°―gone up to 90°.
寒暖計が十度上った
The mercury has risen by 10°.

content:
2. (=上京する)to go (up) to town; to come (up) to town
3. (=昇進する)to be promoted; to rise

content.content: 彼は一兵卒より身を起こして大将に昇った
He rose from the ranks to be a general.

content: 4. (=騰貴する)to rise; to go up; to advance in price; to appreciate:(暴騰する) to jump; to soar

content.content: 物価は騰るばかりだ
The prices go on rising.
物価はだんだん騰る
The prices are rising―on the rise.
物価は梯子登りに登る
The prices rise hand over hand―rise by leaps and bounds.

content: 5. (=〆ていくらになる)to mount to, come to (so much); to mount up to, run up to, foot up to (so much)

content.content: 税金が一万円に上る
The taxes amount to―come to―10,000 yen.
雑費が千円に上る
The expenses amount up to―run up to―foot up to―1,000 yen.
収入が十万円以上に上る
The income comes to over 100,000 yen―exceeds 100,000 yen.
議に上る
to come up for discussion―be brought up for discussion
この問題はこの前の会に議に上った
The matter came up for discussion at the last meeting.

content:
のぼる〔上る、昇る、登る〕
〈自他動〉
1. To rise; to go up, come up (a hill); to ascend (a mountain); to mount (a hill); to climb (a tree); to scale (the wall)

content.content: 日が昇る
The sun rises.
日が昇るところだ
The sun is rising―coming up.
日が昇った
The sun has risen―The sun is up.
日がもう高く昇っている
The sun is high up already.
天に昇る
to go to Heaven―ascend into Heaven
天にも昇る心地
I was in the Seventh Heaven.
木に登る
to climb a tree
彼はあの木に登っている
He is up in that tree.
山に登る
to ascend a mountain―climb a mountain―scale a mountain―mount a hill―go up a hill
昨年の夏富士山へ登った
I made an ascent of Mt. Fuji last summer.
船頭多くして船山に登る
“Too many cooks spoil the broth.”
土手を登るべからず
It is not allowed to climb the bank.
河を上る
to go up a river―sail up a river―ascend a river
坂を上る
to go up a slope―mount a slope―ascend a slope
坂を上ったところに宮がある
There is a shrine at the head of the slope.
位に登る
to ascend the throne―mount the throne―(位に即くの意味なら)―accede to the throne―come to the throne
演壇に上る
to ascend the platform―mount the rostrum
階段を上る
to go up the stairs―mount the stairs―ascend the stairs
梯子を上る
to go up a ladder―mount a ladder
城壁を登る
to scale the wall
帆柱に登る
to go aloft
煙は空中へ上る
Smoke rises into the air.
空中へ登れば登るほど寒くなる
The higher up you go into the air, the colder it becomes.
寒暖計が九十度に上った
The mercury has risen to 90°―gone up to 90°.
寒暖計が十度上った
The mercury has risen by 10°.

content:
2. (=上京する)to go (up) to town; to come (up) to town
3. (=昇進する)to be promoted; to rise

content.content: 彼は一兵卒より身を起こして大将に昇った
He rose from the ranks to be a general.

content: 4. (=騰貴する)to rise; to go up; to advance in price; to appreciate:(暴騰する) to jump; to soar

content.content: 物価は騰るばかりだ
The prices go on rising.
物価はだんだん騰る
The prices are rising―on the rise.
物価は梯子登りに登る
The prices rise hand over hand―rise by leaps and bounds.

content: 5. (=〆ていくらになる)to mount to, come to (so much); to mount up to, run up to, foot up to (so much)

content.content: 税金が一万円に上る
The taxes amount to―come to―10,000 yen.
雑費が千円に上る
The expenses amount up to―run up to―foot up to―1,000 yen.
収入が十万円以上に上る
The income comes to over 100,000 yen―exceeds 100,000 yen.
議に上る
to come up for discussion―be brought up for discussion
この問題はこの前の会に議に上った
The matter came up for discussion at the last meeting.

のぼろぎく
〈名〉(=小鳥の好むのぼろぎく)The groundsel

content:
のませる〔飲ませる〕
〈自動〉(飲みたがる人になら)to let (one) drink:(飲みたがらない人になら)to make (one) drink:(馬などになら)to give (a horse) to drink

content.content: 飲みたいというなら飲ましてやれ
Let him drink if he wants to!
否応無しに飲ましてやれ
Make him drink whether he will or not!
馬に水を飲ませる
to give a horse to drink―(多くの馬なら)―water cattle
子どもに乳を飲ませる
to suckle a child―give suck to a child―give a child to suck―nurse a child
人に酒を飲ませる
to regale one with liquor―treat one to liquor
酒でも飲ませて元気をつけてやれ
Prime him with liquor!
後で一杯飲ませるから精を出せ
Work hard, and I'll treat you to a drink afterward.
口を割って飲ませる
to force one to drink―force the wine down one's throat
あの料理屋では好い酒を飲ませる
They serve good wine at that house.
あの料理屋はなかなか飲ませる
You are well served at that house.
医者が患者に薬を飲ませる
A doctor administers medicine―doses his patient.
毒を飲ませる
to administer poison―poison a man
煮え湯を飲ませる
to wring one's heart

content:
のまれる〔呑まれる〕
〈被動〉
1. To be swallowed (by a serpent)

content.content: 蛙が蛇に呑まれる
A frog is swallowed by a snake.

content: 2. (=威圧される)to be overawed (by superior intellect)

content.content: 偉い人の前へ出ると呑まれてしまって手向かう勇気が無くなる
One is overawed by the presence of a great man, and dare not lift a finger against him.

content:
のみ〔而已〕
〈副〉(名詞に伴えば)alone; the only; the sole:(動詞、形容詞に伴えば)only; merely; but

content.content: 言語を有するは人のみ
Man alone can speak―Man is the only creature that can speak.
成功したるは彼のみ
He alone has succeeded―He is the only man who has succeeded.
これを為し得るは独り君あるのみ
You alone can do it―You are the only man who can do it.
僕の友人としては君あるのみ
You are my only friend―You are my sole friend.
伴侶としてはただ書あるのみ
Books are my only―my sole―companions.
神は唯一あるのみ
There is only one God―but one God.
彼は言うのみにして行わぬ
He only preaches, he never practises.
彼は指図をするのみで自分では働かぬ
He merely directs, he never works himself.

content:
のみ〔蚤〕
〈名〉The flea

content.content: 蚤に食われる
to be bitten by fleas
蚤に食われたくらいの傷だ
It is only a flea-bite.
蚤にも食わせぬ大事な息子
I keep him as the apple of my eye.
蛋に攻められる
to be tormented by fleas
昨夜は蛋に攻められて眠れなかった
The fleas kept me awake last night.
蚤を取る
to catch fleas―hunt fleas
蚤を潰す
to kill a flea
蚤取粉
insect-powder
蚤取眼{のみとりまなこ}
eager eyes
蚤取眼で捜す
to look eagerly (for anything)
蚤の夫婦
a little man with a big wife

content:
のみ〔鑿〕
〈名〉A chisel

content.content: 鑿で像を彫る
to chisel an image

のみあいて〔飲み相手〕
〈名〉A boon companion; a pot-companion

content:
のみあかす〔飲み明かす〕
〈自動〉To drink the night away; to make a night of it

content.content: 今夜はお祝いに飲み明かそうではないか
Let us make a night of it in honour of the occasion!

のみうかれる〔飲み浮かれる〕
〈自動〉To go on the spree

content:
のみかけ〔飲みかけ〕
〈形〉Half-drunk (tea); half-smoked (cigar)

content.content: 飲みかけの茶を卓上に置いた
I set the unfinished tea on the table.
飲みかけの葉巻き
a half-smoked cigar

のみくい〔飲み食い〕
〈名〉Eating and drinking:(=する) to eat and drink; to refresh oneself; to take refreshments

のみぐすり〔飲薬〕
〈名〉A medicine for internal use; an internal medicine

content:
のみくせ〔飲み癖〕
〈名〉The habit of drinking; intemperate habits

content.content: 彼は飲み癖がついている
He is on the drink.

content:
のみくだす〔呑み下す〕
〈他動〉To take down (food)

content.content: 食物を呑み下すと喉が痛い
My throat pains me in taking down food.

content:
のみくち〔飲み口〕
〈名〉How (a wine) drinks

content.content: この酒は飲み口はどうですか
How does this wine drink?
飲み口はなかなか好い
It drinks very well.
灘のような飲み口だ
It drinks like Nada wine.

content:
のみぐち〔呑口〕
〈名〉A tap; a faucet

content.content: 樽に呑口を付ける
to tap a cask―broach a cask
