樽に呑口が付いている
The cask is on tap―abroach.

content:
のみこみ〔呑込み〕
〈名〉Comprehension; apprehension

content.content: 呑込みが悪い
to be dull of comprehension―slow of comprehension
僕はちと呑込みが悪いからもっと明瞭に話して下さい
I wish you would make yourself cleaver, for I am rather dull of comprehension.
この子は呑込みが早い
The child is quick of apprehension.

content:
のみこむ〔呑込む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=嚥下する)to swallow; to take down

content.content: 喉が痛くて食物が呑込めない
My throat is so sore that I can not swallow food―take down food.
ゴクリと呑込む
to gulp down wine or water
涙を呑込む
to gulp down one's tears

content: 2. (=会得する)to comprehend, apprehend, understand, grasp (the meaning); to take in (the situation); to catch (a melody); to get the hang of (a machine); to get the run of (office business)

content.content: 教師は教えようとすることをよく呑込んで教えなけりゃならぬ
The teacher must have a thorough grasp of his subject.
大意を呑込む
to grasp the general idea
僕が万事呑込んでいる
I understand my business―I know what I am about.
彼はひと目でその場の様子を呑込んだ
He grasped the situation―took in the situation―understood the whole story―at a glance.
彼はたちまち相手の長所短所を呑込んでしまう
He quickly takes in the merits and faults of his man.
この機械の仕掛けが呑込めない
I can not get the hang of this machine.
事務の勝手を呑込まなくちゃいけない
You must get the run of the office business.
僕は彼の気性を呑込んでいるから扱いやすい
I know how to deal with him, for I know his temper.
彼は歌の調子を呑込むことが早い
He is quick at catching a melody.
呼吸を呑込む
get the knack―learn the trick―hit the tone
商売の呼吸を呑込む
to learn the tricks of the trade
彼女は交際社会の呼吸を呑込んでいる
She has hit the tone of society.
人をそらさない呼吸を呑込んでいる
She has a knack at keeping on terms with people.
君の言うことが呑込めぬ
I don't follow you―I don't catch on.

のみしろ〔飲み代〕
〈名〉Money for drinking; drink-money

content:
のみすぎ〔飲み過ぎ〕
〈名〉Excessive drinking:(=る) to drink to excess; to drink too much; to overdrink oneself; to take a drop too much; to indulge too freely in wine

content.content: 今日はちと飲み過ぎた
I have taken a drop too much today.
君の病気は飲み過ぎるからだ
Your illness comes of drinking too much.
彼は時々飲み過ぎては身体をこわす
He often makes himself ill by overdrinking himself―He often drinks himself ill.
彼の親父は飲み過ぎて死んだ
His father drank himself to death.

content:
のみすけ〔飲み助〕
〈名〉A toper; a tippler; a wine-bibber; a hard drinker; a thirsty soul

content.content: あれは飲み助だ
He is a thirsty soul.

content:
のみち〔野路〕
〈名〉A path across a field; a track running though a plain

content.content: 野路で日が暮れたよう
like one belated in the middle of a plain

content:
のみちがえる〔飲み違える〕
〈他動〉To drink the wrong (thing)

content.content: 薬を飲み違えた
I have taken the wrong medicine.

のみつくす〔飲み尽す〕
〈他動〉To drink up (the wine)

content:
のみっくら〔飲みっくら〕
〈名〉A drinking-bout:(=する) to have a drinking-bout

content.content: 飲みっくらをして勝った
I drank my man down.
飲みっくらをして負けた
I was drunk down.

content:
のみつづける〔飲み続ける〕
〈自動〉To keep drinking

content.content: あまり長く飲み続けた
I kept it up too long.
元日から飲み続けだ
I have been steeped in liquor since the New Year's Day.

content:
のみつぶす〔飲み潰す〕
〈他動〉To drink (one) down; to drink (one's fortune) away

content.content: 相手を飲みつぶす
to drink one's companion down―leave one under the table
身代を飲みつぶす
to drink one's fortune away―drink oneself out of one's fortune
彼は家屋敷を飲みつぶした
He has drunk himself out of house and home.

content:
のみつぶれる〔飲み潰れる〕
〈自動〉To drink oneself dead drunk

content.content: 彼は飲みつぶれている
He is dead drunk.

content:
のみとりまなこ〔蚤取眼〕
〈名〉Eager eyes

content.content: 蚤取眼で捜す
to look eagerly (for anything)

content:
のみなおす〔飲み直す〕
〈自動〉To drink again

content.content: 場所を換えて飲み直そう
Let us adjourn somewhere and start afresh!

のみなかま〔飲み仲間〕
〈名〉A boon companion; a pot-companion

content:
のみならず
〈副〉Not only, not merely (... but also...); besides; moreover; as well as

content.content: 彼は学者であるのみならずなおまた良教師である
He is not only a good scholar, but also a good teacher―He is a good teacher as well as a good scholar―Besides being a good scholar, he is a good teacher.
人情は日本のみならず世界中同じだ
Man is man not merely in Japan, but all over the world.
それのみならず君にはご恩がある
Besides,―Moreover,―I owe you a debt of gratitude.

content:
のみにくい〔飲みにくい〕
〈形〉Undrinkable; unpalatable; nauseous

content.content: 飲みにくい薬
a nauseous medicine

のみにげ〔飲み逃げ〕
〈名〉Running away without paying for one's drink:(=する) to run away without paying for one's drink

のみぬけ〔飲み抜け〕
〈名〉A drunkard; a sot

のみのこし〔飲み残し〕
〈名〉Heel-tap

content:
のみほす〔飲み干す〕
〈他動〉To drain (a glass to the bottom); to empty (a cup)

content.content: 一息に飲み干せ
Empty the glass at a draught!
一滴も残さず飲み干す
to drain the glass to the last drop
息を吐かずに飲み干せ
Drain the glass without stopping for breath!
ぐいと飲み干す
to toss off a glass of brandy

のみまかす〔飲み負かす〕
〈他動〉To drink (one's companion) down; to leave (one) under the table

content:
のみまわし〔飲み廻し〕
〈名〉Passing round a cup:(=する) to pass round a cup (at a banquet or a tea-party)

content.content: 茶の飲みまわしをする
to pass round the tea-cup
飲みまわしの大盃
a loving-cup

content:
のみみず〔飲み水〕
〈名〉Drinking water; water to drink

content.content: この井戸の水は飲み水にならぬ
The water of this well is not good to drink.

content:
のみもの〔飲み物〕
〈名〉A drink:(酒類なら)a liquor:(茶、珈琲などなら)a beverage:(総称すれば)drinkables

content.content: 食い物と飲み物
eatables and drinkables

のみや〔呑屋〕
〈名〉［取引所］A stag; a bucket-shop

content:
のむ〔飲む〕
〈他動〉
1. To drink (water, tea, wine); to take (tea or medicine); to regale oneself with (beer); to suck (milk); to smoke (tobacco); to moisten one's clay; to wet one's whistle

content.content: 水を飲む
to drink water
水をごくごく飲む
to drink deep draughts of water
井戸で水を飲んだ、小川で水を飲んだ
I drank at the well―drank at the brook.
渇しても盗泉の水を飲まず
I would rather die than batten on ill-gotten wealth.
馬に水を飲ませる
to give a horse to drink―(多くの馬なら)―water cattle
茶を飲む
to drink tea―take tea
茶を飲みながら話した
We chatted over our tea.
薬を飲む
to take medicine
医者が患者に薬を飲ませる
A doctor administers medicine―doses a patient.
子どもが母の乳む
A child sucks milk―sucks its mother―draws the breasts.
子どもに乳を飲ませる
to suckle a child―give suck to a child―give a child to suck―nurse a child
タバコを飲む
to smoke (tobacco)
酒を飲む
to drink (wine)―regale oneself with liquor―moisten one's clay
酒を飲みながら相談した
We discussed the matter over our wine.
彼は酒を飲みながらその話をした
He told the story over his cup.
彼は酒を飲んでそんなことを言ったのだろう
He must have said so under the influence of wine.
君は酒を飲むか
Do you drink?
彼は朝から晩まで酒ばかり飲んでいる
He does nothing but drink from morning till night.
酒は飲みほうだい
You may drink as much as you like―You will have the run of the cellar.
今晩は大いに飲もうじゃないか
Let us have a carouse this evening!
彼は飲むと冗談を言う
He is funny over his cups.
彼は一滴も酒を飲まぬ
He does not drink a drop of wine―He never touches liquor―He abstains from wine―He is a teetotaller.
決して酒を飲むな
Never taste strong drink!
酒を飲まないと誓った
I have promised never to taste strong drink.
人に酒を飲ませる
to regale one with liquor―treat one to liquor
彼に酒でも飲ませて元気をつけてやれ
Prime him with liquor!
一杯飲む
to have a drink―have a wet―take a drop
一杯飲もうじゃないか
Let us have a drink!
ちょいと一杯飲もうじゃないか
Let us take a wee drop!
一杯飲んでもよい
I don't mind having a drink―I could do with a drink.
一杯飲んで売買の相談を纒める
to wet a bargain
これをやるから一杯飲め
Here is something for you to drink my health with.
後で一杯飲ませるから精を出せ
Work hard, and I will treat you to a drink afterward.
一本飲む
to have a bottle―crack a bottle
切り上げに今一本飲もうじゃないか
Let us have another bottle, to wind up with!
一本飲みながら相談した
We discussed the matter over a bottle of wine.
腹いっぱい飲む
to drink one's fill
彼は大酒を飲む
He drinks deep―drinks hard―drinks heavily―drinks like a fish.
酒を飲むなら控え目に飲め
If you do drink, drink sparingly!
程に飲め
Drink in moderation!
ひと息に飲め
Drink it of at a draught!
酒をがぶがぶ飲む
to swig liquor―swill liquor
浴びる程飲む
to booze―soak
ごくりと飲む
to gulp down wine
ちびちび酒を飲む
to tipple
ぐびりぐびり飲む
to drink in silence
酒を燗して飲む
to drink sake hot
酒に飲まれる
to drink away one's reason
酒は飲むべし飲まるべからず
Drink wine, but do not drink away your reason!
彼は月給を飲んでしまう
He drinks all his salary.
金を儲けると皆飲んでしまう
He drinks his whole earnings.
空き腹に飲む
to drink on an empty stomach
空き腹に飲むと酔う
Wine tells on an empty stomach.
酒を飲んで酔う
to get drunk on wine
ドイツ人はビールを飲んでも酔わぬ
A German can not get drunk on beer.
(酒を飲んでもよいが)酔う程飲むな
You must not make yourself drunk.
酔って倒れるまで飲む
to drink oneself dead drunk―drink till all's blue
飲んだ酒なら酔わずばなるまい
It is no wonder that wine should make me drunk.
酒を飲んで浮かれる
to go on the spree
飲んで管捲く
to talk incoherently in drink―drink oneself into incoherence
酒を飲んで苦労を忘れる(茶椀酒を飲む)
to drown care in wine
酒を飲んで悲しみをまぎらす
to drink down sorrow
飲めや歌えや一寸先は闇よ
“Eat and drink and make merry, for tomorrow we die.”
飲めや歌えの大騒ぎ
a spree
飲む買う打つの三拍子揃った道楽者
He is addicted to wine, woman, and dice―a votary of Bacchus, Venus, and Fortune.
彼らは飲んだり食ったりして日を暮らしている
They pass their time in eating and drinking.
飲まず食わずで一日歩いた
I tramped all day without eating or drinking―with neither bit nor sup.

content:
のむ〔呑む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=嚥下する)to swallow; to gobble up (frogs); to gulp down (water, etc.)

content.content: この劇薬を一滴呑むと死ぬ
If you were to swallow a drop of this poison, you would die.
蛇が蛙を呑む
A snake swallows a frog.
彼は浪に呑まれてしまった
He was swallowed up by the waves.
ひと口に呑んでしまうぞ
I will swallow you at a mouthful―make a mouthful of you.
固唾を呑む
to hold one's breath―bate one's breath
固唾を呑んで勝負を見ていった
We watched the contest with bated breath―with breathless interest.
四海を呑む
to conquer the world

content: 2. (=隠す)to conceal

content.content: あの男はいつも匕首を呑んでいる
He always carries a dagger in his bosom.
その男はこの短刀を呑んでおった
This dagger was found on his person.
涙を呑む
to keep back one's tears―gulp down one's tears―choke down one's tears
欠伸{あくび}を呑む
to stifle a yawn
恨みを呑む
to repress one's anger―(侮辱を忍ぶの意味なら)―swallow an insult―pocket an affront
彼は恨みを呑んで死んだ
He carried his grudge to the grave.
彼の姿は暗黒に呑まれて行った
His form disappeared into the darkness―vanished into the night.

content: 3. (=威圧する)to overawe

content.content: 偉い人の前へ出ると呑まれてしまって手向かう勇気が無くなる
One is overawed by the presence of a great man, so that one dare not lift a finger against him.

content: 4. (=軽視する)to make light of (a task); to hold (one) in the hollow of one's hand

content.content: 弁士は聴衆を呑んでかかる
The orator holds his audience in the hollow of his hand.
演説する時は聴衆を呑んでかからなけりゃ駄目だ
When you speak in public, you must make little of your audience.

content:
のめる
〈自動〉To fall forward

content.content: 彼は急にのめって炉へ入った
He fell forward into the fire.

content:
のめる〔飲める〕
〈他動〉Can drink (wine)

content.content: 君は酒が飲めるか
Can you drink?
君は飲める口だ
You are no enemy to liquor.
彼は金持ちになってうまい酒が飲める
He has made a fortune, and can indulge his tastes.
そうすりゃうまい酒が飲めようという寸法さ
I expect to make a good thing out of it.

content: 〈形〉Good to drink; drinkable

content.content: この井戸の水は飲めますか
Is the water of this well good to drink?
この水は飲めない
This water is not good to drink.
この酒はとても飲めない
This wine is not fit to be drunk.
この酒は値段にしては飲める
This wine drinks well for its price.
なかなか飲める
It is very good drinking.
このタバコは飲める
This tobacco smokes well―It is good smoking.

content:
のやま〔野山〕
〈名〉The field and hills

content.content: 野山の獣
the beasts of the field

content:
のら〔野良〕
〈名〉The fields

content.content: 野良へ出て働く
to work in the fields
野良仕事
field labour

のらいぬ〔野良犬〕
〈名〉An ownerless dog; a street-dog; a pariah-dog

content:
のらくら
〈副〉Idly; dawdlingly; loiteringly:(=する) to idle; to dawdle; to loaf; to drone; to dally; to loiter

content.content: 彼はいつものらくらしている
He is always loafing around.
のらくら歩く
to loiter along
のらくらして日を送る
to lead an idle life―dawdle one's time away
あれはのらくら者だ
He is an idler―a loafer―a drone―a sluggard―a laggard.

のらねこ〔野良猫〕
〈名〉A homeless cat

content:
のり〔海苔〕
〈名〉The laver

content.content: 乾海苔
dried lavers
味付け海苔
flavoured lavers
海苔粗朶
brushwood set in the sea for gathering lavers

content:
のり〔糊〕
〈名〉Paste; starch:(製紙に用いる糊は)size

content.content: 洗濯物に糊を付ける
to starch linen
糊の利いたシャツ
a well-starched shirt
このシャツは糊が利いていない
This shirt is not starched enough.
もっと糊を利かしておくれ
I want more starch in it.
紙を糊ではり付ける
to paste paper on the wall
糊入
a paste-pot
鋏と糊入の仕事(切り抜き新聞など)
a scissors-and-pastepot work
糊板
a board for making rice-paste
糊へら
a spatula for making rice-paste

content:
のり〔乗り〕
〈名〉
1. (=乗ること)a ride

content.content: 一乗りする
to take a ride―have a ride

content: 2. (=白粉などの付き工合)how (a paint) spreads

content.content: この白粉は乗りが好い
This toilet-powder spreads well.

content: 3. (=乗り合い)partnership; joint account

content.content: 乗りで一口買おうじゃないか
Let us buy a share on joint account―Let us buy a share between us.

のり〔法〕
〈名〉
1. (=法則)a law
2. (=仏法)the Buddhistic doctrine

content:
のりあい〔乗り合い〕
〈名〉
1. Riding together:(より)passenger service

content.content: 乗合船
a passenger boat
乗合馬車
(旅行のは)a stage-coach―(市街のは)―an omnibus
乗合自動車
a motor-bus―an auto-bus
乗合の客
a fellow-passenger

content: 2. (=共同購買)partnership; joint account

content.content: 乗合いで一口買おうじゃないか
Let us take a share on joint account―Let us buy a share between us.

content:
のりあげる〔乗り上げる〕
〈自動〉To be stranded; to take the ground; to run aground; to go ashore; to run on (a rock); to strike (a rock):(わざとなら)to beach (a ship)

content.content: 船を浅瀬に乗り上げた
The ship was stranded―ran aground―went ashore.
船を暗礁に乗り上げた
The ship ran on a rock―struck a rock.
三池丸は朝鮮沖のある島に乗り上げている
The Miike Maru is aground―ashore―on an island on the coast of Korea.
船を乗り上げて沈没を免れた
They saved the ship from sinking by beaching her―by running her aground.
船を洲に乗り上げた
The ship stranded on a sandbank.
船は洲に乗り上げて離れぬ
The ship is stuck on a sandbank―hard and fast on a sandbank.

content:
のりあわせる〔乗り合わせる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=誰と同乗する)to ride in the same carriage (with some one); to travel (with some one) in the same boat

content.content: 汽車で一人の海軍将校と乗り合わした
I happened to ride in the same carriage with a naval officer.
乗り合わした乗客
a fellow-passenger

content: 2. (=汽車などに間に合わせる)to catch (a train)

のりいい〔乗り好い〕
〈形〉(A horse or a bicycle) which rides well

content.content: この馬は乗り好い
This horse rides well.

content:
のりいる〔乗り入る〕
〈自動〉To ride in; to ride into (a place)

content.content: 死地に乗り入る
to ride into the jaws of death―ride to certain death
敵陣へ乗り入る
to ride through the enemy's line

content:
のりうつる〔乗り移る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=移乗する)to change (horses or cars); to take to (a boat)

content.content: 本船を乗り捨てて端艇に乗り移った
They left the ship to her fate, and took to the boats.

content: 2. (=憑移る)to possess (a man); to inspire (a man)

content.content: 人に神霊が乗り移った
A man is inspired.
神霊の乗り移った詩人
an inspired poet

のりうま〔乗り馬〕
〈名〉A riding-horse; a saddle-horse; a mount; a hack; a palfrey (for ladies)

content:
のりおくれる〔乗り後れる〕
〈他動〉To miss (a train)

content.content: 急がないと汽車に乗り後れるよ
Make haste, or you will miss the train.
乗り後れた乗客
a belated passenger

content:
のりおり〔乗り降り〕
〈名〉Getting in and out:(=する) to get in and out

content.content: 電車の乗り降りがおっくうだ
I find it troublesome to get into and out of the cars.
汽車の乗り降りに手を貸しておくれ
Please help me into and out of the cars.

content:
のりかえ〔乗り換え〕
〈名〉
1. (汽車や電車の乗り換え)a change; transfer:(船の乗り換え)transhipment:(=る) to change cars; to transfer (to another car); to tranship

content.content: 築地方面乗り換え
Change cars for Tsukiji!
塩町で青山行きへ乗り換える
At Shiocho, you change cars for Aoyama.
あそこへ行くには乗り換えが多い
You have to change cars several times to get there.
乗り換え無しに青森まで直行です
You run through to Aomori without changing (cars).
乗り換え場
a place for changing cars
乗り換え駅
a station for changing cars―a junction
乗り換え切符
a transfer (-ticket)
女が男を乗り換える
A woman takes up with another man―jilts one lover for another.
牛を馬に乗り換える
to change for the better

content: 3. (=株式の乗り換え)carrying over; continuation

content.content: 乗換計算日
a contango day―a carry-over day
買乗換打金
contango―carrying change.
乗換打金
premium―backwardation

content:
のりかける〔乗り掛ける〕
〈他動〉To be about to get into (a car or a boat):(より)to set one's hand to (an undertaking)

content.content: 乗りかけた船だ(後へは引けぬ)
I have gone too far to retreat―I have crossed the Rubicon.

content:
のりき〔乗り気〕
〈名〉Enthusiasm

content.content: 乗り気になる
to enter into anything with enthusiasm
友人達は僕の事業に乗り気になっている
My friends enter into my scheme with enthusiasm.
彼はこの事業に非常に乗り気になっている
He enters, heart and soul, into the scheme.
彼は乗り気になって僕の意見を聴いてくれた
He heartily entered into my views.

content:
のりきる〔乗り切る〕
〈他動〉To ride across (a river); to sail across (a sea)

content.content: 騎兵は河を乗りきった
The cavalry swam their horses across the river.
この小帆船が太平洋を乗りきって来たのだ
The schooner has sailed across―crossed―the Pacific.

content:
のりくみ〔乗組〕
〈名〉The crew (of a ship)

content.content: 長門乗組の水兵
a sailor belonging to the Nagato
長門乗組将校
an officer on board the Nagato

content:
のりくみいん〔乗組員〕
〈名〉A ship's crew; a ship's company; a ship's complement

content.content: 軍艦乗組員
a warship's crew
長門乗組員
the Nagato's crew
彼は長門の乗組員だ
He belongs to the Nagato's crew.
同艦の乗組員は七百名である
She carries a crew of 700―She has a complement of 700.

content:
のりくむ〔乗組む〕
〈他動〉To form part of a ship's company

content.content: 彼の弟は海軍大尉で長門に乗組んでいる
His brother is a lieutenant on board the Nagato―attached to the Nagato.

content:
のりこえる〔乗り越える〕
〈他動〉To get over (a fence); to climb over (a wall); to ride across (a mountain)

content.content: 塀を乗り越える
to climb over a wall
山を乗り越える
to ride across a mountain―cross a mountain on horseback

content:
のりこす〔乗り越す〕
〈自動〉
1. (=汽車や電車で目的地点を越えて乗る)to ride past one's destination; to be carried beyond one's destination; to override oneself

content.content: (電車で)読書に夢中になって乗り越してしまった
I was so much absorbed in reading that I overrode myself.
汽車で寝ているうちに乗り越してしまった
I was asleep in the train and carried past my destination.

content: 2. (=自動車などが他の自動車を追い越す)to pass (another car)

のりこなす〔乗りこなす〕
〈他動〉To manage (a horse)

content.content: 悍馬を乗りこなす
to manage a mettlesome steed

content:
のりこむ〔乗り込む〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=乗船する)to go on board, come on board (a ship)

content.content: 本船は早朝出帆につき乗客は前夜お乗り込みありたし
We sail early in the morning, and the passengers are requested to come on board in the evening.
神戸で乗り込んで馬関で暫く上陸した
I went on board at Kobe, and went on shore at Bakan.
候補生が軍艦へ乗り込む
A cadet joins his ship.

content: 2. (=町へ乗り込む)to make one's entry into (a city); to come upon (the town)

content.content: 一行はものものしく乗り込んだ
The party came upon the town with a flourish of trumpets.
我が軍は奉天へ堂々と乗り込んだ
The Japanese made a triumphal entry into the city of Mukden.
日本軍は旗鼓堂々と旅順へ乗り込んだ
The Japanese made their entry into Port Arthur with colours flying and band playing.
河村一座は昨夜乗り込んだ
Kawamura and his troupe made their entry yesterday.

content:
のりすてる〔乗り捨てる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=船を乗り棄てる)to abandon (a ship) to her fate; to leave (a ship) to her fate

content.content: 本船を乗り捨てて端艇に乗り移った
They left the ship to her fate, and took to the boats.

content: 2. (=車から降りる)to alight from, get out of (a carriage)

content.content: 向島で車を乗り捨て後は歩いた
I alighted from my ricksha at Mukojima. and did the remainder of my journey on foot.

content:
のりそこなう〔乗り損う〕
〈他動〉To miss (a train)

content.content: ひと足のことで汽車に乗り損なった
I missed the train by a step.
玉の輿に乗り損う
to miss riding in a palanquin―fail to marry into the purple

content:
のりだす〔乗り出す〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=出帆する、出港する)to sail; to set sail; to put to sea; to leave (a port)

content.content: 五日に横浜を乗り出した
We left Yokohama on the 5th.
大海へ乗り出す
to venture on the sea―launch upon the deep
乗り出した船だ(後へは引かれぬ)
I have gone too far to retreat―I have crossed the Rubicon―The die is cast.

content: 2. (=事業を始める)to embark in (an enterprise); to venture on (a speculation); to launch forth on, launch out on (an enterprise)

content.content: 冒険事業に乗り出す
to embark in an enterprise―launch forth on an enterprise
投機に乗り出す
to venture on a speculation

content: 3. (=前方へこごむ)to lean forward; to bend one's head forward

content.content: 皆乗り出して聴いている
Everybody leans forward―Every head is bent forward―to listen to him.

のりちがえる〔乗り違える〕
〈他動〉(=汽車などに乗り違える)To take the wrong (train)

content:
のりつけ〔糊付け〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: のりづけ〔糊付け〕

のりづけ〔糊付け〕
〈名〉Starching:(=する) to starch (linen)

content:
のりつける〔乗り付ける〕
〈自動〉(=乗り着く)to ride up to, drive up to (the door)

content.content: 自動車が玄関へ乗りつけた
He drove up to the door in a motor-car.

content: 〈他動〉(=乗り慣れる)to get used to riding

content.content: 自動車に乗りつけると普通の車はまだるくなる
When you are used to motoring, you will find carriage too slow.

のりつぶす〔乗り潰す〕
〈他動〉To ride down (a horse)

content:
のりて〔乗り手〕
〈名〉(馬のは)a rider:(車や船のは)a passenger

content.content: 馬が乗り手を落とす
A horse throws his rider.
この線路は乗り手があまり無い
There is little passenger traffic on this line.

content:
のりと〔祝詞〕
〈名〉A Shinto address to the gods

content.content: 祝詞を上げる
to read an address to the gods

content:
のりとる〔乗り取る〕
〈他動〉To capture (a fortress); to cut out (a ship); to supplant, supersede (a man); to take over (the cabinet); to step into one's shoes

content.content: 砲台を乗り取る
to capture a fort
敵艦を乗り取る
to cut out a ship
競争者の地位を乗り取る(女を寝取る)
to cut out a rival
人の地位を乗り取る
to supersede a man―supplant a man―(in his office)
彼は僕の後を乗り取ろうとしている
He wants to step into my shoes.
内閣を乗り取る
to take over the Cabinet

content:
のりならす〔乗り馴らす〕
〈他動〉To break in (a horse); to break (a horse) to the rein

content.content: 乗り馴らした馬
a broken horse

content:
のりにくい〔乗りにくい〕
〈形〉(A horse or a bicycle) which rides badly

content.content: この自転車は乗りにくい
This bicycle rides badly.

content:
のりにげ〔乗り逃げ〕
〈名〉Bilking the fare:(=する) to bilk the fare

content.content: 汽車を乗り逃げする
to bilk the railway-fare
人の自転車を乗り逃げする
to ride away with a bicycle

のりば〔乗り場〕
〈名〉(電車なら)a car-stop:(船なら)a landing-place

のりはぐれる〔乗りはぐれる〕
〈他動〉(=汽車などに乗りはぐれる)To miss (a train)

content:
のりばり〔糊貼り〕
〈名〉Pasting

content.content: 紙を糊貼りにする
to paste paper on the wall

content:
のりまわす〔乗り廻す〕
〈自他動〉(馬でなら)to ride about:(馬車でなら)to drive about

content.content: 一行はパリの市街を自動車で乗りまわした
The party motored about the streets of Paris.

content:
のりもどす〔乗り戻す〕
〈自動〉(馬なら)to ride back:(馬車なら)to drive back

content.content: 車を乗り戻した
I rode back in my ricksha.

のりもの〔乗物〕
〈名〉
1. (=駕籠)a palanquin
2. (=車)a vehicle

content:
のる〔載る〕
〈自動〉To be recorded (in history); to figure (in history); to appear (in a newspaper); to be put (on the books); to be given (in the programme)

content.content: その名は歴史に載っている
His name figures in history.
これは歴史に載っている中での第一の海戦である
This is the greatest naval battle on record.
その記事はどの新聞にも載っていた
The account appeared in all the papers.
彼の名が名簿に載っているか
Is his name on the list?―on the books?―on the rolls?
彼の名は学籍に載っていない
His name is not found on the books.
その取組は番付に載っていない
I can not find the match in the programme.

content:
のる〔乗る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=乗り行く)to ride (a horse or a bicycle―in a carriage, a train, a street-car, a motor-car, a car, a boat); to drive (in a carriage); to sail (in or on a ship); to fly (on an aeroplane)

content.content: 馬に乗る
to ride a horse―(一回なら)―take a ride―have a ride.
君は馬に乗るか、馬に乗れるか
Do you ride?―Can you ride?
彼は馬に乗って出かけました
He has gone for a ride.
一日馬に乗りづめに乗った
I kept in the saddle all day.
裸馬に乗る
to ride bareback
尻馬に乗る
to follow the lead of others
人には添ってみよ馬には乗ってみよ
“The proof of the pudding is in the eating.”
馬車に乗る
to ride in a carriage―drive (in a carriage)―(一回なら)―take a drive―have a drive
馬車に乗って Station へ行った
I drove to the station.
馬車に乗って公園を通った
I drove through the park.
何も僕だって馬車に乗れないという理由はあるまい
Why should I not ride in a carriage?
汽車に乗る
to ride in a train
汽車に乗って大森へ行った
I went by train to Omori.
僕は汽車は二等に乗る
I travel second-class.
車に乗る
to ride in a ricksha
車に乗って行こう
Let us go by ricksha.
自動車に乗る
to ride in a motor-car
君は自動車に乗ったことがあるか
Did you ever ride in a motor-car?
自動車に乗って行こう
Let us go by motor-car.
電車に乗る
to ride in a street-car
電車に乗って行こう
Let us go by tram.
君は自転車に乗れるか
Can you ride a bicycle?
駕籠に乗る
to ride in a sedan-chair
僕は箱根で駕籠に乗ったことがある
I once rode in a sedan-chair at Hakone.
船に乗る
to sail in a ship―sail on a ship
君は船に乗ったことがあるか
Did you ever sail in a ship?―Have you ever been at sea?
小舟に乗る
to ride in a boat
あの汽船に乗ってみたいものだ
I should like to ride in that steamer.
親船に乗ったつもりでおれ
“Your father is at the helm.”

content: 2. (=下から乗る、乗り込む)to mount, get on (a horse); to go on board (a ship); to get into (a carriage, a train, a street-car, a boat):(米国にては)to board (a train or a street-car):(どこから乗る)to take (horse, ship, a boat); to take passage (in or on a ship)

content.content: 馬に乗る
to mount a horse―get on a horse―take horse
この馬は高くて乗れない
The horse is so tall that I can not mount him.
彼はひらりと馬に飛び乗った
He jumped on the horse.
山を越す人はこの村で馬に乗る
The traveller crossing the mountain takes horse at this village.
船に乗る
to go on board a ship―take ship―(船乗りになるの意味なら)―go to sea
今晩船に乗る
I go on board this evening.
神戸で船に乗って上海へ行く
I take ship at Kobe for Shanghai.
船のあり次第に乗ります
I shall take the next ship that sails.
大島へ便船があったからこれに乗った
I took passage in a steamer that was bound for Oshima.
汽車に乗る
to get into a train―board a train―take a train―catch a train
汽車に乗ろうじゃないか
Let us take a train!
一時三十分の汽車に乗れるだろう
I think we can catch the 1.30 train.
電車に乗る
to get into a car―board a car―take a car
電車に乗ろう
Let us take a car!
上野で電車に乗った
I got into a car―boarded a car―took a car―at Ueno.
車に乗ろうじゃないか
Let us take a ricksha!
舟に乗って河を上ろうじゃないか
Let us take a boat and go up the river!
さあ皆様お乗りなさい
All aboard!

content: 3. (=乗っている)to be mounted on (a horse); to be on board (a ship); to be on (a bicycle); to be on (an aeroplane); to be in (a carriage, a train, a street-car, a motor-car, a boat, etc.)

content.content: 大将は白馬に乗っておった
The general was mounted on a white charger.
人が乗っている馬
the horse on which one is mounted
彼は乗っている馬を撃たれた
His horse was shot under him―He had his horse shot under him.
彼の弟は海軍大尉で長門に乗っている
His brother is a lieutenant in the navy on board the Nagato―attached to the Nagato.
あの汽船には軍隊が乗っている
That steamer has troops on board.
彼は自動車に乗ってすれ違った
He flashed past me in a motor-car.
彼は馬車に乗って通り違った
He swept past me in a carriage.

content: 4. (=物の上に乗る)to get on (a chair); to stand on (a pedestal); to mount (a table)

content.content: その窓は椅子に乗ってようやく届く
You can just reach the window by getting on a chair―by mounting a chair.
立像は台に乗っている
The statue stands on a pedestal.
その本は一番上の棚に乗っている
The book is on the topmost shelf.
(足場の上で)僕の乗っている板がミリミリいい出した
The plank I stood on―The plank beneath me―began to creak.

content: 5. (=絵具なとがどう付く)to spread (well or ill)

content.content: この白粉はよく乗る
This toilet-powder spreads well.

content: 6. (=だまされる)to be taken in; to fall a victim (to a scheme)

content.content: 計略に乗った、手に乗った
I fell a victim to his schemes―fell into a snare―walked into a trap.
その手にゃ乗らぬ
That game won't do with me―That cock won't fight.

content:
7. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 調子に乗る
to let oneself go―let oneself loose―be elated with success―be intoxicated with success
彼は調子に乗りやすい
He is apt to let himself loose―apt to be intoxicated with success.
成功して調子に乗っている
He is intoxicated with success―Success has turned his head.
相談に乗る
to entertain a proposal
彼はなかなか相談に乗らない
He will have nothing to do with my proposal.
人の話に乗る
to enter into one's views―enter into a scheme
彼は人の話に乗って財産を無くした
He entered into a scheme and lost his property.
おだてに乗る
to yield to flattery
彼はなかなかおだてに乗らぬ
He is proof against flattery.
口車に乗る
to be cajoled―be wheedled
はやりに乗る
to follow the fashion―bow the knee to Baal
鹿肉は油が乗っている
Venison is in grease―in the prime of grease―in the pride of grease.
仕事に気が乗る(油が乗る)
to warm to one's work
仕事に気が乗らぬ
I have no heart for my work.
話に気が乗る(興が乗る)
to warm up to one's subject
そんなうまい話なら僕も一口乗ろう
I will take a share in such a promising scheme.
僕の唄は三味線に乗らぬ(糸に乗らぬ)
My song does not go to the samisen.
この脚本は板に乗らぬ
The play can not be put on the stage―The play can not be staged―The play does not stage well.

content:
のるかそるか〔伸るか反るか〕
〈副〉Sink or swim; neck or nothing

content.content: のるかそるか一つやってみよう
Sink or swim, I will try―I will take my chance―take the chances―chance it―take the risks―risk it.

content:
のれる〔乗れる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=乗せる)to seat (so many)

content.content: この自動車は四人乗れる
This car can seat four.

content: 2. (=乗ることができる)can ride (a bicycle)

content.content: 君は馬に乗れるか
Can you ride?
自転車にも乗れる
I can ride a bicycle.

content: 3. (=汽車などに間に合う)to catch (a train)

content.content: 急行に乗れたか
Did you catch the express?
乗れなかった
I missed it.

content:
のれん〔暖簾〕
〈名〉
1. A shop-curtain

content.content: 彼を攻撃するのは暖簾に腕押しだ
To attack such a man would be a waste of labour.

content: 2. (=店の株)the goodwill (of a firm)

content.content: 暖簾を売る
to sell the goodwill of a firm―sell out (a business)
暖簾を買う
to buy the goodwill of a firm―buy out a business
暖簾を分けてやる
to set one up in business
年期を勤め上げて主人から暖簾を分けて貰いました
After I served out my time, my master set me up in business.

content: 3. (=店の体面)the credit (of a house)

content.content: 店の暖簾を汚す
to injure the credit of the house
この店は暖簾をよごしたことが無い
The house was never known but to its credit.
そんなことをしては店の暖簾にかかわる
Such conduct would concern the credit of the house.

content:
のろい
〈形〉
1. (=遅い)Slow; tardy:(綺麗に言えば)deliberate

content.content: この汽車はのろい
This train goes slow.
君は足がのろい
You are slow of foot―a slow walker.
あの人は仕事がのろい
He is a slow worker.
うちの人はのろくて困ります
My husband is too deliberate.
彼はのろい代りに間違いが無い
He is slow but sure.

content: 2. (=鈍い)dull; obtuse

content.content: あの男はのろいように見えてもなかなか抜け目が無い
He appears to be dull, but is quite shrewd.

content: 3. (=女にのろい)spooney (on girls); susceptible (to female charms)

content.content: 西洋人は女にのろい
Foreigners are susceptible to female charms.

のろい〔呪い〕
〈名〉A curse; a malediction; imprecation; execration

content:
のろう〔呪う〕
〈他動〉To curse (a man); to pronounce a curse on (a man); to imprecate evil upon (a man); to wish (one) evil:(自動詞に用いれば)to execrate

content.content: あの学校は多くの人に呪われている
Many people wish that school evil.
彼は成功したために多くの人に呪われている
His success has raised him many evilwishers.
人を呪わば穴二つ
“Curses come home to roost”―“A curse cuts both ways”―“Harm watch, harm catch.”
呪われたる国
a devoted land
呪われたる人
a doomed man

content:
のろけ〔惚気〕
〈名〉A story of one's love affairs:(=る) to talk about one's love affairs; to boast of one's conquests

content.content: さんざんのろけを聞かされた
I had to listen to the story of his conquests ad nauseam.
彼は手放しでのろける
He makes a boast of his conquests.
君はきわどいところでのろける
You fly off at a tangent to your favourite topic.
あの人ののろけには閉口だ
His sweet stories beat me.
惚気賃
a fine for talking about one's amours
のろけ相手
a confidant―(は男、女なら)―a confidante

content:
のろし〔狼煙〕
〈名〉A rocket; a signal-fire; a beacon

content.content: のろしを揚げる
to fire a rocket―light a signal-fire―show a beacon

content:
のろのろ
〈副〉Slowly; sluggishly; at a snail's pace:(綺麗に言えば)deliberately:(=する) to be slow; to be deliberate

content.content: あの男は何をさせてものろのろしている
He is a slow worker―a deliberate worker.
いつものろのろ歩いている
He is always loitering on his way.
工事がのろのろ進む
The works progress at a snail's pace.

content:
のろま〔野呂間〕
〈名〉A dunce; a dullard; a dolt; a slow coach; a stick-in-the-mud:(=な) dull; stupid; obtuse; slow; stick-in-the-mud

content.content: あの男はのろまだ
He is a slow coach―a stick-in-the-mud.
彼はのろまでいつも機会をはずす
He is so slow that he always misses his chance―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His slowness always loses him his chance.

のわき〔野分き〕
〈名〉A wintry blast

content:
のんき〔呑気〕
〈形〉Free from care; care-free (existence); careless (life); easy (life); easy-going (man); thoughtless (existence, etc.)

content.content: 学生生活は呑気だ
Student life is free from care.
独身は呑気で好い
A bachelor's is a care-free existence―a careless life.
呑気に構える
to take things easy
君は呑気過ぎる
You take things too easy.
彼は落第しても呑気なものだ
He takes his failure quite easily.
呑気に暮らす
to lead a careless life―live an easy life
彼は田舎へ引込んで呑気に暮らしている
He lives an easy life in his country retreat.
田舎の人は刺戟が無いから呑気だ
Country-people are free from care owing to want of stimulus.
あれは呑気な人だ
He is an easy-going man―easily contented with anything.
明日食う米が無くとも呑気なものだ
He takes no thought for the morrow―He is thoughtless of the future.
彼は試験を前に控えて呑気に遊んでいる
He idles his time away carelessly, with an examination before him.
晦日を知らずにいるとは君もずいぶん呑気だね
You take things easy not to know the end of the month.
呑気なことを言っているね
How easy you take things!
そんな呑気なことを言っておられん
I can't afford to take things so easy.

のんだくれ〔飲んだくれ〕
〈名〉A drunkard; a sot

content:
のんだりくったり〔飲んだり食ったり〕
〈名〉Eating or drinking:(=する) to eat and drink; to refresh oneself; to take refreshments

content.content: 彼らは飲んだり食ったりして日を暮らしている
They pass their time in eating and drinking.
彼は飲んだり食ったりして金を使ってしまう
He spends all his money in food and drink.

content:
のんでかかる〔呑んでかかる〕
〈他動〉To make light of (anything); to hold (one's man) in the hollow of one's hand

content.content: 演説をする時は聴衆を呑んでかからなけりゃいけない
A speaker should make little of his audience―hold his audience in the hollow of his hand.

content:
のんびり
〈副〉Free from care:(=する) to feel relieved

content.content: 仕事が片づいて気がのんびりする
It is a relief to have my work off my hands.
試験がすんで気がのんびりする
Now that the examination is over, I feel much relieved.
我が家へ帰って洋服を脱いで浴衣に着換えると気がのんびりする
To come home and change my foreign clothes for a yukata, gives me much relief.
久しぶりで野原へ出ると気がのんびりする
The sight of an open field relieves the eye after a long confinement in the city.
彼は富貴の家に生まれてのんびり生い立った
He was born rich, and grew up free from all care.

のんべ〔飲んべ〕
〈名〉A drunkard; a sot

content:
のんべんだらり
〈名〉Dawdlingly

content.content: のんべんだらりと日を暮らす
to dawdle one's time away

content:
は〔歯〕
〈名〉
1. A tooth (複数―teeth)

content.content: 歯が生える
to cut one's teeth―teethe
この子は歯が生えるところだ
The child is cutting its teeth―teething.
もう歯が生えた
It has cut its teeth.
歯がまだ生えそろわぬ
It has not cut all its teeth yet.
歯が欠ける
A tooth breaks―to break a tooth―(欠けて無くなるの意味なら)―lose one's teeth
(老人は)歯が欠けてしまった
His teeth are all gone.
歯が抜ける
A tooth comes out.
歯を抜く
to extract a tooth―draw a tooth―pull out a tooth
この歯は抜かなければならぬ
You must have this tooth extracted―have this tooth drawn―have this tooth pulled out.
歯に物がはさまる
Something gets in between one's teeth.
(楊枝で)歯をくじる
to pick one's teeth (with a toothpick)
(楊枝で)歯を磨く
to clean one's teeth (with a tooth-brush)
歯が痛む
My teeth ache―I have a toothache.
寒くて歯がガタガタする
My teeth chatter with cold.
怖くて歯の根が合わなかった
My teeth chattered for fear.
歯が浮く
My teeth are set on edge.
酸ッぱい果物を見たばかりでも歯が浮く
The mere sight of sour fruits set my teeth on edge.
鉄と石ときしると歯の浮くような音がする
Iron grates against stone―grides against stone―jars against stone.
歯の浮く音
a grating sound―a griding sound―a jarring sound―a strident sound
あの人は歯の浮くような英語を使う
He speaks intolerable English―insufferable English.
歯を喰いしばる
to clench one's teeth―set one's teeth
歯を喰いしばって我慢した
I bore it with set teeth.
歯を噛む
to grind one's teeth―gnash one's teeth
歯をむき出す
to show one's teeth―show one's ivories―grin
歯を染める
to dye one's teeth―blacken one's teeth
歯をうめる
to plug a tooth―(うめて貰うの意味なら)―have a tooth plugged
金歯
a gold-plugged tooth
歯を入れる
to put in a false tooth―(入れて貰うの意味なら)―have a false tooth put in
入れ歯
a false tooth―an artificial tooth
歯の跡
an impression left by teeth
あの人は歯が白い
He has white teeth―ivory teeth.
歯に合わぬ
(原意は)It is too hard for my teeth.
この本はお歯に合うまい
This book is too hard for you―beyond your reach.
この品はお歯に合うまい
The article is too dear for you―too expensive for you―beyond your reach.
歯が立つ、歯が立たぬ
(原意は)I can get your teeth into it―I can hot get my teeth into it, it is so hard.
この問題には歯が立たない
This problem is too hard for me.
あの男には歯が立たない
He is too much for me―I am no match for him.
歯を見せる
(原意は)to show one's teeth
白い歯を見せる
to show one's good nature
あんな奴には歯を見せるとつけ上がる
You must be severe with such fellows, or they will presume upon your good nature.
歯に衣を着せる
to mince matters
歯に衣を着せずに素直に言おう
I will not mince matters―I will speak my mind.

content: 3. (=物の歯)the teeth (of a comb, a saw, a rake); the teeth or cogs (of a gearwheel); the skids or supports (of an ashida)

content.content: この櫛は歯が細かい、歯が荒い
This comb has fine teeth―coarse teeth.

content:
は〔刃〕
〈名〉The edge (of a knife, etc.)

content.content: 剃刀は刃が鋭利だ
The razor has a keen edge―a fine edge.
剃刀のような鋭利な刃
a razor-edge
鈍い刃
a dull edge―a blunt edge
刃がまくれる
The edge is dulled―The edge is blunted.
そんな物を切ると小刀の刃がまくれてしまう
You will dull (the edge of) the knife―blunt (the edge of) the knife―if you try it on such things.
刀の刃がこぼれる
The edge of a sword gets nicked.
刃がところどころこぼれている
The edge is nicked in places.
刀に刃を付ける
to give an edge to―put an edge on―a sword

content:
は〔端〕
〈名〉
1. (=端数)a fraction

content.content: 端を切捨てる
to omit fractions
端を切捨てて三千
3,000 in round numbers

content: 2. (=はし)the edge (of a surface); the outline, the contour (of a mountain, etc.)

content.content: 月が山の端を出る
The moon comes out from behind a mountain.
月が山の端に入る
The moon goes down behind a mountain.

content:
は〔覇〕
〈名〉Ascendancy; supremacy; hegemony

content.content: 覇を争う
to contend for supremacy
覇を称える
to gain the ascendency―assume the hegemony
天下に覇たり
He reigned supreme over the land―She reigns supreme over the world.

content:
は〔派〕
〈名〉A party (of politicians); a sect (of Buddhists); a school (of philosophers); a section (of a party);(議会の何々派)an interest

content.content: 工業派
the manufacturing interest
写実派
the realistic school
派が違う
They belong to different schools.
一派を立てる
to form a sect―found a school

content:
は〔葉〕
〈名〉
1. A leaf:(尖った草の葉)a blade:(麦などの葉)a spear:(海草、しだのように茎を兼ねた葉)a frond:(木の葉を総称すれば)leafage; foliage

content.content: 植物の葉は動物の肺である
The leaves are to the plant what the lungs are to the animal.
葉を取ってしまうと木が枯れる
If a tree is denuded of its leaves, it will die.
秋は木の葉が落ちる
Trees shed their leaves in autumn.
落葉樹は今葉が出ている
The deciduous trees are now in leaf.
楓は葉が好い
The maple has a beautiful foliage.
植木屋はこれを葉ものと言う
The gardener calls it a foliage tree.
木の葉が繁っている
The trees have a luxuriant leafage.
葉の繁った木
a leafy tree
草の葉一本でも不思議でないものは無い
A blade of grass is a mystery.
根も葉も無い話だ
The story is groundless―unfounded.
根掘り葉掘り聞く人だ
He is an inquisitive person.
根を絶ち葉を枯らす
to destroy anything root and branch

content:
ば〔場〕
〈名〉
1. (=場所)room; space; ground; a place; a spot; a scene

content.content: 場を取る
to take up room―occupy much space
まだ入る場があるか
Is there room for more?
現場で
on the spot―on the ground―on the scene
猟場
a hunting-ground―(私有なら)―a preserve―(漁猟場なら)―fishing-grounds
逃げ場
a place of refuge―a place of safety
隠れ場
a hiding-place
晴れの場
a public place―a public occasion
その場で
on the spot―then and there
その場で殴ってやった
I thrashed him on the spot.
下手人はその場でつかまった
The murderer was arrested on the spot.
その場で理由を問えばよかったに
You should have demanded the reason then and there.

content: 2. (=芝居の何の場)a scene

content.content: 別れの場
a parting scene
愁嘆場
a pathetic scene
ヨーロッパは修羅場と化した
Europe was turned into a scene of deadly strife and bloodshed.

content: 3. (=芝居などの席)a seat; a place

content.content: 場を取っておく
to book a seat―take a place―(興行者の方で言えば)―reserve a seat for one

content: 4. (=活動の場)a field; a stage; a theatre; an arena; a scene of action

content.content: 活動の場
a field of activity―a theatre of activity―a stage to play on
競争の場
the arena of competition―the lists
その場に臨んで苦情を言いだした
He began to complain on the scene of action.

content: 5. (=取引所の場)market

content.content: 前場
the morning market
後場
the afternoon market

content:
6. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 気を利かして場をはずした
I took the hint, and kept out of the way―I took care to be out of the way.
その場をごまかす
to save appearances
その場をのがれる
to effect one's retreat―make good one's escape
この場限りの話だ
This is between ourselves―It shall go no further―Nobody will be the wiser.
その場の目的を達する
to gain one's end
この場に及んで逃げ出すとは卑怯だ
It is cowardly to beat a retreat at the last moment.
その場はどうか治まった
The matter was settled for the occasion.
けんかはその場限りさ
You should forgive and forget―“Let not the sun go down upon your wrath.”
その場限りの事を言う人だから当てにならぬ
He is not to be depended upon, for he will speak on impulse―speak on the spur of the moment.

content:
バー
〈名〉A bar

content.content: バーの女給
a barmaid

content:
ばあい〔場合〕
〈名〉Case; event; occasion; circumstances:(稀には)time; season; place; day; hour; moment; juncture

content.content: この規則の適用されぬ場合がある
There are cases where―occasions when―the rule does not hold true.
この場合には適用されぬ
It does not apply to this case.
日本人なら死ぬような場合に西洋人は逃げる
A foreigner flies where a Japanese would die―when a Japanese would die.
場合が違う
The cases are different.
失敗した場合には死ぬまでのことさ
In case we fail,―In case of failure,―In the event of failure,―we can but die.
必要の場合には金を借りてもさし支えない
You may borrow money in case of necessity.
必要の場合に借りた金だ
The money was borrowed under circumstances of necessity.
こういう場合にはどうすればよいものか
How should one act in such cases?―on such occasions?―under such circumstances?
場合によっては嘘をついてもよいものか
Is it allowable to tell a lie in some cases?―on some occasions?―under certain circumstances?
どんな場合にも決してうそをつくものでない
In no case―On no occasion―Under no circumstances―should one tell a lie.
これをするもあれをするも場合次第だ
You may do this or that as the case may be―as the occasion may demand.
場合次第にする(臨機応変の処置をとる)
You may act according to circumstances―act as the case may demand.
それは時と場合だ
That depends on circumstances.
この場合だから、ぜひお待ちを願わなければならなぬ
Under these circumstances, I must request you to wait.
あの場合、場合が場合だから引くにも引かれなかった
I was in for it under the circumstances.
非常な場合には非常な手段を要する
We must take exceptional measures in exceptional cases―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Exceptional circumstances necessitate exceptional measures.
必死の場合に手段を選んでいられない
We can not be scrupulous about the means under desperate circumstances.
この大事の場合に彼が死んだのはいかにも残念だ
His death at this moment―at this juncture―is deeply to be regretted.
いざ鎌倉という場合にこんな人間は役に立たぬ
Such men are useless in case of need―in time of need―in case of emergency―in an emergency―in the day of trouble―in the hour of danger.
いざという場合にそんなものは間に合わぬ
Such things are useless in the moment of action.
すわという場合に訓練があると無いでは違う
Training tells in the moment of peril.
このしゃれは場合はずれだ
The joke is out of season―out of place.

ばあいはずれ〔場合外れ〕
〈形〉(To be) out of place, out of season, unseasonable, inopportune, malaprops

content:
ばあさん〔婆さん〕
〈名〉An old woman

content.content: お婆さんは若い綺麗な人の引立役
An old woman serves as a foil to the young and pretty.
お婆さんのおしゃれ
She persists in blooming into the midst of winter.

content:
はあたり〔歯当り〕
〈名〉Toothsomeness

content.content: パンの皮は歯当たりが好い
Bread-crust is toothsome.

content:
ばあたり〔場当たり〕
〈名〉A gag; stage-effect; a claptrap

content.content: 文士は場当たりをやる
Men of letters strive after effect.
彼の政策は場当りが多い
His policies are calculated for effect.
気の利いた政治家はそんな下らない場当たりはやらぬ
A respectable politician will not resort to such claptraps.

ばあや〔婆や〕
〈名〉An old woman-servant; an old nurse; an old housekeeper

はあり〔羽蟻〕
〈名〉A winged ant

content:
はい
〈応答詞〉
1. Yes (sir)
2. (=点呼に対しては)here (sir); present (sir)
3.

content.content: はい、上げるよ
Here it is―There you are.
はいはい言う
to be at one's beck
彼ははいはい言ってよく用を達す
He is at my beck and call.
何事もはいはいと言ってしたことの無い奴だ
He never obeys me at once.

content:
はい〔灰〕
〈名〉Ashes

content.content: 東京に灰が降ったことがある
Once ashes fell in Tokyo.

〈名〉The abolition of licenced prostitution

content.content: 廃娼運動
a prostitution-abolition movement―a purification campaign
廃娼論を唱える
to advocate the abolition of licenced prostitution

content:
ばいしょう〔賠償〕
〈名〉Compensation; indemnification; reparation; restitution:(=する) to compensate, indemnify (one for a loss); to compensate (for), repair, make good, make up for, make amends for, make reparation for (a loss); to make restitution

content.content: 君が損をしたなら賠償する
I will compensate you for any loss you may sustain.
損の賠償として千円出す
I will pay you 1000 yen in compensation for your loss.
損害を賠償する
to compensate one for damages―make reparation for damages―make restitution
損害賠償
compensation for damages―reparation for damages―restitution
損害賠償の訴訟を起こす
to sue for damages―prosecute for damages
一万円賠償の訴訟を提起する
to file a 10,000 yen suit (against some one)
損害賠償の訴訟
an action for damages

content:
ばいじょう〔陪乗〕
〈名〉Attendance in the same carriage

content.content: 侍従長の御陪乗あり
The Grand Chamberlain attends on His Majesty in the Imperial carriage―His Majesty is attended in the carriage by the Grand Chamberlain.

ばいしょうきん〔賠償金〕
〈名〉An indemnity:(法廷で要求すれば) damages

content:
ばいしょうふ〔売笑婦〕
〈名〉An unlicenced prostitute; a street-walker; a woman of the streets

content.content: 売笑婦をする
to go on the streets

content:
ばいしょく〔陪食〕
〈名〉Dining with the Emperor

content.content: 御陪食仰付{おおせつ}けらる
You are commanded to dine with his Majesty.

はいしん〔背信〕
〈名〉Breach of faith; perfidy:(=する) to break faith (with an ally, etc.)

はいしん〔背進〕
〈名〉A countermarch; a retreat:(=する) to countermarch; to retreat:(船なら)to go astern; to make sternway

はいじん〔廃人〕
〈名〉A disabled person; a cripple

ばいしん〔梅信〕
〈名〉The tidings of plum-blossoms; the first notice of spring

content:
ばいしん〔陪審〕
〈名〉Trial by jury

content.content: 陪審制度
the jury system

ばいしん〔陪臣〕
〈名〉(直参に対し)a rear-vassal

content:
ばいしんかん〔陪審官〕
〈名〉A jury(は十二人よりなる):(の一人) a juryman; a juror

content.content: 陪審官になる
to serve on a jury―sit on a jury
陪審官が有罪(無罪)の裁決をする
The jury brings in ［returns］ a verdict of ［not］ guilty.
陪審長
the foreman of the jury

ばいしんさいばん〔陪審裁判〕
〈名〉Trial by jury

ばいしんせいど〔陪審制度〕
〈名〉The jury system

content:
はいすい〔排水〕
〈名〉
1. (=水を流し出すこと)drainage:(=する) to drain (a place); to drain off the water

content.content: 排水盆地
a drainage-basin

content: 2. (=水を押し退けること)displacement:(=する) to displace (so many tons of water)

content.content: 排水トン数
displacement tonnage
この船の排水は一万トン
The ship displaces 10,000 tons.

はいすい〔配水〕
〈名〉Distribution of water:(=する) to distribute water

はいすいち〔配水池〕
〈名〉A reservoir; a distributing reservoir
